Dear all,

The mode of the quiz has been changed from Offline to Online due to the
unavailability of classrooms. Therefore if anyone who hasn't registered
yet, wishes to participate in the quiz, please register by 6PM today by
filling the form I had sent earlier. Further details will be sent to the
newly registered participants shortly after 6 PM.

Regards
Kartik Gopa Kumar
Secretary, Qriosity

> Warm Greetings,

> Qriosity is back with yet another quiz, this time, the *General Quiz. *You
> may be good at a particular topic but how good are you at all topics
> *combined* ? This quiz will be intended to gauge exactly that. It will be
> conducted on *Saturday, 15th October in Nila Campus*. It will be a *duo*
> quiz and will consist of *2 rounds* as is customary. Also, please note
> that this quiz will also play a role in the *Inter IIT Quiz Team
> selections*, the top performers in the quiz will be shortlisted for the
> team. Further information will be provided in the upcoming days.
>
> Club leaderboard points will also be awarded as follows:
>
> 1st: 100 points
> 2nd: 80 points
> 3rd: 60 points
> Other finalist(s): 35 points
> Honorable mentions: 25 points
> All other participants: 20 points
>
> To register yourself for the quiz, kindly fill the form below.
>
> https://forms.gle/ZmNYf5GnDLzib8A19
>
> Registration deadline will be till the commencement of the quiz, however
> for updates like quiz venue and timings, please make sure to fill the form
> preferably by *11:59 PM (midnight), 14th October.*
>
> Looking forward to seeing a large number of participants.
>
> Regards
> Kartik Gopa Kumar

*****************************************************

Warm Greetings,

Qriosity is back with yet another quiz, this time, the *General Quiz. *You
may be good at a particular topic but how good are you at all topics
*combined* ? This quiz will be intended to gauge exactly that. It will be
conducted on *Saturday, 15th October in Nila Campus*. It will be a *duo*
quiz and will consist of *2 rounds* as is customary. Also, please note that
this quiz will also play a role in the *Inter IIT Quiz Team selections*,
the top performers in the quiz will be shortlisted for the team. Further
information will be provided in the upcoming days.

Club leaderboard points will also be awarded as follows:

1st: 100 points
2nd: 80 points
3rd: 60 points
Other finalist(s): 35 points
Honorable mentions: 25 points
All other participants: 20 points

To register yourself for the quiz, kindly fill the form below.

https://forms.gle/ZmNYf5GnDLzib8A19

Registration deadline will be till the commencement of the quiz, however
for updates like quiz venue and timings, please make sure to fill the form
preferably by *11:59 PM (midnight), 14th October.*

Looking forward to seeing a large number of participants.

Regards
Kartik Gopa Kumar
Secretary, Qriosity

Dear All

I am sending you New shedule for Badminton selection turnament.
Please be on time


*Note*:
1. Only Non-Marking shoes are allowed in the Court.
2. Players should bring their Non-marking Shoes and Badminton Rackets.
3. We have given time slots for each match. Players should be present in
court at least 30 minutes prior to their slot.
4. Players who want to have lunch in Nila Mess have to bring their own food
Tokens from Ahalia mess.
5. Ahilea Students Should take 9:00 Bus.

Thankyou

*****************************************************

Greetings everyone,

We will have our first badminton selection tournament on 15 and 16 of
October, 2022 to form the Inter IIT Badminton team. We will have an opening
ceremony on October 15th at 7:00 a.m during which we will brief on the
selection procedures.
Currently there will be two rounds:
Round-1: 15th October
Round-2: 16th October

Match Fixtures and Time slots for round-1 are attached to the mail and
round-2 fixtures will be shared after completion of Round-1. Players coming
from Ahalia can take following shuttles:

For Morning slots:
     Tempo at 7:00am
     Bus at 8:00 am
For Afternoon slots:
    Bus at 2:00pm
    tempo at 3:00pm
Players should check their respective slots and board the bus accordingly.

*Note*:
1. Only Non-Marking shoes are allowed in the Court.
2. Players should bring their Non-marking Shoes and Badminton Rackets.
3. We have given time slots for each match. Players should be present in
court at least 30 minutes prior to their slot.
4. Players who want to have lunch in Nila Mess have to bring their own food
Tokens from Ahalia mess.
Regards,
Alok Singh
International Kabaddi Player & SAI Gold Medalist Coach
physical Training Instructor
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad


*****************************************************

Dear all,

Please find below details about an online symposium on "Meteoroids, Meteors
and Meteorites Messenger from space"
Spac

***********************************************************************************************
Dear Sir,

Physical Research Laboratory, Ahmedabad, India is organizing a Planetary
Science Symposium on “Meteoroids, Meteors and Meteorites Messenger from
Space” (MetMeSS-2022) during November 17-18, 2022. In view of the current
pandemic situation, the symposium will be on online mode.

This symposium is being organized by Planetary Laboratory Analyses
Sections (PLAS) of Planetary Science Division, Physical Research
Laboratory (PRL), Ahmedabad. PRL is the cradle of Space Sciences in India
and has a long association of pioneering work in Meteoritics,
Cosmochemistry and Planetary Sciences. Thereof, this symposium will create
an excellent opportunity to present and discuss the fundamental research
and frontier areas in Planetary Sciences.

Find the Flyer of the symposium as attached.

Kindly circulate the same to the researchers, post-doctoral, doctoral and
graduate students in your organisation for gracious and active
participation in the symposium.

We are expecting to begin the Symposium Registration on October 1, 2022
onward.

Thanking you.

Yours sincerely,

On Behalf of Organizing Committee



-- 


-- 
K V Biju
Technical Officer | IIT Palakkad
Ahalia Integrated Campus | Kozhippara PO | Palakkad Dist | Kerala 678557
Call: +91-4923 226 309/390
GSM:+91-9497718136/8281112815 | Email:kvbiju@iitpkd.ac.in
<kvbiju@iitpkd.ac.in>
https://iitpkd.ac.in/people/biju <http://iitpkd.ac.in>


-- 
Uma Divakaran
Assistant Professor (Physics) and
Associate Dean (Academics, PG),
IIT Palakkad

An Institution of National Importance - IIT Roorkee



[  ]

<https://eventing.coursera.-MjAyMi0xMC0xMCIsImNhbXBhaWduR3JvdXAiOiJoRXFHc0VpZkVlMnpoQ1VMSXZ0QmR3IiwibGlua3MiOltdfX0sInVzZXJJZCI6NTk5NDczNTN9.1tsbLCBIQoqVmTH6Oozw7_RFZtYd9AzffM6ExvJA_5Y>

 

Indian Institute of Technology - Roorkee is among the foremost institutes 

of national importance in higher technological education, engineering & 

research. It has also been considered a trend-setter in the area of 

education and research in the field of science, technology, and 

engineering.



What makes IIT Roorkee special?





        * Experienced Faculty: The faculty at IIT Roorkee offers a unique

          mix of communication research and industrial training activities

          with the Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering.



        * Postgraduate Certificates: offered by IIT Roorkee allow you to

          quickly develop industry-relevant skills and enhance your

          professional portfolio.



        * Institute Ranking: - IIT Roorkee is ranked sixth among the

          engineering colleges by the National Institutional Ranking

          Framework, 2021. It has now completed more than 170 years of its

          existence and is an “Institution of National Importance”.





Enrolments closing soon. Last few spots left!

Dear Santosh,



Greetings from the LTI SPARK – Campus Recruitment Team.

LTI (NSE: LTI) is a global technology consulting and digital solutions
Company helping more than 495 clients succeed in a converging world. With
operations in 33 countries, we go the extra mile for our clients and
accelerate their digital transformation journeys.

As we power LTI through next phase of growth, we are strengthening our
talent for future to capitalize on the opportunities ahead of us and
further enhance the value we deliver to all stakeholders. In line to this
purpose, please find the attached Job Description and Eligibility criteria
for 2023 Batch Premier Technical Campus hiring. Join us as we build the
future talent of tomorrow.

**Kindly share the interested candidate details in the attached sheet for
further screening process.

Compensation - B.Tech 9LPA & M.Tech 9.5LPA

Selection Process
                   - Online Test (Aptitude Test + Communication Assessment
+ Coding Stimulation +Technical Assessment)
                   - Technical & HR Interviews









Mandatory documents to be carried in person for HR interview.

   1. Photograph
   2. Aadhar Card
   3. 10th, 12th marksheets, UG/PG Pursuing degree semester wise marksheets
   (till date) issued by institute.



*Please do get back to us with convenient slot/date to organise the
recruitment process at your institute. Upon Confirmation we shall finalize
the date.*



Team LTI wishes you and your esteemed institution the very best for a
successful campus season 2023!

Let’s Ignite the Spark, Let’s Solve

Dear Team,

Greeting from C-DAC!

Centre for Development of Advanced Computing is a Premier R&D organization
of the Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY) to carry
out R&D in ICT, Electronics & Associated Domains. *www.cdac.in
<http://www.cdac.in/>*

C-DAC is planning to conduct campus recruitment for hiring efficient
graduates/post graduates from your institute.

*Details of the position offered is as follows:*

*Name of the Post*                 :  Knowledge Associates

*Classification*                         :  Contractual on consolidated pay

*Initial Contract Period*         :  3 years (Renewable based on
performance/need)

*Min. CGPA score*                 :  6.0 or above

*Starting Pay (Annual CTC)*   :  For B.Tech – 8.5 Lakhs approx.

                                                   For M.Tech – 9.18 Lakhs
approx.

                                                   For Ph.D – 9.87 Lakhs
approx.

*The indicative expertise areas and skills required for selection provided
in the attached sheet.*


*Students from the branches mentioned in the attached sheet and allied
branches are eligible to apply.*


*You are requested to provide the following:*

(i)        Students profile based on the criteria mentioned above and in
the attached format. Students can apply for multiple centres/locations.

(ii)       Tentative dates to conduct the campus interviews.

(iii)      Any other formality to be completed by us.


Please note that in view of the shortage of time, we would be selecting
from few institutes at the discretion of C-DAC from those who are
confirming, on a first come first serve basis.

The interviews will be conducted online.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Outreach EECS <outreach.eecs@iisc.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Oct 13, 2022 at 11:45 AM
Subject: Request to Connect With Your Students | From EECS, IISc Bangalore
To: albert@iitpkd.ac.in <albert@iitpkd.ac.in>


Dear Colleague,



I hope my email finds you doing well. I am writing to you on behalf of the
Dean, EECS, IISc Bangalore <https://eecs.iisc.ac.in/departments/>. EECS
Division consists of 4 different departments
<https://eecs.iisc.ac.in/departments/> focusing on a large number of
research areas such as Micro/Nanoelectronics, SP/Comm, AI, Neuromorphic,
Power Electronics, Robotics, IoT, Quantum
Computing/Communication/Sensing/Photonics, Deep Learning, Theoretical
Computer Science, Computer Systems & Software, Intelligent Systems,
Computational Electromagnetics, Virtual Reality, Cyber-Physical Systems,
5G/6G Communication, etc.



The purpose of this personal note is to seek your help to connect to the
final and pre-final year students and immediate graduates of your institute
from departments/programs related to ECE/EE/CS. We are embarking on several
new programs in IISc, which require us to boost our Ph.D. intake
significantly. Studies have indicated that students often do not get
first-hand exposure to opportunities in India. This leads to many leaving
India to search for Ph.D. opportunities elsewhere. In addition, students
are often unaware of the opportunities post-Ph.D. Besides, there are also
several misconceptions about Ph.D. *We wish to change this by directly
engaging with students. In this direction, we want to host a session on
Oct. 27th (details will be shared with students who register) in which we
wish to engage with students across the country and walk them through (1)
Global opportunities, in general, post-Ph.D. in India, (2) Why one should
do Ph.D., (3) Who should peruse Ph.D., and in the end (4) Ph.D.
opportunities in EECS (ECE/EE/CS), IISc Bangalore. As we gather experience,
we will offer more such sessions in the future.*



Through this exercise, we also wish to reach out to economically/socially
underprivileged students. This will help us to understand their
apprehensions, if any, towards Ph.D. and how we can address this to
encourage every talented student to embark on a Ph.D. journey, independent
of their societal/economic background. We will also discuss the private
fellowships (over and above the Ph.D. stipend) available in EECS IISc, for
such students.



We hope you will agree that we are embarking on a challenging task, which
will be difficult without your help. Keeping this in mind, *may we seek
your support to help us connect with your students by forwarding/sharing
this email with your immediate graduates and students in the
final/pre-final years of your B-Tech/Dual-Degree/M-Tech programs under
ECE/EE/CS areas. It would be helpful if your students could fill out this
google form before Oct. 21st to register for the online event (2 Hrs) on
Oct. 27th: https://forms.gle/8VX3vJV24AY7D39g8
<https://forms.gle/8VX3vJV24AY7D39g8> *



I appreciate any help you can provide. We look forward to
meeting/interacting with your students. If you have any suggestions, please
reply to this email.





Best regards

---

Prof. Mayank Shrivastava

*On behalf of the EECS Outreach Team & Dean, EECS *

Division of Electrical, Electronics, and Computer Science

Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore

Web: https://eecs.iisc.ac.in/

Dear Sir,



Greetings from TCS !



As discussed, we are kickstarting this year’s Research and Innovation
Hiring for TCS selected premium colleges. As a part of the process, request
you to share the details from below specified disciplines who are eligible
(as per the below given criteria) and are interested in applying for TCS
R&I role.



*Eligible Disciplines:*

   - *UG/PG engineering courses* with specializations *Computer Science,
   IT, ECE, EEE, Mathematics, Statistics* mainly
   - Additional courses included are *Bio Sciences / Biotechnology /
   Bioinformatics, Materials & Metallurgy, Chemical, and Aerospace Engineering*

*Eligibility Criteria:*
The TCS Eligibility Criteria as mentioned in the Normal TCS Technical
Campus recruitment Policy *(60% consistent)* is applicable to TCS Research
and Innovation hiring as well.



*Additionally*, for highest qualification, the below criteria should be met
by candidates to be eligible to appear for the TCS Research and Innovation
selection process.
*·        CGPA of 8 and above / Percentage of 80% *and above in the highest
qualification (as per the latest published results)
·        *No pending backlogs/arrears* at the time of selection process

*Expected CTC:*
The expected CTC ranges from * 9 **lpa** (UG candidates) to 11.3 **lpa (PG
candidates)*




Request your support as always. Please let me know incase of any
clarifications.



Also *attaching the JDs for reference.*







Thanks and Regards

Talent Acquisition Group- Kerala
TATA Consultancy Services
TCS Centre SEZ Unit,

India

Hello all,

Hope everyone had a refreshing vacation week. Following the positive
response for Boxing training classes, the PBM (Powerlifting - Bodybuilding
- Martial arts) club is excited to introduce the Wrestling training
sessions.

The first session for basics will be held on 12/10/22 (wednesday), evening
4pm to 5pm at Ahalia Gym(Hostel 3). The sessions will be tutored by Dr.
Swaroop Sahoo. The details of the following sessions will be communicated
to the participants via whatsapp. We request everyone to attend the classes
for having instilled the love of learning and to have a physically active
lifestyle.
[image: IMG-20221008-WA0012.jpg]

For further query please contact Vasanthan - 9500487768

Hustle and wrestle.

*****************************************************

Greetings from POD (formerly Calyxpod)

We are pleased to inform you that on popular demand across colleges we are
conducting *Skill Check Assessments for Final and Pre-Final Year Students*.
These assessments have been specially designed by industry experts who have
been involved with campus recruitments across 750+ companies over the last
15 years.

These assessments are meant to help measure the level of preparedness of
students for the upcoming job/internship opportunities. These assessments
have been specially designed keeping the software industry in mind.

Students will be provided with a detailed PDF report on their performance.
With the help of the same, they can decide which areas they should
concentrate on to prepare better for their career opportunities. Also, this
will also help students experience how they would have to give tests online
when companies visit their campuses. *A sample report is attached to the
email.*

We will also provide a consolidated report on the performance of all the
students based on which you can decide what areas you should conduct
training. *A sample report is attached to the email.*

We will be conducting the following assessments (all MCQ based) as part of
the same:

   1. *English, Logical, Quantitative - 75 mins*
   2. *Computer Programming - 90 mins *
   3. *Computer Fundamentals [Networking, Operating System, Database] - 90
   mins*

Process for conducting the assessments.

   - Assessments for your students will be conducted online. Assessments
   will be conducted free of cost.

Please find the confirmed schedule below for the Skill Check Assessments
for the 2023 & 2024 batch.

   - Start Date & Time
      - 14th October 2022 onwards 10:00 AM
   - End Date & Time
      - 17th October 2022 till 6:00 PM

Also, we have sent you the invite to log-in to the platform and for
students the sign up url is -  https://iitpkd.pod.ai/W7XMyC/sign-up .
Students can register using this link, and all the registrations will be
approved by 13th October EOD as we'll be doing it in bulk.

Please let me know in case of any queries, and students can reach us @
feedback@pod.ai or call us @ +91-11-41179695 (Monday to Friday 10:00 AM to
7:00 PM)

Vaibhav Singh
B.Tech Branch Coordinator,
Career Development Centre,
Indian Institute of Technology, Palakkad
Contact No: +91 8827501407
Email: 102001037@smail.iitpkd.ac.in

*****************************************************

*Phrasal Verbs Exercise*

Use the phrasal verbs listed below correctly, to replace the highlighted
(in bold) words in each sentence:

came about,  turn down, speak up, came into, came at, run over, go far, act
up, pick up on, passed away,


1. After a long battle with cancer the professor *died* yesterday.

2. After his father died he *inherited* a large fortune.

3. As I backed away the robber *attacked* me with a knife

4. Before we start work on the project, let's just *describe briefly* who
is expected to do what.

5. Can you tell me how the accident *happened*?

6. Careful! The leopard will *attack* your throat!

7. Children may *create trouble* in class in order to get attention.

8. Could you *lower the setting of the* volume of the music in the gym in
the morning hours? It is really loud and annoying

9. Could you please *talk more loudly*? I can't hear you with all the
traffic in the background

10. Did you *notice* his nervousness when we asked about the missing stuff?

Answers

(1) passed away, (2) came into, (3) came at, (4) run over, (5) came about,
(6) go far, (7) act up, (8) turn down, (9) speak up, (10) pick up on


regards, Sandhya
-- 
English Language Support & Services
IIT Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/elss

<Please read the email below CAREFULLY before clicking any LINK>

As part of the company's requirements, please take the following test for us to proceed with your application.

Disclaimer:
•        This email is sent to those who applied to Accenture Japan Ltd.
•        Please send an email to accenture@asiatojapan.com if you have received this e-mail in error.
•        For this exam, you can choose your favorite language from several options.

About the test:
・You will also be asked some general information about your background which we ask from all our candidates.
・Please follow the format specified for each question. If a question does not apply to you please input "N/A" instead of leaving it blank.

To ensure a smooth test:
・You are encouraged to read the steps to take the test after you received the test invitation. (https://help.tracks.run/ja/articles/2588087-steps-to-take-the-exam)
・A series of tutorial questions are prepared here to help each candidate to prepare for the test better. 
*Use the actual test link below, and find the link for the tutorial there (don't use the actual "Start Exam" button at the end of the page, that is for the actual test). You can try using a different browser if you encounter a problem with accessing it.
・You are encouraged to use the programming language that you are comfortable with within the list. (https://help.tracks.run/ja/articles/2411847-supported-programming-languages)
・Should you have problems accessing the test (content connectivity error), this may be due to the page's authentication. Please try using incognito or Firefox and see if the problem persists.
・You may direct your questions to accenture@asiatojapan.com (please refrain from contacting the track support team as it may take more time for them to answer your questions)

Reminders:
・Please try to find a quiet place wherein you will not be disturbed for the duration of the test
・Countermeasures against cheating and sharing of answers will be in place. Also, while not exactly cheating, IDEs do not work too well with the system and using one may affect your scoring. Please refrain from using an IDE during the test. Please believe in your own skills and answer the test to the best of your ability.
・Follow the schedule prescribed by your placement office to take the test and be sure to accomplish it until then.
・Please save a screenshot of your "Check System" results in case you run into a technical problem. Having this will allow us to help you faster.
・Please disable Google Translate in your browser before you start the test.

Thank you for your cooperation, and all the best!

## Exam Information

Exam : Accenture Japan - 2022 IIT Palakkad
Deadline : 2022-10-08 14:30 (GMT+09:00) Asia/Tokyo

## Steps to take exam

Take the exam from the following url.
https://app.tracks.run/abroad/exams/a4c5783696514ad79c89e1e7712b5e6d

- The exam timer will not start immediately. Please feel free to check the above link for more information about the exam (how long it will take, what kind of challenges there are, etc).

- Please note you cannot take the exam from a mobile browser. Please open it in a recent version of our supported desktop browsers.
  (Chrome, Firefox, Safari or Microsoft Edge)

- Feel free to try out a tutorial exam here:
  https://app.tracks.run/tutorial?lang=en

*****************************************************

Today, listen to this video <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cr4RYby4L6Q> to
revise some common phrasal verbs.

Use the phrasal words covered to fill in the blanks correctly:

1) I have been trying to ..........................regularly, but my
fondness for good cake is sabotaging my fitness goals.

2) It is a good idea to .......................... mistakes in a way that
does not demoralise the student

3) After the test it was possible to ...................... Covid.

4) The bag I used in college is so.............................. now, but I
still use it 'cos it's my favorite.

5) ......................! Watch where you step or you'll have mud on your
shoes.

Answers
1) work out
2) point out
3) rule out
4) worn out
5) Watch out!

regards, Sandhya
-- 
English Language Support & Services
IIT Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/elss


*****************************************************

Dear All,
Warm Greetings from the IAR Cell!
Hope you all are doing well.
With immense joy, we bring to you the 6th edition of our official
newsletter, Footprints.

We sincerely thank Mr. Deepu George Kurian for the Alumni article. I would
also like to thank Ms. Teena Roy, Ms. Sneha Laxmi Jayan, Mr. Anand Kumar
Sharma, Mr. Shrujan Kanabar and Mr. Abhishek Saran for contributing towards
the epigram section. We also would like to thank Mr. Aniket Singh Rajpoot
and Mr. Arjun for agreeing to be a part of the Footprints Interview.

I am sincerely grateful to Dr. Deepak Rajendraprasad and Mr. Samuel S, for
their undying support.
Special thanks to the Creative Content team who worked under me for their
diligent work and to Mr. Vaibhav Nagrale, the Design head, and his team for
designing numerous, beautiful posters and the newsletter you are about to
read and finally to the interviewers for giving us beautiful and exquisite
interviews. Lastly, I am grateful to Mr. Joel Jeffrey for his constant
encouragement.

PFA Footprints!

CS4150-M-2022 -> Forums -> Announcements -> Cases of plagiarism
https://lms.iitpkd.ac.in/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=522#p585
Cases of plagiarism
by Albert Sunny - Tuesday, 4 October 2022, 10:21 PM
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Over the past week, I have caught several cases of plagiarisms in labs 3, 4
and 5. In sprite of giving ample time (almost a week) to work in each labs
it is disheartening to see several of your resort to such unethical means.
While I encourage discussions to get a better understanding of the task at
hand, discussing or sharing codes is frowned upon. If you do not what is
plagiarism, have a look at
https://www.plagiarism.org/article/what-is-plagiarism [1]

If you are having difficulty understanding the questions, attend the Monday
afternoon sessions where the lab questions are discussed in detail. Do not
use lack of understanding as an excuse to pass off other's code as your
own. Several students say they plagiarized codes because of placements
tests / lack of time. This is a an unreasonable excuse. If you are pressed
for time and have other priorities, skip the lab for that week. It is a
better option than plagiarizing.

I hope you realize that an IDC action / fail grade in an S7 core course
would mean that you will have to stay back for one more year to complete
the course, and your plans for job / higher studies would be disrupted. So,
think well before you plagiarize again in my course!!!

Links:
------
[1] https://www.plagiarism.org/article/what-is-plagiarism

---------------------------------------------------------------------
This is a copy of a message posted in CS4150-M-2022.

Change your forum digest preferences:
https://lms.iitpkd.ac.in/mod/forum/index.php?id=82


*****************************************************

*Idioms*

In continuation to the mail sent out last week, here are some more idioms
that relate to money:

1. Break even

To neither gain nor lose money.

“The trip to Mysore cost me Rs40,000, but I almost broke even after winning
Rs35,000 as tech-contest prize money.”

2. Break the bank

To be very expensive.

“Taking a month-long vacation to be either in the hills or by a beach would
break the bank. There’s no way I could afford to do it right now.”

3. To be closefisted

Someone who doesn’t want to spend money. Similar to being stingy.

“Karishma is so closefisted, she won’t even contribute to buy snacks for
the proposed Diwali party.”

4. To go Dutch

Everyone pays for their own meal at a restaurant.

“We had our first date last evening and we went Dutch. I paid for my coffee
and she paid for her salad.”

5. Shell out money/to fork over money

To pay for something (usually expensive).

“I wish I didn’t buy that new car now that I’m shelling out Rs18,000 a
month in EMI payments.”

“She had to fork over a lot of money for traffic fines last month.”

regards, Sandhya

-- 
English Language Support & Services
IIT Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/elss

Dear Students

*1. Funding* :  Master's degree and an Internship in the English language,
Russian Government Scholarship Programme for the academic year 2023-2024 .
The Scholarship includes

   - Free tuition fees for the entire duration of the chosen program.
   - Maintenance allowance
   - Dormitory accommodation (based on availability)

2.* Language of instruction*:  One Masters program and an Internship are
offered in English

3. *Location* :
Reshetnev Siberian State University of Science and Technology (Reshetnev
University) is the first flagship university in Krasnoyarsk Region. It is
located in the city of Krasnoyarsk,Krasnoyarsk is a major educational
centre in Siberia, Located at *east-central Russia*. Nearest airports
are Krasnoyarsk
Cheremshanka Airport (41.8 KM from university ) and Krasnoyarsk
International Airport (43.3 km from University ).

4. *Ranking* :
#351-400 (EECA University Ranking )  (Emerging Europe & Central Asia Region
Ranking
<https://support.qs.com/hc/en-gb/articles/4403794652178-Emerging-Europe-Central-Asia-EECA-Region-Ranking>
).
Note:

   - Students can apply directly after discussing with the Faculty advisor
   and HoD.
   - Permission letter from Dean of Academic for going on Internship and
   one can apply directly for Masters program.
   - Refer attached Appendix 2 and 3 for Documents required and Application
   form respectively
   - *Last date of application is 15th October 2022.*



Thanks and Regards,

> Dear All,
>
> Achnet Technologies (Tescra Software), Job profile has been published on
> the CDC Portal. Go through the profile well and apply.
>
> The deadline for application is* 5 pm, 27 Sep 2022. *
>
> *Please keep this information strictly confidential from other peer
> institutes*, feel free to contact me for any clarification.
>
> *Mandatory conditions from Achnet. *
>
> 1.    Selected students will have to sign the bond agreement in the month
> of April 2023. Bond agreement hard copies will be shared to their mailing
> address and they have to sign along with 2 witnesses (should be their
> family members ONLY).
> 2.     Pre-Induction Training program for the selected students will
> start on 1st January 2023. The training is from Monday to Friday.
> No stipend during the training period
>
> The pre-induction training will be 1-2 hours weekly
>
>
>
>    - Pre-Induction-Program is a specially crafted program to help college
>    graduates learn to translate theoretical knowledge into practice.
>    - This program requires a 1-2 hr. weekly training session using Video
>    Conferencing.
>    - During the video conference, students will be taught new
>    tools/techniques and guidance for the professional world.
>    - During the video conference, students can resolve their queries and
>    doubts with the Mentor.
>    - They will be assigned projects after every session, which are
>    required to be submitted at a specified time.
>    - These small projects may require anywhere from 8hrs to 40 hrs of
>    effort, per project, from students.
>    - The program expects students to spend around 4-8 per week on these
>    assignments.
>    - On submission of the assignments, they will be evaluated and
>    respective feedback will be provided to the students.
>
>
>
> *Please keep this information strictly confidential from other peer
> institutes*, feel free to contact me for any clarification.
>
> Thank you.
>
> Regards,
>
> *Santhosh Kumar R*
> *Training and Placement Officer*
> *Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad *
>
> *Transit Campus,*

*****************************************************

Dear All,

Achnet Technologies (Tescra Software), Job profile has been published on
the CDC Portal. Go through the profile well and apply.

The deadline for application is* 5 pm, 27 Sep 2022. *

*Please keep this information strictly confidential from other peer
institutes*, feel free to contact me for any clarification.

*Mandatory conditions from Achnet. *

1.    Selected students will have to sign the bond agreement in the month
of April 2023. Bond agreement hard copies will be shared to their mailing
address and they have to sign along with 2 witnesses (should be their
family members ONLY).
2.     Pre-Induction Training program for the selected students will start
on 1st January 2023. The training is from Monday to Friday.
No stipend during the training period

The pre-induction training will be 1-2 hours weekly



   - Pre-Induction-Program is a specially crafted program to help college
   graduates learn to translate theoretical knowledge into practice.
   - This program requires a 1-2 hr. weekly training session using Video
   Conferencing.
   - During the video conference, students will be taught new
   tools/techniques and guidance for the professional world.
   - During the video conference, students can resolve their queries and
   doubts with the Mentor.
   - They will be assigned projects after every session, which are required
   to be submitted at a specified time.
   - These small projects may require anywhere from 8hrs to 40 hrs of
   effort, per project, from students.
   - The program expects students to spend around 4-8 per week on these
   assignments.
   - On submission of the assignments, they will be evaluated and
   respective feedback will be provided to the students.



*Please keep this information strictly confidential from other peer
institutes*, feel free to contact me for any clarification.

Thank you.

Regards,

*Santhosh Kumar R*
*Training and Placement Officer*
*Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad *

*Transit Campus,*

*Near Gramalakshmi Mudralayam,*

*Pudussery West, Palakkad - 678 623,*

*Kerala*
*Contact No: 04923 226591/9497718137*
*tpo@iitpkd.ac.in <tpo@iitpkd.ac.in> *
*www.iitpkd.ac.in* <http://www.iitpkd.ac.in/>

DAY 331
10/10/2022

*ELIMINATING DISTRACTIONS*

 In meditation, something is only a distraction if you deem it as such.
Allow everything to be as it is, cultivating a sense of equanimity. We
eliminate distractions by allowing them to become part of the meditation

--

Hey Guys!
Greetings from Curtain Call!

We are excited to announce that the *Inter IIT team for dramatics* is being
formed.  We will be needing actors, script writers etc. So I kindly request
that interested people fill the form given below by 8th October.
There will be categories of performance such as stage play,  street play
and monologue.

https://forms.gle/XdeCsCUzo1pKncSi9

[image: Inter_IIT.png]

Further details regarding selections will be conveyed to the interested
candidates. Also previous year's rulebook is attached below.

On 04/10/22 17:28, Joel Sam Mathew wrote:
> Dear sir,
>
> For Lab 5 questions 1 and 3 were done entirely by me. Question 2 I 
> didn't know how to approach the problem, so I asked Jasir(111901025) 
> to explain it to me on pen and paper. He told me what data structure 
> to use and explained the algorithm case by case, which I directly 
> implemented. He also helped me fix bugs in question 2 where I was 
> having trouble. I did not explicitly copy his code, but I did refer to 
> his pseudocode which he explained on paper for writing my solution. I 
> am sorry for my mistake, but I promise it was not done intentionally.
>
> Thanking you
> Joel Sam Mathew

>         Dear Student,
>
>         TAs of CS4150 have informed me (with adequate proof) that your
>         lab 5 codes look very similar to your batch-mate's code. I am
>         writing this mail to you seeking an explanation for such a
>         similarity.
>
>         [FOR FIRST TIME OFFENDERS] If you are willing to admit that
>         you have indeed plagiarized the code, and submit an
>         undertaking that you will not involve in such activities in
>         the future, you will be awarded zero marks for lab 4 and no
>         other action will be taken.
>
>         [FOR REPEAT OFFENDERS] A decision will be made after seeing
>         your explanation. Note that if you are indeed guilty,
>         confession may lead to a mild penalty.
>
>         Note that you have time till *10:00 AM, Tue, 04 Oct 2022* to
>         respond to this mail (reply all). Failure to respond to this
>         mail within the above deadline will be considered as your
>         admission of plagiarizing the code.
>
>         Regards,
>         Albert
>

*****************************************************

Dear sir,

For Lab 5 questions 1 and 3 were done entirely by me. Question 2 I didn't
know how to approach the problem, so I asked Jasir(111901025) to explain it
to me on pen and paper. He told me what data structure to use and explained
the algorithm case by case, which I directly implemented. He also helped me
fix bugs in question 2 where I was having trouble. I did not explicitly
copy his code, but I did refer to his pseudocode which he explained on
paper for writing my solution. I am sorry for my mistake, but I promise it
was not done intentionally.

Thanking you
Joel Sam Mathew
111901026

this mail (reply all). Failure to respond to this mail within the above
deadline will be considered as your admission of plagiarizing the code.

On Tue, Oct 4, 2022 at 4:20 PM Albert Sunny <albert@iitpkd.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear Student,
>
> TAs of CS4150 have informed me (with adequate proof) that your lab 5 codes
> look very similar to your batch-mate's code. I am writing this mail to you
> seeking an explanation for such a similarity.
>
> [FOR FIRST TIME OFFENDERS] If you are willing to admit that you have
> indeed plagiarized the code, and submit an undertaking that you will not
> involve in such activities in the future, you will be awarded zero marks
> for lab 4 and no other action will be taken.
>
> [FOR REPEAT OFFENDERS] A decision will be made after seeing your
> explanation. Note that if you are indeed guilty, confession may lead to a
> mild penalty.
>
> Note that you have time till *10:00 AM, Tue, 04 Oct 2022* to respond to
> this mail (reply all). Failure to respond to this mail within the above
> deadline will be considered as your admission of plagiarizing the code.
>
> Regards,
> Albert
>


*****************************************************

Dear Student,

TAs of CS4150 have informed me (with adequate proof) that your lab 5 codes
look very similar to your batch-mate's code. I am writing this mail to you
seeking an explanation for such a similarity.

[FOR FIRST TIME OFFENDERS] If you are willing to admit that you have indeed
plagiarized the code, and submit an undertaking that you will not involve
in such activities in the future, you will be awarded zero marks for lab 4
and no other action will be taken.

[FOR REPEAT OFFENDERS] A decision will be made after seeing your
explanation. Note that if you are indeed guilty, confession may lead to a
mild penalty.

Note that you have time till *10:00 AM, Tue, 04 Oct 2022* to respond to
this mail (reply all). Failure to respond to this mail within the above
deadline will be considered as your admission of plagiarizing the code.

Regards,
Albert

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Sarath Sasi <sarath@iitpkd.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Oct 5, 2022 at 12:18 PM
Subject: [Broadcast] Pale Blue Dot 4
To: <broadcast@iitpkd.ac.in>


Dear all,
It is our great pleasure to invite you for the fourth lecture in the Pale
Blue Dot - IIT Palakkad Public Lecture Series. The details of the talk are
given below.

*Speaker: *Dr. Manunath Krishnapur, Indian Institute of Science Bangalore.
*Title*: "*Taking Chances; Making Decisions*"
*Date and time:   *08*.*10.2022, 04.00 PM
*Venue: *Victoria College Auditorium , Palakkad
*Abstract: *Like basic arithmetic, basic skills to read and interpret data
is essential to survival in the modern world where surveys, polls,
statistics from scientific studies, sports figures, economic data, etc. are
thrown at us all the time. We take many half-real half-made-up situations
to illustrate correct and incorrect ways to do this. The level of
mathematical sophistication required will be kept at high-school level, and
an attempt made towards a relaxed lecture, just short of putting the
audience to sleep.

*About the speaker: *Dr. Manjunath Krishnapur is a Mathematician at Indian
Institute of Science Bangalore. He has made outstanding contributions to
the field of Probability Theory. His discoveries have been published in the
most reputed Mathematics journals, including Annals of Mathematics, as well
as in reputed Physics journals because of their relevance to Statistical
Physics. He is also a favourite "Math teacher" to many Math and non-Math
students of IISc.


Best regards,
Pale Blue Dot Team

-- 
Sarath Sasi
Assistant Professor in Mathematics
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
Ahalia Integrated Campus, Kozhipara
Palakkad 678557, Kerala

is essential to survival in the modern world where surveys, polls,

From: <adoni@admin.iitd.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Oct 6, 2022 at 12:53 PM
Subject: Winter Systems School 2022 at IIT Delhi
To:


To HoD Department of Computer Science & Engineering

Kindly forward the below advertisement to relevant student forums at your
Institute.

-------

We are excited to host the first winter systems school at CSE, IIT Delhi
during 5th-9th Dec. 2022. In the school, we will study two computer systems
areas: cybersecurity and cloud computing.

The webpage of the winter systems school is at
https://systems-rg.github.io/wss22.

The school is open to senior UG (3rd or 4th year) and PG students in India.
Please apply to attend the school if you are interested in learning about
computer systems. All applicants will be required to take an online test
with questions on OS and compilers, and will also include programming
tests.  The programming tests can be taken either in Java or C++.  We will
select a cohort of up to 100 students based on the online test. The
selected students will be offered free stay (with meals) in the IIT Delhi
hostels for up to 7 days around 5th-9th Dec. 2022.

The applications are now open at https://forms.gle/HK2hMBmqv1nRpYQx8 until
15th October 2022. The details of the online test will be communicated to
the applicants over email.

>From the selected participants of the winter school, a few student
attendees will be offered paid summer internships at IIT Delhi in 2023. *All
queries regarding the program can be directed to **wss22@googlegroups.com
<wss22@googlegroups.com>.*

The school is supported by the Mohit Aron Endowment. The schedule includes
an inaugural talk on the entrepreneurial journey by Mohit. Mohit is an IITD
alumnus and has founded Cohesity and Nutanix.

--
Subodh Sharma
Associate Dean, Academics (Outreach & New Initiatives)
Pankaj Gupta Chair Professor of Privacy and Decentralisation
Associate Professor
Department of Computer Science and Engineering, IIT Delhi

Dear All,

                              *Greetings from Team Mitra*


*             October 10th is observed to be World Mental Health Day*


       The overall objective of World Mental Health Day is to raise
awareness of mental health issues worldwide and to mobilize efforts to
support mental health. Mental health includes our emotional, psychological,
and social well-being. It affects how we think, feel, and act. It also helps
determine how we handle stress, relate to others, and make healthy choices. The
World Mental Health Day theme for 2022 is "*Make Mental Health and
Well-being for all a Global Priority"*

#Letsfocusonmentalhealth
#spreadpositivity

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Preeti Aghalayam <preeti@iitm.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Oct 6, 2022 at 5:42 PM
Subject: A study on gender based language, from IITM
To: uma@iitpkd.ac.in <uma@iitpkd.ac.in>




***
The link : https://forms.gle/vZ8kXMXg7CyDXztA7

*Brief about the questionnaire:*

This survey is conducted as a part of research work of PhD (IDRP) scholar
at IITM ( G.L. Vijaya Vani, Roll No: Ch22D301).

The survey is to understand the use of Gender Neutral Language
(GNL)/inclusive language which is based on beliefs about language,
recognition of GNL, and willingness to use inclusive language at academic
institutions.

Data collected during this study will be used for academic purposes only.
Responses will be treated with utmost confidentiality and will be presented
in summary form only. This survey does not require you to provide your name
or other personal information.

Your responses are very important to the data collection efforts.
We appreciate your cooperation. Please answer as best you can (there is no
right or wrong answer). Thank you for saving me a few minutes of your
precious time.


Please be a part of the research by filling out this form
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdLyRNfL9jpZDwcbHzIqWhYCI9qJzsp2tdnv2igorVLPJRJLA/viewform>

Best Regards

Vani

Just a reminder for today's talk at 2 pm in Ahalia auditorium.

On Wed, Oct 5, 2022 at 11:27 AM M Ashok Kumar <ashokm@iitpkd.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear All,
>
> A talk by Dr Manjunath Krishnapur of the Indian Institute of Science is
> scheduled as per the following details.
>
> Date & Time: *Friday, 07 October at 2 pm*
>
> Venue: Auditorium, Ahalia campus
>
> Title: Exact distribution of zeros in random polynomials and analytic
> functions
>
>
> Abstract: In random matrix theory, there are numerous models of random
> matrices whose eigenvalue distributions can be computed exactly. In the
> adjacent field of random polynomials there are hardly any. About the only
> one is the discovery of Peres and Virag (around 2005) concerning the zeros
> of the random analytic function on the unit disk: F(z)=g_0+g_1z+g_2z^2+…
> where g_k are i.i.d. standard complex Gaussian random variables. Although F
> has infinitely many zeros, they gave an exact determinantal formula to
> compute the joint distributions. As a corollary, the mean, variance, and
> exact distributions of the number of zeros in the sub-disk of radius r can
> be computed. Recently we found a new proof of this theorem starting from
> the uniform random polynomial whose zeros are in the unit disk. The key is
> to find a description of these random polynomials in terms of orthogonal
> polynomials on the unit circle. We describe this proof in the lecture.
>
> Biography of the speaker: Manjunath Krishnapur is an Associate Professor
> at the Indian Institute of Science, Bengaluru, and an excellent speaker of
> Mathematics. More details about him can be found here
> <http://math.iisc.ernet.in/~manju/>.
>
> All are cordially invited.
>
> Thanks & Regards
> Ashok.
>


*****************************************************

Dear All,

A talk by Dr Manjunath Krishnapur of the Indian Institute of Science is
scheduled as per the following details.

Date & Time: *Friday, 07 October at 2 pm*

Venue: Auditorium, Ahalia campus

Title: Exact distribution of zeros in random polynomials and analytic
functions


Abstract: In random matrix theory, there are numerous models of random
matrices whose eigenvalue distributions can be computed exactly. In the
adjacent field of random polynomials there are hardly any. About the only
one is the discovery of Peres and Virag (around 2005) concerning the zeros
of the random analytic function on the unit disk: F(z)=g_0+g_1z+g_2z^2+…
where g_k are i.i.d. standard complex Gaussian random variables. Although F
has infinitely many zeros, they gave an exact determinantal formula to
compute the joint distributions. As a corollary, the mean, variance, and
exact distributions of the number of zeros in the sub-disk of radius r can
be computed. Recently we found a new proof of this theorem starting from
the uniform random polynomial whose zeros are in the unit disk. The key is
to find a description of these random polynomials in terms of orthogonal
polynomials on the unit circle. We describe this proof in the lecture.

Biography of the speaker: Manjunath Krishnapur is an Associate Professor at
the Indian Institute of Science, Bengaluru, and an excellent speaker of
Mathematics. More details about him can be found here
<http://math.iisc.ernet.in/~manju/>.

All are cordially invited.

Thanks & Regards
Ashok.


*****************************************************

DAY 329
05/10/2022

*OVERCOMING DIFFICULT EMOTIONS*


 In meditation, we can reflect on things that challenge us in our lives
with great power because in meditation we have the “home court” advantage
over those challenges. When they come up in life, they can surprise us, but
in meditation, we can call them forth to deal with them.

  ♦ Take a seat and set a timer for at least five minutes.
  ♦ Bring to mind a challenging person, place, or thing.
♦ Breathe into it and notice the different thoughts and feelings you have
around it.
  ♦ With every exhale, release the old ways of feeling, clearing through
the discomfort.
  ♦ Imagine that the next time you are faced with this challenge in life,
you are stronger, more stable, and less affected by it.

--FORWARD TOGETHER
*Team MITRA*
*IIT Palakkad*
*Nila Campus Room# B-224A (Tilang Hostel)*
*Ahalia Campus#Hostel 3 (Left side Room)*
https://www.facebook.com/TEAM.MITRA.IIT.PALAKKAD
<https://www.facebook.com/TEAM.MITRA.IIT.PALAKKAD/?__cft__[0]=AZWnTfStvGlEXxtjgA1HgnDm-8s9Tn2cQ7hvMVz-Mn8flr9ZwNvDoYd2s9muzRozhOvnhjaSZ3uKZMEKAZ7UtfIStmZiExYfiKweNttjb6Iy26uHgaqcxhb4bkU2yOET96yGUmYzUnvCpztdg_FAsD_X6UlK2G1yqL7NAN651Z7pglMtbf3XUN57-fngOjJeNIk&__tn__=kK-R>

>>> *Attention B. Tech and M. Sc. students who were availing the
>>> institute scholarship during the academic year 2021-22*,

>>> This is to inform you that for the purpose of renewal of
>>> various scholarships offered to you from the institute, you are requested
>>> to submit the valid annual family Income certificate (April 2021-March 2022
>>> period). The income certificate has to be issued by the Tahsildar or other
>>> competent Revenue authority from your respective locations (issued on or
>>> after 01-04-2022 or should  be valid as on 30-09-2022).
>>>
>>> A detailed list of competent authorities who are authorized to issue the
>>> annual family income certificates is attached herewith this mail for your
>>> reference. Annual income certificates signed by officials other than the
>>> designated persons will not be accepted.
>>>
>>> All the students must apply for the scholarships through the
>>> National Scholarship Portal. If a student misses to apply in the NSP or
>>> does not provide the non-availability of any schemes for which he/she is
>>> eligible then he/she has to forgo his/her institute scholarship for the
>>> academic year 2022-23.
>>>
>>> If the same student is eligible for both the institute as well as a
>>> scholarship through the NSP portal, he/she may be allowed to renew the
>>> institute scholarship, with a condition that the student has to remit the
>>> amount received from NSP scholarship to the institute account, since a
>>> student is not allowed to avail two government scholarships simultaneously.
>>>
>>> You are advised to fill in the google form and upload the supporting
>>> documents  here
>>> <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScpyD0BvzDtTMHkN8FZ9Iqm1spBb62lAk8O4tHt-Uglp6TYxQ/viewform?usp=sf_link>
>>>
>>> The deadline for giving the renewal applications to the institute will
>>> be 15 days from the date of opening of the NSP portal. A separate email
>>> will be sent once the institute receives information from the concerned
>>> ministry about the opening of the NSP for submitting the applications.
>>>
>>> The applications for the renewal of scholarships shall be submitted
>>> latest by 31-08-2022.

>>> scholarship renewal applications.*

> annual family income certificates is attached herewith this mail for your
> reference. Annual income certificates signed by officials other than the
> designated persons will not be accepted.
>
> All the students must apply for the scholarships through the
> National Scholarship Portal. If a student misses to apply in the NSP or
> does not provide the non-availability of any schemes for which he/she is
> eligible then he/she has to forgo his/her institute scholarship for the
> academic year 2022-23.
>
> If the same student is eligible for both the institute as well as a
> scholarship through the NSP portal, he/she may be allowed to renew the
> institute scholarship, with a condition that the student has to remit the
> amount received from NSP scholarship to the institute account, since a
> student is not allowed to avail two government scholarships simultaneously.
>
> You are advised to fill in the google form and upload the supporting
> documents  here
> <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScpyD0BvzDtTMHkN8FZ9Iqm1spBb62lAk8O4tHt-Uglp6TYxQ/viewform?usp=sf_link>
>
> The deadline for giving the renewal applications to the institute will be
> 15 days from the date of opening of the NSP portal. A separate email will
> be sent once the institute receives information from the concerned ministry
> about the opening of the NSP for submitting the applications.
>
> The applications for the renewal of scholarships shall be submitted latest
> by 31-08-2022.
>
> *Please note that no extensions will be provided for the institute
> scholarship renewal applications.*
>
> Please contact us in case of any queries/ clarifications
>
> Thanks
>
> --
> *With Thanks and Regards*
> *Academics Section*
> *IIT Palakkad*
>


-- 
*With Thanks and Regards*
*Academics Section*
*IIT Palakkad*

Respected Sir,
I am Indrashis Gain from MSc Mathematics second semester. I want to renew
my MCM Scholarship. My income certificate issuing officer is Sub-divisional

of @gmail.com format.But in the Google form it is mentioned that the email
format should be gov.in format. I have Official Contact No. of
Sub-divisional officer of my area. What should I do sir?
Faithfully,
Indrashis Gain.

*****************************************************

Dear Students,

In continuation to the trailing mail sent , please be informed that
the* National
Scholarship Portal <https://scholarships.gov.in/> *is open and accepting
applications for fresh as well as renewal applications for the Academic
year 2022-23. Please make sure that all of you have to login and apply for
the eligible schemes through the portal. The students who had applied for a
scheme in the previous academic year shall apply for a renewal of the same
and others have to apply for fresh scholarships.You can check the
guidelines and FAQs available on the National Scholarship Portal for more
details on the same. If you are facing any technical issues or facing any
difficulty in application for the scholarship issued by National
Scholarship Portal you may contact the helpdesk of the portal either
through contacting them over telephone at 0120 - 6619540 or by writing
email to helpdesk@nsp.gov.in (from 8 AM to 8 PM on all days, excluding
holidays)
It has to be noted that if you are eligible for the scholarship through NSP
then it is mandatory to apply for the same and you can mention the same
while applying for the renewal of institute scholarship. In such cases the
institute scholarship will be renewed with a condition that the amount
received from NSP has to be paid to the institute account since availing
two government scholarships simultaneously  is not advisable as per
instructions from the GoI norms. This is for your information and action
from your end at the earliest.

The last date for submitting the institute renewal applications through the
google form link ( here
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScpyD0BvzDtTMHkN8FZ9Iqm1spBb62lAk8O4tHt-Uglp6TYxQ/viewform?usp=sf_link>
 ) will be 31-08-2022

*Please note that no extensions will be provided for the institute
scholarship renewal applications.*

Thanks

On Fri, Jul 15, 2022 at 12:44 PM Academic IIT Palakkad <

*****************************************************

Dear Students,

*Attention B. Tech and M. Sc. students who were availing the
institute scholarship during the academic year 2021-22*,

This is to inform you that for the purpose of renewal of
various scholarships offered to you from the institute, you are requested
to submit the valid annual family Income certificate (April 2021-March 2022
period). The income certificate has to be issued by the Tahsildar or other
competent Revenue authority from your respective locations (issued on or
after 01-04-2022 or should  be valid as on 30-09-2022).

A detailed list of competent authorities who are authorized to issue the
annual family income certificates is attached herewith this mail for your
reference. Annual income certificates signed by officials other than the
designated persons will not be accepted.

All the students must apply for the scholarships through the
National Scholarship Portal. If a student misses to apply in the NSP or
does not provide the non-availability of any schemes for which he/she is
eligible then he/she has to forgo his/her institute scholarship for the
academic year 2022-23.

If the same student is eligible for both the institute as well as a
scholarship through the NSP portal, he/she may be allowed to renew the
institute scholarship, with a condition that the student has to remit the
amount received from NSP scholarship to the institute account, since a
student is not allowed to avail two government scholarships simultaneously.

You are advised to fill in the google form and upload the supporting
documents  here
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScpyD0BvzDtTMHkN8FZ9Iqm1spBb62lAk8O4tHt-Uglp6TYxQ/viewform?usp=sf_link>

The deadline for giving the renewal applications to the institute will be
15 days from the date of opening of the NSP portal. A separate email will
be sent once the institute receives information from the concerned ministry
about the opening of the NSP for submitting the applications.

The applications for the renewal of scholarships shall be submitted latest
by 31-08-2022.

*Please note that no extensions will be provided for the institute
scholarship renewal applications.*

Please contact us in case of any queries/ clarifications

Thanks

-- 
*With Thanks and Regards*
*Academics Section*
*IIT Palakkad*


*****************************************************

Dear sir,

No, I haven't plagiarised from any batchmate's code.
For the first question I referred
https://cp-algorithms.com/graph/dijkstra.html#implementation and the
implementation is almost exactly the same so my code might look similar to
people who referred the same link. I didn't think this was a problem since
the problem was very straightforward and that was the usual implementation
I have used before.

For the second question, after the completion of my solution, on discussion
with batchmates, I realised there was a more reliable way to ensure
convergence. This also was by discussion and no copying of code was
involved.

I received the mail only an hour ago, that's why I could not reply within
the deadline.

Joel Sam Mathew
111901026

>
> TAs of CS4150 have informed me (with adequate proof) that your lab 4 codes
> look very similar to your batch-mate's code. I am writing this mail to you
> seeking an explanation for such a similarity.
>
> If you are willing to admit that you have indeed plagiarized the code, and
> submit an undertaking that you will not involve in such activities in the
> future, you will be awarded zero marks for lab 4 and no other action will
> be taken.
>
> If you are denying everything and your explanation is not satisfactory,
> after personally observing your performance in the upcoming viva 1, I will
> raise a formal complaint with the Institute Disciplinary Committee.
>
> Note that you have time till *10:00 AM, Tue, 04 Oct 2022* to respond to
> this mail (reply all). Failure to respond to this mail within the above
> deadline will be considered as your admission of plagiarizing the code.
>
> Regards,
> Albert

Dear sir,

No, I haven't plagiarised from any batchmate's code.
For the first question I referred
https://cp-algorithms.com/graph/dijkstra.html#implementation and the
implementation is almost exactly the same so my code might look similar to
people who referred the same link. I didn't think this was a problem since
the problem was very straightforward and that was the usual implementation
I have used before.

For the second question, after the completion of my solution, on discussion
with batchmates, I realised there was a more reliable way to ensure
convergence. This also was by discussion and no copying of code was
involved.

I received the mail only an hour ago, that's why I could not reply within
the deadline.

*****************************************************

Dear Student,

TAs of CS4150 have informed me (with adequate proof) that your lab 4 codes
look very similar to your batch-mate's code. I am writing this mail to you
seeking an explanation for such a similarity.

If you are willing to admit that you have indeed plagiarized the code, and
submit an undertaking that you will not involve in such activities in the
future, you will be awarded zero marks for lab 4 and no other action will
be taken.

If you are denying everything and your explanation is not satisfactory,
after personally observing your performance in the upcoming viva 1, I will
raise a formal complaint with the Institute Disciplinary Committee.

Note that you have time till *10:00 AM, Tue, 04 Oct 2022* to respond to
this mail (reply all). Failure to respond to this mail within the above
deadline will be considered as your admission of plagiarizing the code.

Regards,
Albert

Hey guys,
I hope you all are doing well.
We're here with the announcement of selections for the most awaited Inter
IIT cultural meet 5.0 hosted by IIT Madras in around 2nd week of January
2023, during our winter break.
This year we're having the following events under photography:

   - Online photography Competition
   - Photoshop Battle
   - Online Photo Story Competition

I, hereby, request all the interested students to kindly fill the following
form <https://forms.gle/xWTYdEE3FnEruQZb6>. The deadline for filling the
same is 9th October 2022 11:59pm.
For any further queries feel free to contact me.
--

*****************************************************

Hello everyone,

Hope all are doing well! From the plethora of mails, I see there has been a
flurry of activities in this semester and that the preparations for Inter
IIT have begun! Happy to see such mails and especially happy to hear
offline activities resuming like before!

Now, as you may see from the subject and the content of this thread, I
write to update you all that *the remainder of the fund that was collected
as part of the donation drive during the peak of the COVID has been handed
over from my SAC to the new SAC, with the current General Secretary,
Jyothiradhithya, holding the funds, totalling to Rs 76,699, (same as the
remaining amount mentioned in the last email in this thread) for the time
being. *

Moreover, as was mentioned while this donation drive was started, that if
there was any amount that remained after the threat of the COVID was
negligible, we would donate the remaining amount to something meaningful,
which would be in line with the spirit with which the fund was collected.
It is more than safe to say that COVID does not seem to be a threat of
severity anymore. So we would like to donate the remaining fund as
promised. For the same, *we would like you, the students who had made the
donations benevolently to the drive, to fill this form:
https://forms.gle/mo3VDmDTwadDWrcT6 <https://forms.gle/mo3VDmDTwadDWrcT6>
and give your opinion on where you would like the fund to be donated. *

I would like to once again thank all the students who had donated to this
fund, I would like to thank the Institute for their help during those tough
times, and last but definitely not the least, I would like to once again
thank the whole team of students and faculty alike that were involved in
making sure we would be able to reach out to students that needed our help
the most in those difficult times.

And, like in those times, I would like to again wish you and your family
the best of health, always.

PS: I hope to read more mails on all the awesome work and fun that you guys
are having at the institute!!! :D

Best,

On Wed, May 26, 2021 at 10:58 PM Students' General Secretary <
gen_sec@smail.iitpkd.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear All,
>
> Hope you are doing well and keeping safe!
>
> This mail is just to update you on the details of the fund. The amount in
> the fund as of now is 91,699 rupees only. It is truly a huge number and I
> once again sincerely thank all of you for your most kind benevolence!
>
> Secondly, but more importantly, we have just recently taken a decision to
> support one afflicted student who needs urgent help. The approved amount
> being donated to the person as of now is 15k based on the requirements (so
> the updated amount in the fund will be 76,699 rupees). We will be sure to
> update all of you on the further usage if any.
>
> Thirdly, I would also like to take this opportunity to thank the
> institute, they have recently helped two students with huge sums of money
> from the IIT Palakkad Charitable Trust, sums which were beyond our
> capacity. My sincerest and humblest thanks once again to the institute,
> especially to Anuradha ma'am and Samuel sir for always being there and
> proactively reaching out to us as well!
>
> As the cases seem to decline, at least in some states, we hope this second
> wave subsides soon enough! Lastly, a redundant but important request
> nonetheless, please do take care of yourself and your family members and
> keep checking on your friends!! You can always reach out to any of the SAC
> members in case of any difficulty or you can fill the running form:

*****************************************************

Dear All,

Hope you are doing well and keeping safe!

This mail is just to update you on the details of the fund. The amount in
the fund as of now is 91,699 rupees only. It is truly a huge number and I
once again sincerely thank all of you for your most kind benevolence!

Secondly, but more importantly, we have just recently taken a decision to
support one afflicted student who needs urgent help. The approved amount
being donated to the person as of now is 15k based on the requirements (so
the updated amount in the fund will be 76,699 rupees). We will be sure to
update all of you on the further usage if any.

Thirdly, I would also like to take this opportunity to thank the institute,
they have recently helped two students with huge sums of money from the IIT
Palakkad Charitable Trust, sums which were beyond our capacity. My
sincerest and humblest thanks once again to the institute, especially to
Anuradha ma'am and Samuel sir for always being there and proactively
reaching out to us as well!

As the cases seem to decline, at least in some states, we hope this second
wave subsides soon enough! Lastly, a redundant but important request
nonetheless, please do take care of yourself and your family members and
keep checking on your friends!! You can always reach out to any of the SAC
members in case of any difficulty or you can fill the running form:
https://forms.gle/qtRF8qEbCgjm2n52A!

Wishing you and your family the best of health,
Thanks and warm regards,
Shrujan.

*****************************************************

Dear All,

Hope you and your family member are doing well and keeping safe! Please do
take care of yourself and your family members and keep checking up on your
friends!

I feel immense pleasure in notifying all of you that we have been able to
collect 89,604 rupees in the drive as of today!! This is a huge amount and
I personally feel very humble and grateful to each and every one of you who
has come out strong in these difficult times! Truly, truly great work and I
once again thank and each and every one of you for your kind benevolence!

Lastly, I would like to make an important announcement with regards to an
update in our fund distribution policy. As you may know, the prices of
essential medicines have shot up due to high demand and because of the
same, some students may face difficulty in paying the inflated amount.
Hence, we have decided that *we will donate rupees 5000 to anyone facing
financial issues with medication*. If the student needs further assistance,
we will contact the institute since they may be able to help much better
and also, please note that the primary use case of our funds, or the
primary idea we have in mind, is that it should go to a person who needs
the money urgently for a bed (general or ICU) and is facing financial
trouble. And as we have mentioned in the previous mail, the price for a bed
can go very high so the amount (for medicinal purposes) has been capped
keeping that in mind. However, if you have any questions or concerns,
please feel free to reply to this mail.

Wishing you and your family the best of health,
Thank you,
Shrujan.

*****************************************************

Dear All,

It is my great pleasure to let you all know that we have collected 60,494
in the donation drive so far! Kudos to us all!! This shall be of great help
to the afflicted students.

As of now, we are going through all the form responses and constantly
reaching out to people who have asked for any sort of help. We shall keep
you all posted on the usage of funds as and when it happens.

Once again, I would like to sincerely thank all of you for coming together
in these tough times and making a donation! All of us shall prevail through
this, together! And again, please take care of yourself and your loved ones
and keep checking up on your friends.

Wishing you and your family the best of health,
Thank you,
Shrujan.

*****************************************************

Dear All,

As you know, many of our friends, some of whom you may know, have been
affected severely by the second wave of COVID. Our prayers are with them
and their family.

Friends, as you also know, we had asked in the form whether you or your
friend would need financial support or not. And sadly, some of the affected
students are not in a well-off financial position and with regards to the
same, we are starting a donation drive. The QR code and the UPI ID is given
below (thanks to Juttu Anurag, club head, Finance club). We understand that
you may also be stressed financially and hence we request you to come
forward and only donate as per your capacity.

[image: WhatsApp Image 2021-05-08 at 12.18.24 PM.jpeg]
UPI ID: sathamhrushikesh@paytm

This is a business account ID so no need to worry about any transaction
limits. The fund distribution policy that we have currently come up with is
as follows:


   - We will donate rupees 20,000 to any student who urgently needs a
   general bed and is struggling with the finances
   - We will donate rupees 50,000 to any student who urgently needs an ICU
   bed with a ventilator and is struggling with finances.

Of course, we hope the fund will be able to get sufficient liquidity for
this. Other situations may be dealt with on a case-to-case basis. Any other
updates will be communicated as needed.

Friends, these are indeed really tough times and I once again urge you all
to please take care of yourselves, your family, and keep checking on your
friends regularly. If any of your friends need any help, please don't
hesitate to contact us. We shall try and arrange anything and everything we
can. We shall overcome this, together!

Wishing you and your family the best of health,
Thank you,
Shrujan Kanabar

Students' General Secretary

Student Affairs Council | Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
+91-6351088949
gen_sec@smail.iitpkd.ac.in
sac.iitpkd.ac.in <https://sac.iitpkd.ac.in:8090>

Thank you,
Jagadeesh

DAY 323
29/09/2022

*KNOW THYSELF *

The Greek aphorism “know thyself” was said to be written on the temple of
Apollo, the god of light. Light is associated with knowledge and
understanding. Ask yourself, “
*What can I learn about myself today?”*

--

*****************************************************

Hello everyone!

Hope you all are having a good time.

We are delighted to announce the success of the Petrichor ‘23 pre-fest
workshop series that boasted 460+ participants from 47 colleges extending
to 4 states. It was a pleasant surprise for us to see numerous students
arrive from the length and breadth of South India to attend the workshops
conducted on Game Development, IC Engines, Artificial Intelligence, and
Real-time signal processing for IoT edge-based devices. The eagerness that
the participants showed for the sessions was energizing for our professors,
who returned the favor with equal energy.

I'm sure both the student communities had a wonderful time interacting with
each other while getting to know about our college and Petrichor.

We extend our heartfelt gratitude towards our speakers Prof.Anand T.N.C,
Prof.Pramod Kuntikana, Vishnu B Raj, Narendra Kumar, Prof. Sabarimalai
Manikandan, and the members of YACC including Jyothiradhithya, Jerry John,
Amish Saxena & Harsh Dubey.

We couldn’t have done this without the support of Prof.Afzaal Ahmed
(Faculty Advisor, Petrichor), Prof.Arvind Ajoy (Technical Advisor,
Petrichor), Prof. Jagadeesh Bayry (Dean students), and Prof.Sovan Lal Das
(Dean Academics).

Special thanks to Samuel Sir, Biju Sir, and Unni Sir along with the CFET
team and Electronics lab staff for their guidance throughout the event.

Last, but surely not least; The volunteers. We cannot appreciate them
enough. They served as the soul of the event, proactive from the very
beginning until the end to make this happen.



Stay tuned for upcoming activities of Petrichor and our annual fest in
January. Here’s to reaching greater heights.

Hereby attaching the after movie of the workshop
 Aftermovie.mp4
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/19u2yombTLRiRYhxYDMrYAbU9yYrwnVSg/view?usp=drive_web>

*Regards     *
*Aleena Paul*

*Fest Coordinator            *
*Petrichor'23, IIT Palakkad    *


       Follow us :
Facebook <https://www.facebook.com/petrichor.iitpkd/> *| *Instagram
<https://www.instagram.com/petrichor.iitpkd/>
contact : +91-9400714718

>
> *Title:* The norms of cutting a rectangular cake into equal triangular
> slices.
>
> *Abstract:* Lilavati has made a rectangular cake for her son's birthday,
> which he is to celebrate with his 6 friends. They all demand triangular
> slices. This expository talk will discuss the impossible predicament of
> Lilavati. During this discussion, we will briefly encounter the p-adic norm
> and Sperner's lemma. Until the last few minutes, the talk will require no
> serious mathematical background.

*****************************************************

Dear All,
The next talk in the Yuktibhasa series conducted by our Department of
Mathematics, will be delivered online by Dr. Sarang Sharad Sane of
IIT-Madras, on the 28th of September (coming Wednesday), starting at 4pm.
Further details are laid down below:

*Title:* The norms of cutting a rectangular cake into equal triangular
slices.

*Abstract:* Lilavati has made a rectangular cake for her son's birthday,
which he is to celebrate with his 6 friends. They all demand triangular
slices. This expository talk will discuss the impossible predicament of
Lilavati. During this discussion, we will briefly encounter the p-adic norm
and Sperner's lemma. Until the last few minutes, the talk will require no
serious mathematical background.

*Time*: 4pm of 28th of September (Wednesday)

Next, *the credentials for joining this webinar to be held via zoom are as
follows*:
Join Zoom Meeting
https://zoom.us/j/91438590079
Meeting ID: 914 3859 0079

Again, all are welcome for this webinar.
Best Regards,
Balakumar.

*****************************************************

*Idioms*

Today let's consider some common idioms related to money:

1. Born with a silver spoon in one’s mouth

Someone who comes from a wealthy and successful family.

“Jayesh was born with a silver spoon in his mouth. His parents bought him
everything he wanted and sent him to the best private schools.”

2. To go from rags to riches

To go from being poor to having a lot of money.

“Actor Jim Carrey went from rags to riches. At one time, he was living in a
van, but he continued to work hard and eventually became one of the
highest-paid comedians in the world.”

3. Pay an arm and a leg for something

To pay a lot of money for something. You can also say that something “costs
an arm and a leg.”

“The price of chocolate has doubled. I nearly paid an arm and a leg for a
small bar.”

“Chocolate costs an arm and a leg now.”

4. To have sticky fingers

To be a thief.

“The manager fired the cashier because he had sticky fingers. He stole more
than Rs2000 in a month.”

5. To give a run for one’s money

To compete with someone at their level and make them really work for their
win.

“Jayson  really gave me a run for my money in the chess tournament. He
almost beat me!”

regards, Sandhya
-- 
English Language Support & Services
IIT Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/elss

DAY 327
03/10/2022

*CHARACTER REFLECTION MEDITATION*

♦ Get into a comfortable position, set a timer for five minutes or more,
and begin to meditate.
  ♦ Start by bringing the awareness to the breath and letting the body
relax.
  ♦ Begin to reflect on your life, imagining that every moment of your life
is a scene in a movie.
♦ Imagine that every moment was a part of character development for your
character in a movie.
  ♦ Ponder the implications of your character. What kind of insight can you
gain?
