> Dear All,
>
> Ms. Mimisha M Menakath who is working with the guidance of Dr. Mahesh R
> Panicker will be presenting her research proposal on 28th September 2022 at
> 03:00 PM through online mode.
>
> Title: Signal Processing for Underwater 3D Acoustical Imaging System
>
> Date & Time: 28th September 2022 at 03:00 PM
>
> Venue: Zoom meeting details are given below
>
> Meeting ID: 953 7949 3716
>
> Passcode: 114058
>
> Meeting link: https:
> https://zoom.us/j/95379493716?pwd=djJzUnBkd1VMSXhuL0NaMDMwRkRDUT09
>
> ABSTRACT :
>
> Ocean exploration using underwater acoustical 3D imaging is becoming
> popular as it provides information about the 3D geometry of the targets. In
> the underwater acoustical 3D imaging system, the major components are an
> omnidirectional transmitter and a uniform 2D receiving array. The
> transmitter sends an ultrasound pulse of suitable frequency. When the
> transmitted pulse encounters any change in the medium acoustic impedance, a
> part of transmitted energy will be reflected back. The backscattered echoes
> are collected by using the 2D receiving array. The 3D image of the region
> of interest is reconstructed from the backscattered echoes. Delay and Sum
> beamforming is the promising technique used to convert received time
> information into space information or image. The major challenges for
> designing an underwater 3D imaging system are the cost and complexity of
> the hardware, computational complexity and large memory requirements of the
> existing imaging algorithms. Designing a sparse 2D array which provides the
> same beam pattern as a uniform 2D array is one way to reduce the
> complexity, cost and memory requirements. A sparse 2D array with a minimum
> number of elements will be designed. Another way is to develop fast and
> compute efficient beamforming algorithms. We developed a fast-beamforming
> algorithm with significant reduction in computational complexity and memory
> requirements. However, conducting real experiments to validate imaging
> algorithms and sparse array designing algorithms is the bottleneck on the
> research of underwater acoustical 3D imaging. Since a suitable simulation
> tool for modelling realistic underwater scenarios is not yet available, the
> development of such a simulation tool is also important. We exhaustively
> utilized the k-Wave toolbox for modelling underwater targets. As the
> resolution of the reconstructed image is very poor, image processing such
> as segmentation is also required for the better interpretation of the
> reconstructed images. A suitable segmentation algorithm will be developed
> to separate underwater targets from sediment reverberation.
>
>
> All are cordially invited.

*****************************************************

Dear All,

Ms. Mimisha M Menakath who is working with the guidance of Dr. Mahesh R
Panicker will be presenting her research proposal on 28th September 2022 at
03:00 PM through online mode.

Title: Signal Processing for Underwater 3D Acoustical Imaging System

Date & Time: 28th September 2022 at 03:00 PM

Venue: Zoom meeting details are given below

Meeting ID: 953 7949 3716

Passcode: 114058

Meeting link: https:
https://zoom.us/j/95379493716?pwd=djJzUnBkd1VMSXhuL0NaMDMwRkRDUT09

ABSTRACT :

Ocean exploration using underwater acoustical 3D imaging is becoming
popular as it provides information about the 3D geometry of the targets. In
the underwater acoustical 3D imaging system, the major components are an
omnidirectional transmitter and a uniform 2D receiving array. The
transmitter sends an ultrasound pulse of suitable frequency. When the
transmitted pulse encounters any change in the medium acoustic impedance, a
part of transmitted energy will be reflected back. The backscattered echoes
are collected by using the 2D receiving array. The 3D image of the region
of interest is reconstructed from the backscattered echoes. Delay and Sum
beamforming is the promising technique used to convert received time
information into space information or image. The major challenges for
designing an underwater 3D imaging system are the cost and complexity of
the hardware, computational complexity and large memory requirements of the
existing imaging algorithms. Designing a sparse 2D array which provides the
same beam pattern as a uniform 2D array is one way to reduce the
complexity, cost and memory requirements. A sparse 2D array with a minimum
number of elements will be designed. Another way is to develop fast and
compute efficient beamforming algorithms. We developed a fast-beamforming
algorithm with significant reduction in computational complexity and memory
requirements. However, conducting real experiments to validate imaging
algorithms and sparse array designing algorithms is the bottleneck on the
research of underwater acoustical 3D imaging. Since a suitable simulation
tool for modelling realistic underwater scenarios is not yet available, the
development of such a simulation tool is also important. We exhaustively
utilized the k-Wave toolbox for modelling underwater targets. As the
resolution of the reconstructed image is very poor, image processing such
as segmentation is also required for the better interpretation of the
reconstructed images. A suitable segmentation algorithm will be developed
to separate underwater targets from sediment reverberation.


All are cordially invited.


-- 
Thank you
Regards,

Office of the Dean (Academics)
IIT Palakkad

Santhosh-TPO

<https://www.facebook.com/TEAM.MITRA.IIT.PALAKKAD/?__cft__[0]=AZWnTfStvGlEXxtjgA1HgnDm-8s9Tn2cQ7hvMVz-Mn8flr9ZwNvDoYd2s9muzRozhOvnhjaSZ3uKZMEKAZ7UtfIStmZiExYfiKweNttjb6Iy26uHgaqcxhb4bkU2yOET96yGUmYzUnvCpztdg_FAsD_X6UlK2G1yqL7NAN651Z7pglMtbf3XUN57-fngOjJeNIk&__tn__=kK-R>


*****************************************************

*Complete the sentences* using the verbs below in the correct form. Some
need to be used more than once

feel,smell, look, sound, taste, see, hear, touch

1. Listen. Can you hear anything? It ........................... like
there’s someone outside.
2. I had to put on my glasses as I couldn’t ..............................
the small letters properly.
3. The pan is still very hot, so make sure you don’t
.............................. it
4. I asked him to speak up because I couldn’t
.............................. what he was saying.
5. The cat’s fur .............................. soft and warm under my
fingers.
6. It .............................. like something is burning. We should
check the stove.
7. Although the apple ........................... like it was ready to eat,
it tasted very sour.
8. Dhruv can't wait to ....................... the assorted cupcakes he's
ordered from a homebaker.
9. Dhanu has been ........................... low, so Shriya is being
careful about watching out for her
10. Have you .................. the news? It seems Tony and Suma are
getting promotions.


*Answers*
1) sounds
2) see
3) touch
4) hear
5) feels/ felt
6) smells
7) looked
8) taste
9) feeling
10) heard

regards, Sandhya
-- 
English Language Support & Services
IIT Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/elss

*****************************************************

Dear Students,
Please refer to the trailing mail.

It has been noticed that some  students come to the computer labs and leave
their baggage on the chairs and go for their other work.  As the lab is a
common place for all, please keep your belongings with you instead of
leaving it in the Computer Labs. Once again, we would like to reiterate
that the computer labs are the places for serious study. For the
discussions and other activities, you may go to any other free class rooms.
If any  student is found to be making disturbances for others. he/she will
be asked to leave the computer lab.

This is to remind you that please do not use the plug points in the
computer labs for charging mobile devices.
We have told you multiple times that not to bring snacks/chocolates and
drinking water bottles to the computer labs.
Please see the image from the Computer lab last night. We have

Kindly cooperate with us to serve you better.

[image: ComputerLab20220928.jpeg]


Thanks
With Regards
Biju




On Wed, Sep 7, 2022 at 5:25 PM Biju K V <kvbiju@iitpkd.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear Students,
>
> We would like to bring to your kind attention that the students are not
> allowed to bring any eatables and water bottles to the computer lab.
> Despite being given multiple warnings, the students are bringing water
> bottles and spilling water over the computer tables. Please do avoid it.
>
> The Labs are to be considered as places for serious study. For the
> discussions and meetings you may choose any free class rooms.
>
> Usage of Laptops within the computer lab makes the resource wastage which
> otherwise would have been used by some other users.
> So, we request you to use PCs in the computer lab, instead of Laptops
> when you are inside the Lab.
> Also, kindly do not remove the keyboard and mouse connected to the PCs in
> the computer lab.
>
> It has been noticed that the students are bringing their mobile chargers
> to the computer labs and plug into the free socket available along with the
> socket connected to the system.
> When you about to leave the lab, you switch off the power to remove the
> charger, but eventually, Computer gets shutdown uncleanly.  This would
> create data loss and other related issues with the computer.
> So, we request you to use the mobile chargers only when it is absolutely
> necessary. It would be nice that if you could use plug points outside the
> lab.
>
> It has also been noticed that the students are keeping their baggage on
> the chairs in the computer lab and go out for their other
> activities/classes.
> We urge you to take your belongings when you leave the computer lab.
> Kindly do not treat our computer labs as cloak rooms.
>
>
> Kindly cooperate with us for the smooth running of the lab.
>

students may not be able to use the computer lab in the future.

to follow the rules and regulations. Otherwise you will face the
consequences.

*****************************************************

Dear Students,

We would like to bring to your kind attention that the students are not
allowed to bring any eatables and water bottles to the computer lab.
Despite being given multiple warnings, the students are bringing water
bottles and spilling water over the computer tables. Please do avoid it.

The Labs are to be considered as places for serious study. For the
discussions and meetings you may choose any free class rooms.

Usage of Laptops within the computer lab makes the resource wastage which
otherwise would have been used by some other users.
So, we request you to use PCs in the computer lab, instead of Laptops when
you are inside the Lab.
Also, kindly do not remove the keyboard and mouse connected to the PCs in
the computer lab.

It has been noticed that the students are bringing their mobile chargers to
the computer labs and plug into the free socket available along with the
socket connected to the system.
When you about to leave the lab, you switch off the power to remove the
charger, but eventually, Computer gets shutdown uncleanly.  This would
create data loss and other related issues with the computer.
So, we request you to use the mobile chargers only when it is absolutely
necessary. It would be nice that if you could use plug points outside the
lab.

It has also been noticed that the students are keeping their baggage on the
chairs in the computer lab and go out for their other activities/classes.
We urge you to take your belongings when you leave the computer lab.
Kindly do not treat our computer labs as cloak rooms.


Kindly cooperate with us for the smooth running of the lab.

-- 
K V Biju
Technical Officer | IIT Palakkad
Ahalia Integrated Campus | Kozhippara PO | Palakkad Dist | Kerala 678557
Call: +91-4923 226 309/390
GSM:+91-9497718136/8281112815 | Email:kvbiju@iitpkd.ac.in
<kvbiju@iitpkd.ac.in>
https://iitpkd.ac.in/people/biju <http://iitpkd.ac.in>

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: TIH IIT Mandi <tih@iitmandi.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Oct 3, 2022 at 4:01 PM
Subject: Metaverse Developer Unity 3D Level-1 Course
To:


Hello Sir/ Madam,

Greetings of the day!

We at IIT Mandi iHub and HCI Foundation are starting Metaverse Developer
Unity 3D Level-1 Course in collaboration with  ITRA Japan Co. Ltd.

About the Course:

   -

   The Metaverse Developer Unity 3D course is designed by experts from IIT
   Mandi iHub & HCI Foundation and ITRA Japan Co Ltd. The course offers career
   opportunities in this emerging industry for those looking for better
   professional prospects. ‘Metaverse Developer – Unity 3D – Level 1’ covers
   the basics with theory and practice sessions. The course will give you
   eligibility to take the ‘Certified Associate level examinations’ from Unity
   3D at the end of the course.
   -

   Opportunity to learn from the experts from IIT Mandi iHub and HCI
   Foundation (iHub) and ITRA Japan Co Ltd.


   -

   The course will give opportunities in India and abroad to join the
   emerging industry which offers starting salaries from Rs. 4 lakh or more
   with no upper limit for the right candidates.


   -

   Inclusive of Unity 3D 'Certified Associate' examination fees

 Link to Apply

https://dev.ihubiitmandi.in/learn/iHub-and-HCI/?fbclid=IwAR2ghREkdJhViozUxqOI-yDYOOUYm5qwxEAH77L2cW6u1IVFOXwpic7lrTI


Mode

Duration

Timing

Seats

Last Date

Online

60 hours (Approx 2 Months)

Mon - Fri (1.5 hrs daily)

Limited

20 October 20222


About IIT Mandi iHub and HCI Foundation: The iHub is a section 8 company
established under the National Mission on Interdisciplinary, Cyber-Physical
Systems (NM-ICPS). The vision of iHub is to make India a leader in HCI
research and applications in the world. Based on faculty strengths,
industry collaborations, and ongoing projects, our focus is on the
following: Technology (interface) Development, Evaluation, HRD & Skill
Development, Entrepreneurship, and Collaborations. For more information,
visit- http://iitmandi.ac.in/TIH-HCI/





Note: For more details, the Flyer is attached.





Regards,



Aditya Sharma

Associate PR and Outreach

IIT Mandi iHub and HCI Foundation

For those who may be interested.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Principal MSRIT <principal@msrit.edu>
Date: Sat, Oct 1, 2022 at 12:03 PM
Subject: Hackathon at RIT Bangalore
To: sanjay H A <sanjay.ha@msrit.edu>, Geetanjali R <geetanjali.r@msrit.edu>


Dear Directors, Principals, & Department Heads,


We are pleased to share with you that we at Ramaiah Institute of Technology
are organizing our biggest ever hackathon, CentuRITon, in commemoration of
our Founder Dr M S Ramaiah’s birth centenary and also our RIT’s Diamond
Jubilee year.


CentuRITon will be a 36-hour long hackathon event with over 300
participants from all over India competing in exciting tracks with various
opportunities to interact with industry professionals.


The event is open to students as well as industry professionals. We invite
students from your organization to actively participate in this national
level hackathon.


We would be highly grateful if you would let your students be a part of
this technical extravaganza and let them explore their geeky side.


Timeline:

Online Idea Submission      :  18th Sept - 28th Oct

Announcement of Finalists :   5th Nov

CentuRITon Grand Finale   :  25th - 27th Nov


Website : https://centuriton.com/

Registration URL: https://centuriton.devfolio.co/


Exciting cash prizes worth ₹4.5 Lakhs and above are up for grabs alongside
various other goodies and vouchers.


Note : For outstation teams, there is also a provision for their
accommodation.


Warm regards,

Team CentuRITon,

Ramaiah Institute of Technology,

Bengaluru - 560054.


*****************************************************

Dear All,
Hope this email finds you well!
As we all know that the *Wellness Hub* of our institute always makes
efforts to organise a wide range of diverse activities for the wellness of
the institute community.This time, I am glad to inform you all that the
wellness hub is organising a *Painting Exhibition and Competition* event
with the support of *Dean Students. *

As we all know painting is a creative activity which has a
therapeutic impact on oneself. It is also another way of keeping a diary of
your thoughts and your dreams. Hence, we should try our hands on canvas and
colors to experience the magic and showcase the talent within us.
Below I have mentioned the details about the event.There will be two parts
to the event i.e., *Painting Competition and Painting Exhibition.*
So please take your time and make your painting for the event.


*Painting Exhibition*
The exhibition will be conducted in the first week of November, 2022.The
exact date will be declared soon.
It will be conducted for three days at our institute at Agora.
It is open for students, faculties and staff.
I will send you a detailed schedule in a few days.
You are welcome to use paper or canvas board for the exhibition. But it is
better to use canvas board as it would be convenient to showcase your
painting. All types of coloring materials can be used for painting.
If you are interested then kindly enter your details in the google form
attached below.


*https://forms.gle/FSXbeVauz4J27ktN9 <https://forms.gle/FSXbeVauz4J27ktN9> *

*Painting C**ompetition *
 A painting competition will be conducted on the penultimate day of the
exhibition and will be for the students only.
Paper will be provided while brush and color has to be brought by the
competitors.
All types of coloring materials can be used for painting.
*There will be attractive prizes for the winners.*

Interested students can enter their details in the google form attached
below.


*https://forms.gle/omVaFBCdPG6FxTbD8 <https://forms.gle/omVaFBCdPG6FxTbD8>*

Looking forward to your kind participation in the event.

[image: Painting Competition1.JPG]

With best regards,
Sujata Priyambada Palai
Yoga and Wellness,
IIT Palakkad

Dear Colleagues,
If you have any old answer scripts (hard copies that are more than a year
old) that you want to be discarded please deposit the old answercripts to
the academic section in Nila or Ahalia.

Dear Students,
Please note that all answer scripts that are more than a year old will be
shredded. Therefore, for any reviews please contact the instructor within
one year of the end of the examinations.

Thank you, Sovan

*****************************************************

Dear Colleagues,
It has been decided to discard the exam answer copies that are more than a
year old by shredding. Please deposit the old answercripts to the academic
section in Nila or Ahalia, that you wish to be discarded.

Dear Students,
Please note that all answer scripts that are more than a year old will be
shredded. Therefore, for any reviews please contact the instructor within
one year of the end of the examinations.

Thank you, Sovan
-- 
*Sovan Lal Das*
*Associate Professor of Mechanical Engineering and*

*Dean (Academics)*

*Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad*

*****************************************************

*Phrasal Verbs and correct usage:*

Examine the phrasal verbs below and use them to fill-in the blanks and
create meaningful sentences:

a) Write in: Write a letter to, e.g. to a publication, to an editor, to a
company asking for information
b) Write in: Fill in something required, by writing
c) Write off: Assign a low value to something/ discard
d) Write out: Write at full length or in expanded form
e) Yield up: Give something against one’s will
f) Yield up: Disclose something hidden

1) This latest excavation by the University team in Cairo has
.................. over a hundred pieces of fine Roman silverware.

2) Sometimes it is better to ................an old electrical appliance
rather than try to source spare parts for it.

3) When you are using an abbreviation for the first time, please
.................... the full-form.

4) A lot of consumers ..................... and get acknowledgements for
their feedback too.

5) The brave soldier refused to .........................his gun and paid
dearly for it.

6) The interview candidates were given a pre-interview sheet and asked to
........................... their contact details.

7) Thomas Edison was famously .......................... by his teachers,
so the world owes much gratitude to his mother who believed in him.

8) On the last day of school,  we were required to ....................a
list of ten jobs we'd like to do.

9) Are the slum dwellers still refusing to ......................... the
squatter settlement to the big builders?

10) The journal's website does have a note for contributors, but I plan to
........................ for more information on the topics they are
interested in.

11) Remember to ...................... your roll number on the first page
of the answer sheet.


Answers
1) yielded up (f)
2) write off (c)
3) write out (d)
4) write in (a)
5) yield up (e)
6) write in (b)
7) written off (c)
8) write out  (d)
9) yield up (e)
10) write in (a)
11) write in (b)


regards. Sandhya
-- 
English Language Support & Services
IIT Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/elss

choose to express mine. My uniqueness is my strength.”

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: WISE, DUK <wise@duk.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Oct 3, 2022 at 10:30 AM
Subject: IDEATHON-Digital University Kerala
To:




*HI*,
Greetings from Digital university Kerala(DUK).

Women Incubation, Startups and Entrepreneurship (WISE) Scheme of Digital
University Kerala  (DUK) announces an Ideathon named “Catch Them Young” for
students of higher Education as part of our Women Entrepreneurship conclave
named “herStory” to be held in October 2022 at Digital University campus,
Trivandrum. The main objective of the Ideathon is to  appreciate the
innovative and socially good ideas from the young minds, which can probably
turn  into a start-up. We would like to invite projects which have a unique
innovation and novelty  with partial or full implementation. The major
thrust areas are Women Security, Aids for Disabled,  Technology for Social
Good, Sustainable Development; but not limited to. The ideas and  summary
of the project of two pages has to be submitted online on or before October
12, and  selected projects will be invited at herstory conclave held in
October 2022. The best three projects will be  selected and a cash award of
Rs. 20,000, Rs. 15,000 and Rs. 10,000 will be given on a mega event day in
October 2022 at DUK, Trivandrum.

The award-winning teams, after their graduation, will be given an
opportunity to start  Entrepreneurship at DUK with a seed funding of Rs. 2
Lakh in the ideation stage and Rs. 3 Lakh when turned to be a registered
company.

Participants need to submit an abstract that outlines their Idea/concept.
The abstract must provide  a definite insight into the various important
attributes of their idea, such as an introduction about  the idea,
Objectives, Proposed Architecture, Implementation Plan, Expected outcome
and the  Impact on Society etc.

The web link for submitting your idea is
https://forms.gle/Yr48M4avmP6hRN9Q7 More
details about WISE is available in www.duk.ac.in/wise

For further details and queries, feel free to contact our project
coordinator at 9995092096

Guidelines

1. The idea shall be unique, novel, in partial or full implementation, will
be accepted.

2. The themes are ‘women security’, ‘Aids for disabled’, 'Technology for
social good’,  ‘Sustainable development but not limited to. Any societal
impact projects will also be  considered.

3. The Ideathon selection process will be done in two stages, Stage 1: the
initial screening  will be done by our expert committee members, and the
results will be intimate through  mail on.

4. Stage 2: The selected candidates from the initial screening will be
invited for a presentation in October in offline mode.

5. A 15 minutes presentation will be allowed. The PPT should contain About
Project,  Objective, Uniqueness and Novelty, Architecture, Technology,
Implementation details,  Results and Outcome, Societal Impact, Market
Competency and Business Approach,  Conclusion etc.

6. There cannot be more than four members in a group in which at least one
female candidate  should be there.

7. Current academic year pass out (2022) students can also apply.

8. It can be software or hardware implementation with strong Technology
support.

9. A cash prize of Rs. 20,000, Rs.15,000 and Rs. 10,000 will be given to
first, second and  third winners of the group respectively.

10. Plagiarism and direct copying of implementation/coding from web or
anywhere noticed  will be rejected.

11. The decision of Judges will be final.

12. Online presentations will not be entertained.

13. Only one entry is allowed for a candidate.




-- 
K V Biju
Technical Officer | IIT Palakkad
Ahalia Integrated Campus | Kozhippara PO | Palakkad Dist | Kerala 678557
Call: +91-4923 226 309/390
GSM:+91-9497718136/8281112815 | Email:kvbiju@iitpkd.ac.in
<kvbiju@iitpkd.ac.in>
https://iitpkd.ac.in/people/biju <http://iitpkd.ac.in>

CS5617-M-2022 -> Forums -> Announcements -> Quiz on Friday (Sep 30)
https://lms.iitpkd.ac.in/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=490#p548
Quiz on Friday (Sep 30)
by Ramaswamy Krishnan Chittur - Wednesday, 28 September 2022, 4:09 PM
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Hi folks:

Friendly reminder that the quiz is on Friday (Sep 30). We'll start at 2PM
in our usual classroom in Ahalia campus, and the duration is 50 minutes.
Please checkout the sample quizzes and solutions that I already posted.

We'll continue our regular class session soon after the quiz is over.

_Instructions_:

* This is a closed book examination. Please keep phones, text books, notes
etc. away from you. Just keep your pen with you.
* Kindly keep your distance from the other students.
* Write your answers in the question paper itself, there should be enough
blank space provided.
* The exam is for 50 minutes only, no extensions.
* I trust that all students will follow the exam code of honor.

Thank you, and good luck!

---------------------------------------------------------------------
This is a copy of a message posted in CS5617-M-2022.

https://lms.iitpkd.ac.in/mod/forum/index.php?id=121

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dean Administration IIT Palakkad <deanadmn@iitpkd.ac.in>
Date: Wed, Sep 28, 2022 at 12:14 PM
Subject: Fwd: Inviting applications from college innovators and early-stage
startups in low carbon & sustainability for IIT Madras organized the
pan-India contest. Winners get Rs 5 lakhs and expert incubation support
To: Industry Liaison Officer IIT Palakkad <ilo@iitpkd.ac.in>, Chief
Innovation Officer IIT Palakkad <cio@iitpkd.ac.in>, Anuradha Shankar <
anuradha@iitpkd.ac.in>


Dear  Colleagues,

      This is for your information and necessary action.

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Carbon Zero Challenge <carbonzerochallenge@gmail.com>
Date: Wed 28 Sep, 2022, 10:35 AM
Subject: Inviting applications from college innovators and early-stage
startups in low carbon & sustainability for IIT Madras organized the
pan-India contest. Winners get Rs 5 lakhs and expert incubation support
To:


Dear Sir/Madam

Greetings from IIT Madras!

We are glad to inform you that the third edition of Carbon Zero Challenge
(CZC), an All India Eco-Innovation and Entrepreneurship competition was
launched on 24 August 2022. CZC 2022 aims to accelerate the lab-to-market
transition of eco-innovations in India by funding innovations from
proof-of-concept, lab-scale solutions to working prototypes or pilots.

The Theme for CZC2022 is CZC for CRC  “Circularity in Resources
Conservation”. CZC 2022 would focus on fostering innovative solutions
incorporating circularity and sustainability for managing and conserving
the following resources - Air, Water, Soil, Materials, and Energy.

If you are a college faculty or student, or an early stage startup
innovating in any of the above domains and interested in implementing your
technology in the field through entrepreneurship, we strongly encourage you
and your team to apply for CZeroC.

The deadline for application is Oct 10, 2022. We will be shortlisting about
100 teams, of which  25 teams will be given prototype funding up to Rs 5
lakhs per team. The teams will be connected to experts in industry and
academia to hone their technical and business skills. Based on their
performance, the CZC winners in the final evaluation get a 10 lakhs startup
seed grant and continued support, including access to the IITM incubation
ecosystem.

Please check out our website http://www.czeroc.in for more details and the
application portal.

We look forward to participation from college/university faculty,
innovative students and early-stage startups to register teams.



If you have any questions about the competition, please write to us at
czeroc@iitm.ac.in

Extended deadline:10 October 2022
Thanks & Regards,
Team CZC 2022
IIT Madras
www.czeroc.in
Call: 956609298

*HEART-HEALING ENERGY BALL *

♦ Sit or stand comfortably and let all the muscles in your body relax.
  ♦ Cup your hands as if you are making a snowball, but don’t let your two
hands touch.
♦ Breathe in and out, visualizing the exhale bringing energy from your head
down through your hands.
  ♦ Envision a vortex of positive healing energy being cultivated inside
your hands.
  ♦ Observe any sensations inside of your hands.
  ♦ Place the energy ball into your heart center, smiling, and taking a few
deep breaths to receive the healing energy in your heart.

*For your kind information*



Hello,

Greetings from StrategyCo.Global!

We would like to invite students from all the batches of IIT Palakkad to
participate in the following opportunity.

*About Crash Course cum Competition :* With the successful completion of 7+
cohorts of Management Consulting Bootcamp and National Level Case Study
Competitions*, StrategyCo.Global is back with its one-of-a-kind Crash
Course. *

On a mission to accelerate the careers of aspiring management consultants,
we are conducting the course of case action to continue the legacy of
providing an unparalleled learning experience.

The crash course is structured to help you understand the know-how of
management consulting and will test your data interpretation - logical
reasoning insight while focusing on your creativity to solve a particular
set of cases.

The crash course is a must for students preparing for their placements,
aspirants who want to hone their case-solving skills on understanding
multiple industry problems, and job opportunity networking.

The participant will be given a time of 1 month to proactively solve 24
short case studies.  The exclusive cases comprise 7+ different case types
across 5+ industries.

The participant will receive personalized feedback curated by our expert
team along with the solution of the case study to enhance the learning
experience.

Get a chance to join a community of 5000+ like minded individuals and grow
your networking skills.


Module Structure :


Cost - This is a free crash course, no cost is involved

Number of Modules: 4
Cases in Each Module: 5 (Practice cases) +1 (Test case)
Time per case required: 1 Hour

Mode - SCG’S Online platform
Duration - October 2022

Time Commitment required - 24 flexible hours
Evaluation- Short tests as a performance indicator

What’s in it for you:

   -

   Exciting prizes worth up to 1,00,000
   -

   Consulting Mentorship from Industry experts
   -

   Internship opportunities at StrategyCo.Global
   -

   Amazon Vouchers
   -

   Premium subscription to Netflix, Amazon, LinkedIn, Swiggy, and Spotify
   -

   Access to educational platforms like Canva, Case course access.
   -

   Electronics goodies such as airpods, powerbanks etc
   -

   Merit-Based Certificates
   -

   Live case-solving sessions with senior consultants.
   -

   Direct entry to Bootcamp by SCG.



To register, follow this link - Here
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/16MPoIAQ5Yje-eyh0_K1C7YI1xVJ59CyBpd5g3rnucZE/edit>

Kindly join the telegram group to know more about the next steps - Here
<https://t.me/+1OsERC585YYzZWI1>

For any queries feel free to contact us at +91 85953 09041
Or write back to us at scgcasestudyprogram@strategycoglobal.com


<scgcasestudyprogram@strategycoglobal.com>Best Regards,
Team StrategyCo.Global

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: TIH IIT Mandi <tih@iitmandi.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Sep 26, 2022 at 5:09 PM
Subject: 4th Hybrid Winter School on Cognitive Modeling
To: Debdoot Sheet <debdoot@ee.iitkgp.ac.in>
Cc: Volga Verma <volga@ihubiitmandi.in>


Hello Sir/ Madam,

Greetings of the day!

IIT Mandi iHub and HCI Foundation is organizing the 4th Hybrid Winter
School on Cognitive Modeling from 16-18 October 2022. The workshop is in
Hybrid Mode (Online as well as Offline mode). It is open to all:

   -

   Undergraduate Students
   -

   Master's Degree Students
   -

   PH.D. Students
   -

   Post Doctoral Fellows
   -

   Faculty/ Researchers/ Scientists


What is Cognitive modeling?

It is an area of computer science that deals with simulating human
problem-solving and mental processing in a computerized model. Such a model
can be used to simulate or predict human behavior or performance on tasks
similar to the ones modeled and improve human-computer interaction.

The benefits of learning Cognitive Modeling:

   -

   Cognitive modeling is used in numerous artificial intelligence (AI)
   applications, such as expert systems, natural language processing, neural
   networks, and in robotics and virtual reality applications.
   -

   Cognitive models are also used to improve products in manufacturing
   segments, such as human factors, engineering, and computer game and user
   interface design.


The major objectives of the Winter School:

   -

   To provide a forum to train students, researchers, and professionals on
   the best practices in the area of cognitive modeling.
   -

   To provide a forum for trained students and researchers to work with
   leaders and pioneers in the cognitive modeling domain.
   -

   Expose researchers to state-of-the-art models in basic and applied
   domains.
   -

   Involve top international researchers in the area of cognitive modeling
   to present their work as part of the winter school.


Registration Fee:

(For Offline, Boarding and Lodging are included in fees)


   -

   UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS

Online: 500 INR

Offline: 6000 INR


   -

   MASTER'S STUDENT

Online: 1000 INR

Offline: 6500 INR


   -

   PH.D. STUDENTS

Online: 1500 INR

Offline: 7000 INR


   -

   POSTDOCTORAL FELLOWS

Online: 1500 INR

Offline: 7000 INR


   -

   FACULTY/RESEARCHERS/SCIENTISTS

Online: 2000 INR

Offline: 7500 INR

Important Dates

15.09.2022

Application for Winter School Begins

10.10.2022

Last Date for Submitting Applications

Link to Apply

http://www.acslab.org/winterschool/index.php



About IIT Mandi iHub and HCI Foundation: The iHub is a section 8 company
established under the National Mission on Interdisciplinary, Cyber-Physical
Systems (NM-ICPS). The vision of iHub is to make India a leader in HCI
research and applications in the world. Based on faculty strengths,
industry collaborations, and ongoing projects, our focus is on the
following: Technology (interface) Development, Evaluation, HRD & Skill
Development, Entrepreneurship, and Collaborations. For more information,
visit- http://iitmandi.ac.in/TIH-HCI/

*****************************************************

Hi all,
Hope you all are doing good.
I am so excited to say that now YOGSHALA <Yogshala@iitpkd.ac.in> is an
official cultural club of our Institute.
Since we don't have a logo for our club yet.
So, We are having a logo making contest to select a logo that will be the
face of our club and will showcase our club's features.

The maker of the selected logo will receive:
●cash prize worth 1000 Rs.
●The credit of designing the logo that will be cherished by us

For submission, please upload your logo and other requirements to drive and
attach drive link to the given google form, with access given to
Yogshala@iitpkd.ac.in

google form link : YOGSHALA LOGO MAKING CONTEST
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeAB08Lgc0h_Q-qcVYtXbcJpE4NpXzfXIl377u_hPStUTWu9w/viewform?vc=0&c=0&w=1&flr=0&pli=1>


Minimum Requirements:
●JPEG and PNG (No background image)
●Light and Dark themes of the logo
●Software file that you worked on( .psd, .eps )
●Mention the name of the fonts or/and source of any royalty-free images
that you have used
●Logo should be unique and no copyright should be violated.
●Give a brief description of your logo as a document
● By submitting a design for the contest, the contestants agree to transfer
the copyright/full rights on the design to SAC -Cultural Affairs of IIT
Palakkad

For any further queries reply to this mail or contact
9319570167
[image: Yogshala logo design contest.jpeg]
-- 
--
Regards,
Dipanshu dutta
Deputy Secretary, Yogshala
Indian Institute of Technology, Palakkad
Contact No:9319570167

*Sl. No*

*Title*

*Author*

1

The Art of Statistics: Learning from Data

David Spiegelhalter

2

Boolean Function Complexity: Advances and Frontiers

Stasys Jukna

3

C How to Program: With an introduction to C++

Paul Deitel

4

Combinatorial Optimization

William J. Cook

5

Combinatorial Optimization: Algorithms and Complexity

C. H. Papadimitriou

6

Geometric Algorithms and Combinatorial Optimization

Martin Grötschel

7

Introduction to Circuit Complexity: A Uniform Approach

Heribert Vollmer

8

Introduction to Coding Theory

J. H. van Lint

9

Modern Applications of Automata Theory

Deepak D'Souza

10

Theory of Computational Complexity

Ding-Zu Du

*+* Error Control Coding: Fundamentals and Applications by *Shu Lin*

*+* Theory of Computation by *Dexter C. Kozen*



*Warm Regards, *


*“Handle a book as a bee does a flower, extract its sweetness but do not
damage it” *

*― John Muir*

> *Dear Students and Faculty Members,*
>
> *NTU India Connect Research Internship Programme *is a unique internship
> offered by NTU, Singapore customised for high calibre Indian bachelor,
> master, and PhD students from pre-eminent Indian universities and colleges
> to pursue their research interests at NTU.  *The upcoming term is *from *4th
> January 2023 to 4 June 2023*.
>
>
> *Deadline*
>
> *Nomination: 26th September ( Faculty to nominate students to
> iar@iitpkd.ac.in <iar@iitpkd.ac.in> )*
>
> *Application : 30th September (Only the students nominated will be
> permitted to submit application)*
>
>
>   *Application Process*
>
>    - Nominations of *up to 5 students* by IIT Palakkad. Only the students
>    recommended by the university will be considered for the programme.
>
>
>    - Research projects available with NTU faculty from various colleges
>    and schools for the internship are found in this link
>    https://www.ntu.edu.sg/about-us/global/india-connect-ntu/research-projects.
>    Nominated students must only pick from this list.
>
>
>    - The nominated students must submit their application to NTU India
>    Connect Programme latest by 30 September 2022. Applications received after
>    the deadline will not be considered
>    https://venus2.wis.ntu.edu.sg/NG_APP/LoginIC.aspx.
>
>
>    - Selected students will be notified and made an offer in 6-8 weeks
>    after which they will start the process of visa application
>
>
>
>
> * The following information/documents to be submitted for the application
> process:*
> 1. Personal particulars
> 2. Academic qualifications (e.g. college/university education, period of
> study, qualifications obtained, etc)
> 3. Selection of Courses to read
> 4. Soft copy of your photo
> 5. Soft copy of your latest official transcripts (in English)
> 6. Soft copy of your passport
> 7. Academic Referee Letters (2 of such letters will be required)
> 8. Recommendation Letter
>
> Note: The Academic Referee Letters and Recommendation Letter are
> mandatory for submission of your application. Please have them ready upon
> completing the application form. Late and/or incomplete applications will
> not be processed.
>
>
>
> *Expenses Covered*
>
>

>

>    - Full tuition fees waiver of $16,850
>    - Stipend of S$500 per month
>    - Free on-campus accommodation
>    - Airfare allowance of $500
>    - Visa and Miscellaneous Fee
>
>

> To learn more: https://www.ntu.edu.sg/about-us/global/india-connect-ntu.
>

> graduate students and is globally recognised for its leadership in

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: International and Alumni Relations IIT Palakkad <iar@iitpkd.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Sep 19, 2022 at 8:30 PM
Subject: Fwd: NTU Singapore India Connect Research Internship Programme
To: <students@iitpkd.ac.in>, <faculty@iitpkd.ac.in>
Cc: Deepak R <deepak@iitpkd.ac.in>, Sovan Lal Das <sovan@iitpkd.ac.in>,
International Relations IIT Palakkad <ir_office@iitpkd.ac.in>, Joel Jeffrey
<122001018@smail.iitpkd.ac.in>


*Dear Students and Faculty Members,*

*NTU India Connect Research Internship Programme *is a unique internship
offered by NTU, Singapore customised for high calibre Indian bachelor,
master, and PhD students from pre-eminent Indian universities and colleges
to pursue their research interests at NTU.  *The upcoming term is *from *4th
January 2023 to 4 June 2023*.


*Deadline*

*Nomination: 26th September ( Faculty to nominate students to
iar@iitpkd.ac.in <iar@iitpkd.ac.in> )*

*Application : 30th September (Only the students nominated will be
permitted to submit application)*


  *Application Process*

   - Nominations of *up to 5 students* by IIT Palakkad. Only the students
   recommended by the university will be considered for the programme.


   - Research projects available with NTU faculty from various colleges and
   schools for the internship are found in this link
   https://www.ntu.edu.sg/about-us/global/india-connect-ntu/research-projects.
   Nominated students must only pick from this list.


   - The nominated students must submit their application to NTU India
   Connect Programme latest by 30 September 2022. Applications received after
   the deadline will not be considered
   https://venus2.wis.ntu.edu.sg/NG_APP/LoginIC.aspx.


   - Selected students will be notified and made an offer in 6-8 weeks
   after which they will start the process of visa application




* The following information/documents to be submitted for the application
process:*
1. Personal particulars
2. Academic qualifications (e.g. college/university education, period of
study, qualifications obtained, etc)
3. Selection of Courses to read
4. Soft copy of your photo
5. Soft copy of your latest official transcripts (in English)
6. Soft copy of your passport
7. Academic Referee Letters (2 of such letters will be required)
8. Recommendation Letter

Note: The Academic Referee Letters and Recommendation Letter are mandatory
for submission of your application. Please have them ready upon completing
the application form. Late and/or incomplete applications will not be
processed.



*Expenses Covered*



The NTU India Connect Research Internship Award covers:



   - Full tuition fees waiver of $16,850
   - Stipend of S$500 per month
   - Free on-campus accommodation
   - Airfare allowance of $500
   - Visa and Miscellaneous Fee



To learn more: https://www.ntu.edu.sg/about-us/global/india-connect-ntu.



*About NTU, Singapore*





Ranked amongst the top 20 universities globally by QS World Rankings and
the World's Number 1 Young University for seven consecutive years, NTU is a
world-leading research led university. It has 33,000 undergraduate and
graduate students and is globally recognised for its leadership in
engineering, business, science, technology, medicine, humanities, arts, and
social sciences, international relations, and education. Besides being
reputed as one of the world's most beautiful campuses, the NTU Smart Campus
is a living testbed of tomorrow's technologies and a model of
sustainability, with 61 Green Mark Platinum awards for its building
projects. NTU is home to world-class institutes such as the National
Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth
Observatory of Singapore, and the Singapore Centre for Environmental Life
Sciences Engineering. In addition, some of the world's leading companies,
including HP, Ali Baba, Rolls-Royce, Delta, and others, have corporate and
joint labs on campus focused on accelerating the translation and
commercialization of cutting-edge research and innovation. For more
information about NTU, please click here <https://www.ntu.edu.sg/>.



[image: PM visits Nanyang Technological University]




Thanking you,


With regards

Kavitha

*****************************************************

*Dear Students and Faculty Members,*

*NTU India Connect Research Internship Programme *is a unique internship
offered by NTU, Singapore customised for high calibre Indian bachelor,
master, and PhD students from pre-eminent Indian universities and colleges
to pursue their research interests at NTU.  *The upcoming term is *from *4th
January 2023 to 4 June 2023*.


*Deadline*

*Nomination: 26th September ( Faculty to nominate students to
iar@iitpkd.ac.in <iar@iitpkd.ac.in> )*

*Application : 30th September (Only the students nominated will be
permitted to submit application)*


  *Application Process*

   - Nominations of *up to 5 students* by IIT Palakkad. Only the students
   recommended by the university will be considered for the programme.


   - Research projects available with NTU faculty from various colleges and
   schools for the internship are found in this link
   https://www.ntu.edu.sg/about-us/global/india-connect-ntu/research-projects.
   Nominated students must only pick from this list.


   - The nominated students must submit their application to NTU India
   Connect Programme latest by 30 September 2022. Applications received after
   the deadline will not be considered
   https://venus2.wis.ntu.edu.sg/NG_APP/LoginIC.aspx.


   - Selected students will be notified and made an offer in 6-8 weeks
   after which they will start the process of visa application




* The following information/documents to be submitted for the application
process:*
1. Personal particulars
2. Academic qualifications (e.g. college/university education, period of
study, qualifications obtained, etc)
3. Selection of Courses to read
4. Soft copy of your photo
5. Soft copy of your latest official transcripts (in English)
6. Soft copy of your passport
7. Academic Referee Letters (2 of such letters will be required)
8. Recommendation Letter

Note: The Academic Referee Letters and Recommendation Letter are mandatory
for submission of your application. Please have them ready upon completing
the application form. Late and/or incomplete applications will not be
processed.



*Expenses Covered*



The NTU India Connect Research Internship Award covers:



   - Full tuition fees waiver of $16,850
   - Stipend of S$500 per month
   - Free on-campus accommodation
   - Airfare allowance of $500
   - Visa and Miscellaneous Fee



To learn more: https://www.ntu.edu.sg/about-us/global/india-connect-ntu.



*About NTU, Singapore*





Ranked amongst the top 20 universities globally by QS World Rankings and
the World's Number 1 Young University for seven consecutive years, NTU is a
world-leading research led university. It has 33,000 undergraduate and
graduate students and is globally recognised for its leadership in
engineering, business, science, technology, medicine, humanities, arts, and
social sciences, international relations, and education. Besides being
reputed as one of the world's most beautiful campuses, the NTU Smart Campus
is a living testbed of tomorrow's technologies and a model of
sustainability, with 61 Green Mark Platinum awards for its building
projects. NTU is home to world-class institutes such as the National
Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth
Observatory of Singapore, and the Singapore Centre for Environmental Life
Sciences Engineering. In addition, some of the world's leading companies,
including HP, Ali Baba, Rolls-Royce, Delta, and others, have corporate and
joint labs on campus focused on accelerating the translation and
commercialization of cutting-edge research and innovation. For more
information about NTU, please click here <https://www.ntu.edu.sg/>.



[image: PM visits Nanyang Technological University]




Thanking you,


With regards

Kavitha

FWd...
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Placement Cell IIT Palakkad <placement@iitpkd.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Sep 26, 2022 at 3:24 PM
Subject: Fwd: Accenture Japan: Special Webinar
To: <tpo@iitpkd.ac.in>



---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Accenture Japan <accenture@asiatojapan.com>
Date: Mon, 26 Sep, 2022, 1:30 pm
Subject: Accenture Japan: Special Webinar
To: placement@iitpkd.ac.in <placement@iitpkd.ac.in>


Dear IIT Career and Placement Office,

Greetings. I am writing to inform you that Accenture Japan will be holding
a special online seminar on: “Guide to Working in Japan for Women,” and
would like to know whether your students would be interested in joining in.

Through the years of hiring through IIT’s placements, Accenture Japan has
had an experience wherein candidates (mostly females) had reservations in
taking up a post away from India due to concerns about safety, possible
treatment, and worries of their parents.
The company would like to help in addressing this situation and give a free
online seminar about what it is like to live and work in Japan especially
for females.

The details are as follows:
*PRESENTED BY:* Accenture Japan Ltd.
*DATE:* 28th September, 2022;

30th September 2022
*You may choose which to attend depending on your availability

*TIME:* 12:00-13:10 IST
*VENUE:* Zoom
*PARTICIPANTS:* Anyone (max. 1000 people)
*REGISTRATION:* We require registration for the webinar to better estimate
the number of people who will be attending.

Registration Link:
*https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/1516641547143/WN_xs4xrDHcT_SgoOXyWha5PQ
<https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/1516641547143/WN_xs4xrDHcT_SgoOXyWha5PQ>*



While the content of the online seminar mainly focuses on the experience of
women in Accenture Japan, there will also be a lot of information on Japan
and what it is like to work and live in the country in general, as well as
the common onboarding practices, so even male participants are welcome to
join and listen. We also highly encourage the parents of the students to
join so that they may directly address their worries via asking questions.
Students from lower years who are greatly considering a career in Japan may
also join.

We would greatly appreciate it, if you could share this information with
your students and encourage them to join.
Please note that while the contents of this online seminar is
career-related, we do not consider this as a part of the placement process
and participation is not required to apply for Accenture Japan.

Through these efforts, we hope to see more and more candidates be open to
career options in Japan in the future.

Thank you. Hoping for a positive response.


Sincerely yours,
Accenture Japan Hiring Partner




-- 
Regards,

*Santhosh Kumar R*
*Training and Placement Officer*
*Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad *

*Transit Campus,*

*Near Gramalakshmi Mudralayam,*

*Pudussery West, Palakkad - 678 623,*

*Kerala*
*Contact No: 04923 226591/9497718137*
*tpo@iitpkd.ac.in <tpo@iitpkd.ac.in> *
*www.iitpkd.ac.in* <http://www.iitpkd.ac.in/>

On Thu, Sep 22, 2022 at 5:51 PM Uma Divakaran <uma@iitpkd.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear all,
>
> Dr. Tanay Nag, who is a postdoctoral fellow at RWTH Aachen University,
> Germany, will be presenting an online seminar on 27th September (Tuesday)
> with the details as follows
>
> Speaker: Dr. Tanay Nag
>
> Title: Dynamical construction of Quadrupolar and Octupolar topological
> superconductors
>
> Time: 4:30 pm
>
> Zoom link details: https://zoom.us/j/95139854192
>                              Meeting ID: *951 3985 4192*
>
> Abstract:  We propose a three-step periodic drive protocol to engineer
> two-dimensional~(2D) Floquet quadrupole superconductors and
> three-dimensional~(3D) Floquet octupole superconductors hosting
> zero-dimensional Majorana corner modes~(MCMs), based on unconventional
> d-wave superconductivity. Remarkably, the driven system conceives four
> phases with only 0 MCMs, no MCMs, only anomalous π MCMs, and both regular 0
> and anomalous π MCMs. To circumvent the subtle issue of characterizing 0
> and π MCMs separately, we employ the periodized evolution operator to
> architect the dynamical invariants, namely quadrupole and octupole motion
> in 2D and 3D, respectively, that can distinguish different higher order
> topological phases unambiguously. Our study paves the way for the
> realization of dynamical quadrupolar and octupolar topological
> superconductors.
>
> Ref: Phys. Rev. B 105, 155406 (2022)
>
> All interested are welcome to attend !!!
>
> Best,
> Uma
> --
> Uma Divakaran,
> Assistant Professor (Physics),
> Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad,
> Kerala.
>


-- 
Uma Divakaran,
Assistant Professor (Physics),
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad,
Kerala.


*****************************************************

Dear all,

Dr. Tanay Nag, who is a postdoctoral fellow at RWTH Aachen University,
Germany, will be presenting an online seminar on 27th September (Tuesday)
with the details as follows

Speaker: Dr. Tanay Nag

Title: Dynamical construction of Quadrupolar and Octupolar topological
superconductors

Time: 4:30 pm

Zoom link details: https://zoom.us/j/95139854192
                             Meeting ID: *951 3985 4192*

Abstract:  We propose a three-step periodic drive protocol to engineer
two-dimensional~(2D) Floquet quadrupole superconductors and
three-dimensional~(3D) Floquet octupole superconductors hosting
zero-dimensional Majorana corner modes~(MCMs), based on unconventional
d-wave superconductivity. Remarkably, the driven system conceives four
phases with only 0 MCMs, no MCMs, only anomalous π MCMs, and both regular 0
and anomalous π MCMs. To circumvent the subtle issue of characterizing 0
and π MCMs separately, we employ the periodized evolution operator to
architect the dynamical invariants, namely quadrupole and octupole motion
in 2D and 3D, respectively, that can distinguish different higher order
topological phases unambiguously. Our study paves the way for the
realization of dynamical quadrupolar and octupolar topological
superconductors.

Ref: Phys. Rev. B 105, 155406 (2022)

All interested are welcome to attend !!!

Best,
Uma
-- 
Uma Divakaran,
Assistant Professor (Physics),
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad,
Kerala.

Dear Students,
All are requested to register their cycle in the below link and get it
numbered from the Hostel office *on or before 03/09/2022*. Those who have
already registered and numbered their cycle may ignore this mail. For
numbering the cycles, Ahalia campus students may contact Hostel-1
office(Room No 25) and Nila campus students may contact Tilang B
office(room no 213-A) only during office hours between 9am to 5pm.

*Note: Cycles without numbers will be confiscated by the hostel office and
put for auction at a later date. *

Dear All,
The BSNL team has been working throughout since yesterday to resolve the
issue. They have identified the location where the cable has been broken
and working on it.

Furthermore, there is an issue with NKN at NIC Trivandrum level. Hence, the
Internet connectivity at Ahalia Campus is also affected.

The following services will also be unavailable until the issue is
resolved.

1. Main website
2. Moodle, LMS

The inconvenience caused is regretted


Thanks
With Regards,
CET

*****************************************************

Dear All,

The OFC connecting Ahalia and NIla Campus is down due to a break at
Kanjikode. Consequently, The Internet connectivity at Nila campus is
affected.
However, The  limited failover Internet connectivity is available through
RailTel. But the users will experience the sluggish connection due to less
bandwidth. Please avoid heavy download and video streaming till  the issue
is resolved.


The following services are also affected.
1. Admission and Recruitment portals.
2. All the hosted subdomains.
3. License Servers will not be accessible at Nila.


Thanks
With regards,
TeamCET

*****************************************************

Dear All,
   Please find attached the presentation from the company. The online test
is scheduled tentatively on Sep 14, 2022. The tentative rounds of the
process are as follows.

*1. Online Technical Test*

*2. Online Personality Profiling:* All the shortlisted applicants will have
to take an Online Personality Profiling Questionnaire

*3. Group Discussion*

*4. Personal Interviews*

Warm Regards,
Yagnesh Katragadda
BTech Overall coordinator
CDC, Indian Institute of Technology, Palakkad
Contact No: +91 9908183474
Email: 111901027@smail.iitpkd.ac.in

*****************************************************

Dear all,
             You need to do 3 registrations for applying to the ICICI Job
profile.
              i. Registration In CDC
              ii. Fill the Google form given below link
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/13AqBtC4B510CVG9OV8RKPI7aryvCEPhLukCe7EDGNv4/edit?ts=6311a79a>
.
              iii. Register in the ICICI bank careers page link
<https://www.icicicareers.com/Careers/CP/Requirementapply.aspx?IsProcess=0>.
 KIndly do all registration's before the deadline,* don't miss out any
registration*. All three processes are mandatory.
                      The deadline for application is* 5 pm, 06 Sep 2022.*

*Instruction for applying in ICICI careers page:*
      *1. Online Applications-*The students will also be required to apply
online on ICICI Bank careers page:
https://www.icicicareers.com/Careers/CP/Requirementapply.aspx?IsProcess=0

   - Submit the resume on the link "Apply"
   - After completion of the resume, click on "Submit Resume"
   - Wait for a message that your resume has been submitted successfully
   - A confirmatory mail will be sent to you on successful application
   - A Login Id will be allotted on successful application, the applicant
   is requested to retain this ID for future and mention the same in all the
   correspondences to us

*****************************************************

Hello Everyone,

Warm greetings from the Machine Learning Group and CREDS at IIT Palakkad.

We would like to invite you to the Florence Nightingale Data Science Talk
Series, held on the last Saturday of every month at 11 AM IST. This time,
on *24/09/2022*, we have *Prof. Balaraman Ravindran, Professor, Indian
Institute of Technology Madras*, to deliver a talk on *Reinforcement
Learning with Structured Actions and Policies.*

Prof. Balaraman Ravindran is the Mindtree Faculty Fellow and Professor in
the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at IIT Madras. He heads
the Robert Bosch Centre for Data Science & Artificial Intelligence
(RBCDSAI) at IIT Madras. He is also a senior member of the Association for
Advancement of AI (AAAI) and an ACM Distinguished Member. He received his
PhD from the University of Massachusetts, Amherst and his Master’s degree
from the Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore.
His research interests are centred on learning from and through
interactions and span the areas of geometric deep learning and
reinforcement learning.


Check out our official website <https://mlgiitpkd.github.io/dst.html> for
more details on the talk series. The meeting will be online on Zoom and is
open to all.



Feel free to contact us if you have any questions.



Meet link: https://zoom.us/j/92885815960


Thanks and Regards,

Eva Cherian

Machine Learning Group, IIT Palakkad

https://mlgiitpkd.github.io

CREDS

creds@iitpkd.ac.in

international conference held at Langkawi, Malaysia on 18 Sep-21 Sep 2022.

Uma

and Dr Dinesh Jagadeesan (Chemistry) received the second runner up award in

held at Langkawi, Malaysia on 18 Sep-21 Sep 2022.

sensor for the detection of dopamine by Nb4C3Tx-MoS2 2D-2D hetero
structures".

*****************************************************

*English Idioms*

1. Cut to the chase

When somebody tells you to cut to the chase it means that you’ve been
talking too long and haven’t gotten to the point. When a person uses this
idiom, they’re telling you to hurry up and get to the important part,
without all the details. Be careful how you use this idiom, because if used
while talking to someone like a college professor or your boss, it’s rude
and disrespectful.

If you’re speaking to a group of people, like your employees, and say I’m
going to cut to the chase, it means that there are a few things that need
to be said but there’s very little time, so you’ll skip to the important
parts so everyone understands.

“Hi guys, as we don’t have much time here, so I’m going to cut to the
chase. We’ve been having some major problems in the office lately.”


2. Up in the air

When we literally think about something being up in the air, we have the
idea that something’s floating or flying in the sky, perhaps an airplane or
a balloon. But really if someone tells you that things are up in the air it
means that these things are uncertain or unsure. Definite plans have not
been made yet.

“Maya, have you set a date for the wedding yet?”

“Not exactly, things are up in the air and we’re not sure if our families
can make it on the day we wanted. Hopefully we’ll know soon and we’ll let
you know as soon as possible.”

3. On the ball

If you look at this phrase literally, it means to be either standing or
sitting on a ball—but who would do that?

If you’re on the ball it means that you’re very quick to understand certain
things, very prepared for something or react quickly (and correctly) to a
situation.

For example, if you’re planning an event/seminar that’s still one year away
from now and you’ve almost finished with all the planning already, you’re
definitely on the ball because not many people are that prepared!

“Wow, you’ve already finished your assignments? They aren’t due until next
week, you’re really on the ball. I wish I could be more organized.”

4. Get over something

If you think about it, it’s possible to literally get over something, for
example get over a fence—but this is not how the phrase is generally used
in the English language.

Imagine having a really difficult time, like a celebrity going through a
divorce—it’s hard. But eventually once time passes and they no longer think
about their ex, it means that they’ve gotten over him/her, or, if related
to you, you no longer worry about it and it no longer affects you in a
negative way. It’s also possible to get over an illness, which would mean
that you’ve fully recovered.

“How’s Priya? Has she gotten over the death of her dog yet?”

“I think so. She’s already talking about getting a new one.”


5. Look like a million dollars/bucks

Wouldn’t it be great if we really could look like a million dollars? We’d
be rich, but that’s not the case. If someone tells you that you look like a
million bucks, you should take it as a huge compliment because it means you
look absolutely fabulous and really attractive.

While sometimes we use this idiom for guys, it’s more commonly used to
compliment women. And while some of your female friends may look beautiful
every day, you should save this one for when they’ve really made an effort
and it’s a special occasion, like a festival celebration or a wedding.

“Wow, Farzana, you look like a million dollars/bucks this evening. I love
your hairstyle and dress!”

regards, Sandhya

-- 
English Language Support & Services
IIT Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/elss

*****************************************************

Hello folks,
hope you all are doing well.

*Swachhta Pakhwada* was initiated in 2016 with an objective of bringing a
fortnight of intense focus onto issues and practices of cleanliness. In
accordance with that, the EBSB club of IIT Palakkad is organising the
following events to mark the commencement of *Swachhta Pakhwada* from 11th
to 25th September:


   -
*Catch-a-phrase *

A slogan writing competition in collaboration with *Akshar*.
Submit your entries through this <https://forms.gle/SrY7PmY7JY2cAhG59> google
form on or before 11:59 PM, 24th September.


   - *Swachh*

A poster designing competition in collaboration with *Grafica*.
Submit your entries through this <https://forms.gle/ETLmF9EJnZUgNFSg7> google
form on or before 11:59 PM, 24th September in jpg/jpeg format.


   - *Swachhta quiz*

A quiz competition in collaboration with *Qriosity* with the motive of
checking the basic knowledge of students about sanitation, environmental
responsibilities and related topics. It will be conducted offline on 19th
September.
Interested students may register (individually or in teams of two) through
this <https://forms.gle/s5KTZPoG9fexPFbD6> google form.

Winners and participants will be awarded *points* in the respective *club's
leaderboard*.
The rules and dates can be found in the poster attached below. Hoping to
see active participation from the student community.

Furthermore, another connecting mail will be sent soon to spread awareness
on waste segregation and colour coding of dustbins.
Feel free to contact us with any queries.

-- 


*Thanks and Regards*
*Yash Mittal*
*EBSB Secretary*

*Instagram: ebsb.iitpalakkad <https://www.instagram.com/ebsb.iitpkd/>*
*Contact no: 8295512850 *

*****************************************************

Kind attention to  Students of  Nila Hostels

Dear Students,
We have received complaints regarding internet issues at Hostels in Nila
Campus.
The reason is that some students have connected untrusted rouge devices to
our network.
Those devices are causing connection issues for others in the hostels of
Nila Campus.
The rest of the network in the campus is being protected by us.
We have provided wired LAN connections to all the students. Please connect
only your laptop to these points.

To resolve this issue, please remove all the connected Access Points/
untrusted Wi-Fi routers from your rooms.

We have identified such rooms and visited them, but some of the rooms were
locked .
As per our network policy, students are not allowed to connect untrusted
rouge APs to the Institute network.

If your device does not have a LAN port, please use a RJ45 (LAN port) to
USB converter.

Thanks
With Regards,
Biju

-- 
K V Biju
Technical Officer | IIT Palakkad
Ahalia Integrated Campus | Kozhippara PO | Palakkad Dist | Kerala 678557
Call: +91-4923 226 309/390
GSM:+91-9497718136/8281112815 | Email:kvbiju@iitpkd.ac.in
<kvbiju@iitpkd.ac.in>

From: Chief Innovation Officer IIT Palakkad <cio@iitpkd.ac.in>

*Dear All,*

*Gentle reminder please.*

*Response so far is quite poor.*

*As the YUKTI-NIR data is considered seriously by MoE & AICTE and directly
related to Institute's rating IIC star & ARIIA, all students, faculty and
staff are once again requested to register and enter idea/innovation/start

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Chief Innovation Officer IIT Palakkad <cio@iitpkd.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Sep 19, 2022 at 6:22 PM
Subject: YUKTI - NIR
To: <broadcast@iitpkd.ac.in>


Dear All,

Greetings from CSQUARE Innovation Lab !!!

Let me introduce YUKTI- NIR to you.

YUKTI – National Innovation Repository (NIR) is an initiative of the
Ministry of Education (MoE) Government of India and is implemented by MoE’s
Innovation Cell and AICTE to build a system of repository of ideas,
innovations and startups developed in academic institutions and enabling
institutions to systematically foster the I&E culture by managing and
nurturing these innovations by offering continuous support in terms of
one-to-one mentorship, grant assistance, referral and linkage with
incubation units, connecting with Angel/Venture Capital (VC) investors
network, knowledge agencies, etc.



All *Students, Faculty and Staff* are requested to register themselves in
the YUKTI portal and submit  application of Idea/Innovation/Start-up if
any, using the following link:

 https://yukti.mic.gov.in/login/SUMyMDE4MTE0OTk=

Alumni, Recent Graduates, Entrepreneur & Startup Founders incubated at
TECHIN/IPTIF are also welcome.

The above link is meant only for IIT, Palakkad. Seperate tab is provided
for idea, innovation and start up. Guidelines/FAQ for filing the
application is attached herewith. You may use the following link to get a
video about YUKTI and filing applications in the National Innovation
Repository.

https://youtu.be/G2iX9O525Ik

If you have any other query, you can contact me or Dr. Arvind Ajoy.



All are requested to submit their application on or before 23-Sept-’22.
Warm regards,

Dr. Jacob Chandapillai,
Chief Innovation Officer,
Indian Institute of Technology,
Palakkad, Kerala.

*****************************************************

*Reading Comprehension*

*Read the short passage and attempt the questions that follow to test your
understanding:*

Excerpt from "How do good conversations work? Philosophy has something to
say" by Stephanie Ross

British philosopher, H P Grice, noted in 1975 that successful conversation
is a cooperative enterprise rather than a series of disconnected remarks.
Certain shared
expectations are in place greasing the skids of our conversational give and
take. In particular, he announced a ‘cooperative principle’: ‘make your
conversational
contribution such as is required at the stage at which it occurs, by the
accepted purpose or direction of the talk exchange in which you are
engaged.’ This principle is
observed by following four maxims: of quantity (be informative), quality
(be truthful), relation (be relevant) and manner (be clear). For Grice, we
communicate by
intending that others recognise our intentions to do so. Communication can
be undermined if we violate any or all of the maxims – if we offer less
information than is
required or too much information that distracts; if we make false claims or
claims for which we lack evidential support; if we embark on tangents; if
we formulate
obscure or ambiguous remarks; if we are prolix or disorganised.

Following Grice’s maxims helps ensure that our utterances convey the
meaning we intended. But this is far from guaranteeing conversational
success. Not only must
the speaker choose her words properly, but her conversant must be open to
receiving them. So what makes for a receptive interlocutor? It helps to be
willing,
deferential, interested, intrigued. We valorise conversations when we speak
of them as flowing. Grice’s emphasis on cooperation is crucial here. Both
parties to a
conversation must want it to succeed. He posits a structure of mirrored and
iterated intentions that facilitate conversational exchange. Working
together, conversants
can explore a subject matter or perform a task. Of course the division of
labour will never be exactly equal. But successful and satisfying
conversation results when
participants share a communicative goal, enjoy a minimal match of manner
and style, and accommodate one another’s interests, moods and needs.

1) " successful conversation is a cooperative enterprise rather than a
series of disconnected remarks." Here, enterprise means
a) a business
b) a company
c) an undertaking

2) " greasing the skids" is an idiom. It refers to
a) wooden planks used to build a track for rolling heavy objects
b) skate-like attachments for shoes
c) any action taken to move something more quickly

3) "if we embark on tangents" refers to
a) a straight line or plane that touches a curve or curved surface at a
point, but if extended does not cross it at that point.
b) a completely different line of thought or action
c) a variation of the dance, tango

4) 'accommodate' as used in the last line means
a) provide housing for
b) give someone what they need
c) bear with

5) The terms interlocutor and conversants are used in relation to
a) conversation
b) communication
c) cooperation

*Answers*
1) c
2) c
3) b
4) b
5) a



regards, Sandhya

-- 
English Language Support & Services
IIT Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/elss

CS5617-M-2022 -> Forums -> Announcements -> Spec progress
https://lms.iitpkd.ac.in/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=375#p419
Spec progress
by Ramaswamy Krishnan Chittur - Sunday, 18 September 2022, 3:10 AM
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Class:

Hope your spec document works are in progress. Like I mentioned earlier, I
would expect your spec to contain the following, among other things.

·       Overview.

·       UMLs (Module/Class/Activity diagrams as applicable).

·       Design (design options, your choice among the options, and
why (add research or prototypes)).

·       Interfaces.

·       Analysis – performance, security, usability.

·       Summary and Conclusions.

·       Please also make sure that the document is consistent in its
style and formatting.

References:

·       Please feel free to refer to the sample specs that I had
shared in Moodle (here [1]).

-       You are also welcome to refer to previous year specs (_Aug
2021 - Dec 2021_:  [2]Student group project [2], _Aug 2020 - Dec 2020_: 
[3]Student group project [3]).

Please note that the deadline is Sep 24th Saturday 7 PM.

Thank you.

Links:
------
[1] https://lms.iitpkd.ac.in/mod/folder/view.php?id=953
[2] https://github.com/Yogesh7920/meet.me
[3] https://github.com/convict-git/KoraKaagaz

From: GS Technical Affairs <gsectech@iitb.ac.in>
Date: Sat, 17 Sep, 2022, 6:43 pm
Subject: *****SPAM***** (8.5) Competition | Airathon Mumbai 2022
To: <gensec.technical@iitr.ac.in>, <sec_cocur@smail.iitm.ac.in>, Science
and Technology Council, IIT BHU Varanasi <gensec.sntc@itbhu.ac.in>, <

We have launched this competition to promote sustainable development. I
request all of you to circulate this information on your student mailing
list.


Sustainability Cell IIT Bombay along with Institute Technical Council
invites you to compete in ‘Airathon Mumbai 2022’, a competition aiming to
foster young minds to create models for air quality improvement and to
spread awareness about air quality in Mumbai.



The Sustainability Cell at IIT Bombay is the focal point for our
institute’s sustainable development innovations, research, and teaching. We
promote consciousness about sustainability on campus, introduce
technological advances and work with various institutional organizations,
staff, and students, to incorporate sustainable technologies at our
institute.



The competition, Airathon, is being conducted by Sustainability Cell IIT
Bombay and Institute Technical Council, in association with Fitizen India.
The total prize money will be around Rs 60,000. It will be funded by
Fitizen India.



Details: There will be two tracks in this competition:

   -

   Tech track: The challenge is to develop a feasible and implementable
   model to analyze and help improve the air quality in Mumbai, focusing
   mainly on particulate matter (PM2.5 and PM10 ) and nitrogen dioxide (NO2)
   . The model should be feasible and implementable in the city in the next
   ten years.
   -

      Total prize Tech track: 40K INR


   -

   Campaign track: The participants shall design a campaign strategy that
   displays their creative process and explains how an idea about air
   pollution might resonate with Mumbai residents. It can be a digital
   solution that advances the campaign in innovative and engaging ways using a
   maximum of three social media platforms.
   -

      Total Prize Campaign track: 20K INR


Please find Problem Statements for both tracks in the attachments.

LINK TO COMPETITION (D2C) :
https://unstop.com/competition/airathon-mumbai-2022-sustainability-cell-iit-bombay-indian-institute-of-technology-iit-bombay-435018

Timeline of the events in this competition:

Launch: 16th September

Technical Track Query Session: 21st September Campaign Track Query Session:
22nd September

Last date of submissions: 18th October

Results: 24th October Prize Distribution: 30th October

Prizes will be distributed at the IIT Bombay Half Marathon taking place on
30th October. We would like to invite you for the marathon as well,
organized in the effort to raise awareness about Air Pollution with the
theme #BreatheBetterMumbai.

In case of queries feel free to reach out to Sustainability Cell IIT
Bombay, sustainabilitycelliitb@gmail.com

https://gymkhana.iitb.ac.in/sustainabilitycell/

gsectech@iitb.ac.in

Warm Regards,

*****************************************************

Dear All,

*Important - Cover Letter Submission*

Please write a good cover letter. Please indicate recognition you received
in internships / previous jobs. You can even attach a letter of
recommendation or important emails recognizing your
dedication/skills/motivation etc. We recommend you spend sufficient time
and effort in writing a good cover letter. Applications without a cover
letter or a generic one will be ignored by the Talent Acquisition Team.

Note Please ensure that you write the following statement in your cover
letter, in a separate paragraph. Overlooking this will lead to rejection of
your resume.

*“Why am I suitable for an Analytics Intern role.”  *

*Please submit your cover letter in the google form *
https://forms.gle/HrUB6vvQuP7tVNBs5*  before 9 am <http://9.am/>, 19 Sep
2022. Please note that there won't be any extensions in the deadline and
the cover letters will be shared to the company immediately after the
deadline.*

*The Applications without a cover letter will be rejected by the company.*


Regards,
Yagnesh Katragadda
B.Tech Overall Coordinator,
Career Development Centre,
Indian Institute of Technology, Palakkad
Contact No: +91 9908183474
Email: 111901027@smail.iitpkd.ac.in
Website: cdc.iitpkd.ac.in

*****************************************************

DAY 316
20/09/2022

*“YES, AND . . .” *

It is possible to disagree with someone without being disagreeable.
Practice positive communication through the “Yes, and . . .” technique.
  ♦ Throughout your day, notice if you ever want to disagree with someone.
  ♦ Consider if it is possible to integrate their perspective into your own.
  ♦ When responding, practice positive communication by saying, “Yes, and
_____,” adding your opinion to what they’ve presented rather than as a
replacement.

FORWARD TOGETHER

-- 
*Team MITRA*
*IIT Palakkad*
*Nila Campus Room# B-224A (Tilang Hostel)*
*Ahalia Campus#Hostel 3 (Left side Room)*
https://www.facebook.com/TEAM.MITRA.IIT.PALAKKAD

shortly.
