> Abstract
>
> Graph Neural Networks (GNN) are used  extensively for analyzing
> graph-structured data with higher accuracy for node classification, graph
> classification, and link prediction, in areas such as social networks
> (analyzing human interactions), chemistry (molecule discovery, protein
> folding prediction), transportation, fast-placement of chips, etc. The
> vertices and edges in the case of a GNN are associated with high
> dimensional  feature vectors. The patterns of interests are often
> hidden/entangled in these feature vectors. The  operations in GNNs  consist
> of   data-driven, irregular, with   interleaved dense and regular neural
> network operations. Hence, performance optimizations applied for graph
> processing and traditional DNNs cannot be applied easily to GNNs. Several
> forms of parallelism can be explored in GNNs: operator-level, feature
> vector-level, graph-partition-level, model-level, etc.  Since there is a
> need for studying larger and deeper GNN models, there is also the need to
> accelerate and improve the performance and scalability of GNN
> training/inference algorithms on heterogeneous hardware architectures. We
> aim to provide GNN-specific programming abstractions for heterogeneous
> hardwares. We briefly introduce how graph programming models have evolved
> to process graph neural networks, and then introduce the challenges in
> processing graph neural networks on heterogeneous architectures. The
> presentation will conclude with an high level overview of    future work.

*****************************************************

Dear All,


Mr.Kevin Jude Concessao  who is working with Dr. Unnikrishnan C will be
presenting his research proposal on 21st September 2022 at 02:30 PM.


Date & Time : 21st September 2022, 2:30 pm

Venue             :  Room No. 301,Samgatha , Nila Campus


Please join with the following zoom link if you are unable to participate
in-person.



Meeting Link :
https://zoom.us/j/97082988825?pwd=YTFNMHUyOWxjTHU0eGlzeWJEUVZhdz09

Meeting ID: 970 8298 8825

Passcode: 793556



Abstract

Graph Neural Networks (GNN) are used  extensively for analyzing
graph-structured data with higher accuracy for node classification, graph
classification, and link prediction, in areas such as social networks
(analyzing human interactions), chemistry (molecule discovery, protein
folding prediction), transportation, fast-placement of chips, etc. The
vertices and edges in the case of a GNN are associated with high
dimensional  feature vectors. The patterns of interests are often
hidden/entangled in these feature vectors. The  operations in GNNs  consist
of   data-driven, irregular, with   interleaved dense and regular neural
network operations. Hence, performance optimizations applied for graph
processing and traditional DNNs cannot be applied easily to GNNs. Several
forms of parallelism can be explored in GNNs: operator-level, feature
vector-level, graph-partition-level, model-level, etc.  Since there is a
need for studying larger and deeper GNN models, there is also the need to
accelerate and improve the performance and scalability of GNN
training/inference algorithms on heterogeneous hardware architectures. We
aim to provide GNN-specific programming abstractions for heterogeneous
hardwares. We briefly introduce how graph programming models have evolved
to process graph neural networks, and then introduce the challenges in
processing graph neural networks on heterogeneous architectures. The
presentation will conclude with an high level overview of    future work.


All are cordially invited.


--

Thank you

Regards,

Office of the Dean (Academics)

IIT Palakkad


*****************************************************

Gentle Reminder!

Warm Regards,
Yagnesh Katragadda
Secretary, Academic Affairs

On Thu, 15 Sep 2022, 11:36 Academic Affairs Secretary, <
sec_acad@smail.iitpkd.ac.in> wrote:

> Greeting everyone!
> The ETS India Resource Centre managed by DP Cube learning, will be
> organizing a National level English Olympiad from 26th September to 1st
> October 2022 .
>
> *About English Olympiad*
>
> The Olympiad will focus on problem solving and higher order thinking
> skills. In these times of exponential technological advances across the
> globe, quality education has become the need of the hour. Focus should be
> on shaping the young minds to improve English language learning abilities
> including spellings, grammar, sentence structure and creative writing.
> These skills will be crucial competencies for the future workforce of the
> nation.
>
> Through this Olympiad, we aim to provide the best exposure by introducing
> students to international standard English language challenges meant for
> training and enhancing language skills.
>
>
> *About Registration and Examination:*
>
>
> English Olympiad is a national level examination to be conducted online.
> Exam will be conducted on windows and android platforms ONLY. Olympiad is
> Free of cost.
>
>
> The mode of registration will also be online.
>
>
>
> *Steps of Individual Student Registration:*
>
> The student will enter details like Name, DOB, , Class, School Name,
> Password etc. and then the entered data will be verified by admin by
> sending OTPs on the registered Mobile Number. The OTP will be required to
> be entered for completion of verification process.
>
> After completion of registration process the student will be provided with
> a unique username (on registered email id) and password (encrypted format).
>
>
>
> Date for the examination will be selected (between September26th – 1st October)
> by the students and they will be allowed to take the examination only ONCE.
>
>
> *Exam Pattern and Eligibility:*
>
> The Olympiad will be held for students studying in college in an online
> mode.
>
> The test will comprise Multiple Choice Questions with only one correct
> answer to each question and the duration of the *exam will be 30 mins*.
>

>
> A candidate will have to appear in the Olympiad in respect of the year in
> which he/she is currently studying.
>
> There is no age limit for appearing in the exam. Candidate’s date of birth
> as per college records will be the authentic proof that will be accepted.
>

>
>
>
> The syllabus of the Olympiad will be the same as applicable to the year in
> which the candidates are studying.
>

*****************************************************

Greeting everyone!
The ETS India Resource Centre managed by DP Cube learning, will be
organizing a National level English Olympiad from 26th September to 1st
October 2022 .

*About English Olympiad*

The Olympiad will focus on problem solving and higher order thinking
skills. In these times of exponential technological advances across the
globe, quality education has become the need of the hour. Focus should be
on shaping the young minds to improve English language learning abilities
including spellings, grammar, sentence structure and creative writing.
These skills will be crucial competencies for the future workforce of the
nation.

Through this Olympiad, we aim to provide the best exposure by introducing
students to international standard English language challenges meant for
training and enhancing language skills.


*About Registration and Examination:*


English Olympiad is a national level examination to be conducted online.
Exam will be conducted on windows and android platforms ONLY. Olympiad is
Free of cost.


The mode of registration will also be online.



*Steps of Individual Student Registration:*

The student will enter details like Name, DOB, , Class, School Name,
Password etc. and then the entered data will be verified by admin by
sending OTPs on the registered Mobile Number. The OTP will be required to
be entered for completion of verification process.

After completion of registration process the student will be provided with
a unique username (on registered email id) and password (encrypted format).



Date for the examination will be selected (between September26th – 1st October)
by the students and they will be allowed to take the examination only ONCE.


*Exam Pattern and Eligibility:*

The Olympiad will be held for students studying in college in an online
mode.

The test will comprise Multiple Choice Questions with only one correct
answer to each question and the duration of the *exam will be 30 mins*.



A candidate will have to appear in the Olympiad in respect of the year in
which he/she is currently studying.

There is no age limit for appearing in the exam. Candidate’s date of birth
as per college records will be the authentic proof that will be accepted.



The question paper will be in English only.



The syllabus of the Olympiad will be the same as applicable to the year in
which the candidates are studying.


The test will be conducted in online manner and the registered students
will be allowed to take the exam from their own device from anywhere. Exam
will be conducted on windows and android platforms ONLY.


*Details of Prizes*



   - E-Certificate of participation for all students
   - Certificate for winners – Institution level
   - Amazon vouchers
   - Trophy for the institution
   - Certificate & Trophy for Regional and National level winners
   - Galaxy tab, Mobile, Smart watch Bluetooth speakers, headphones & Power
   banks for national winners


 Registration Link for the Olympiad - https://www.testprac.com/signup .
 The last date to apply is 24th September, 2022.

 For any queries visit website: www.testprac.com or
Contact: 7305511222

Warm Regards,
Yagnesh Katragadda

Dear Student

About English Olympiad

The Olympiad will focus on problem solving and higher order thinking skills. In these times of exponential technological advances across the globe, quality education has become the need of the hour. Focus should be on shaping the young minds to improve English language learning abilities including spellings, grammar, sentence structure and creative writing. These skills will be crucial competencies for the future workforce of the nation.
Through this Olympiad, we aim to provide the best exposure by introducing students to international standard English language challenges meant for training and enhancing language skills.

Last date for registration - 23rd September 2022

About Registration and Examination:

English Olympiad is a national level examination to be conducted online. Exam will be conducted on windows and android platforms ONLY.

The mode of registration will also be online.

Steps of Individual Student Registration:
The student will enter details like Name, DOB, , Class, School Name, Password etc. and then the entered data will be verified by admin by sending OTPs on the registered Mobile Number. The OTP will be required to be entered for completion of verification process.

After completion of registration process the student will be provided with a unique username (on registered email id) and password (encrypted format).

Date for the examination will be selected (between September26th - 1st October) by the students and they will be allowed to take the examination only ONCE.

Students have to arrange for a device with good internet connectivity on the selected date and time of examination.

Exam Pattern and Eligibility:

The Olympiad will be held for students studying in college in an online mode.

The test will comprise Multiple Choice Questions with only one correct answer to each question and the duration of the exam will be 30 mins.

A candidate will have to appear in the Olympiad in respect of the year in which he/she is currently studying.

There is no age limit for appearing in the exam. Candidate's date of birth as per college records will be the authentic proof that will be accepted.

The question paper will be in English only.

The syllabus of the Olympiad will be the same as applicable to the year in which the candidates are studying.

Details of Prizes


  *   E-Certificate of participation for all students
  *   Certificate for winners - Institution level
  *   Amazon vouchers
  *   Trophy for the institution
  *   Certificate & Trophy for Regional and National level winners
  *   Galaxy tab, Mobile, Smart watch Bluetooth speakers, headphones & Power banks for national winners

Registration Link for the Olympiad - https://www.testprac.com/signup

Students can also scan the QR code and register for the Olympiad.



Warm Regards

https://www.ets.org/india-toefl-gre
[cid:image002.png@01D8C6C5.2AC59B40]

Division of IIT Palakkad has received the *CII DIGITAL TRANSFORMATION DX
2022* *award* under Innovative Best Practices for “Common Data Environment
and Building Information Modelling”. This is the topmost award in the
category and I would like all of you to join me in congratulating the
entire EWD team, ably led by Dr Senthilkumar (Chairman, EWD) with constant
support and encouragement of Prof. Sunil Kumar (Founding Director, IIT
Palakkad), on this achievement. The award was received today by Sh.
Navaneeth (Executive Engineer) and Sh Vineesh (Junior Engineer) on behalf
of the institute at the function held in New Delhi (see attached
photograph).

*****************************************************

DAY 315
13/09/2022

*PROGRESSIVE BREATHING*

 Meditate for at least five minutes today.
  ♦ Close your eyes, and breathe in through the nose and out through the
mouth, slowly and gradually, never holding the breath.
♦ Count to three as you inhale.
♦ Count to three as you exhale.
♦ Count to five with each inhale and exhale.
  ♦ Then count to seven with each inhale and exhale and then back to three.
♦ Rotate through counting for three, then five, and then seven on both the
inhale and exhale until five minutes have passed.
--
   FORWARD TOGETHER
*Team MITRA*
*IIT Palakkad*
*Nila Campus Room# B-224A (Tilang Hostel)*
*Ahalia Campus#Hostel 3 (Left side Room)*

*****************************************************

Hi Everyone, We will be having a special session Friday,16th of September
2022, where we will be discussing topics related to mental health, such as
depression and anxiety. This will be a general discussion where anyone can
express their views, share their past experiences, and talk about other
related issues.

If you feel comfortable, you can talk about your own experiences with mental
health problems, and how you deal with them, without fearing judgment from
others. This session is also an opportunity to help others who may be
struggling with similar issues.

Mental health is a serious issue, and it is important that we talk about it
openly and without shame. Hopefully, this session will provide a safe and
welcoming space for everyone to do just that.

Fill up this form if you want your queries to be taken up by our
counselors: Google Form <https://forms.gle/5rncEW9fAdYjoxsW6>


The details are as follows: Venue: H3 common room Date: Friday, September 15
, 2022 Time: 6-7 pm


--

*Contact no: 9752418133*

*****************************************************

Hello Everyone!
Greetings from the Finance Club,

We frequently ask questions about how to manage our finances, where to
invest it, how taxes work, and much more, but we never receive a clear
response to any of them. Don't worry! With a session devoted to personal
finance, Finance Club is here to address all of your inquiries!

To answer your questions, we collaborated with Mr. Prasad, the founder of
convey.in. Convey has a strong 2 Mn+ YouTube family containing well over
500 videos on various subfields within finance. Over the years, the courses
developed by Mr. Prasad have been loved by thousands of students.

The webinar is open to the entire IIT Palakkad Community and everyone is
cordially invited.

Webinar details are as follows:
*Date:* Saturday, Sept 17
*Time: *10am - 11:30am

*Note:* Webinar link will be shared soon.

Thanks and Regards,
Sonu Shaw
Head, Finance Club

CS5617-M-2022 -> Forums -> Announcements -> Progress on the group project
https://lms.iitpkd.ac.in/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=324#p363
Progress on the group project
by Ramaswamy Krishnan Chittur - Monday, 12 September 2022, 4:45 PM
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Class:

How if the project going?

* Have you folks discussed your components with your team?
* Are you clear on what exactly you are going to work on?
* Have you started spec’ing them yet?
* Have you tried prototyping your code yet?

Take it easy, but please make sure there is progress. Two months from now,
we should deliver the final project, so let us get going. If you are
blocked on anything, do not hesitate to let me know.

Project Manager Naren: Would you mind replying in this thread (or in email
to me) on how things are going w.r.t. to the group project?

Thank you.

*****************************************************


CS4150-M-2022 -> Assignment -> Lab 3
---------------------------------------------------------------------

assignment submission for 'Lab 3'

On Fri, Aug 26, 2022 at 5:25 PM Academic Research <acadresearch@iitpkd.ac.in>
wrote:

> Dear All,
>
> Ms. S. Sreejyothi, MS Scholar  who is working under the supervision of Dr.
> Revathy Padmanabhan, will be presenting her research seminar on 16th
> September 2022 at 02:00 PM through online mode.
>
> Title: Plasmon Enhanced Polarization Sensitive Photodetection Using
> Semiconducting Monolayers
>
> Date & Time: 16th September 2022 at 02:00 PM
>
> Venue: Zoom meeting details are given below
>
> Meeting ID: 930 9995 1979
>
> Passcode:  351483
>
> Meeting link:
> https://zoom.us/j/93099951979?pwd=QlhvaFlqN3RCdUlZN1pyN01Ud2ZjQT09
>

>
> ABSTRACT:
>
>
>
> Applications of photodetectors sensitive to the circular polarization of
> light (CPL) can be found in various fields of science and engineering.
> Developing a compact, polarization-sensitive photodetector (PSPD) with good
> responsivity is essential to fulfil the growing needs for CPL detection in
> next-generation technologies. This work elucidates the design of a compact
> PSPD using layered semiconductors as the optically active layer. Simple
> planar metallic nanostructures are used to enhance the responsivity of the
> detector, as the fabrication process flow for planar structures can be
> relatively more straightforward.
>
>
>
> Assigning chiral geometries to the nanostructure can impart polarization
> sensitivity to the detector. To identify geometries that yield maximum
> polarization sensitivity at the absorption peak of the photoactive
> monolayer MoS2 (671nm), six different Ag plasmonic nanostructures are
> designed and analyzed, initially. The shifted rod structure, with a CD of
> 7%, showed the highest polarization sensitivity.
>
>
>
> Since the shifted rod geometry shows good polarisation sensitivity,
> different configurations in shifted nanorod geometries are explored,
> including modifying the metallic shifted rod to three different
> configurations using shifted metal-insulator-metal (MIM) based rods.
> Detailed simulations and analysis of the chiroptic response of each of
> these configurations are performed using the absorption and reflection
> spectra, electric field and surface charge distributions.
>
>
>
> The M-I shifted rod configuration (with Ag film underneath MoS2) exhibited
> high CD; this is further explored to study the effect of overlap length on
> CD in MoS2, to improve the device performance. The ratio (γ) of overlap
> length to length of the rod is varied, and the origin of spectral features
> is understood from the charge and field distributions. The photocurrents
> and the spectral responsively have been calculated as well. The electrical
> analysis shows 51% more sensitivity to LCP than RCP besides the
> illumination sensitivity, making it an efficient PSPD.
>
>
> The poster for the research seminar is attached herewith.
>

*****************************************************

Dear All,

Ms. S. Sreejyothi, MS Scholar  who is working under the supervision of Dr.
Revathy Padmanabhan, will be presenting her research seminar on 16th
September 2022 at 02:00 PM through online mode.

Title: Plasmon Enhanced Polarization Sensitive Photodetection Using
Semiconducting Monolayers

Date & Time: 16th September 2022 at 02:00 PM

Venue: Zoom meeting details are given below

Meeting ID: 930 9995 1979

Passcode:  351483

Meeting link:
https://zoom.us/j/93099951979?pwd=QlhvaFlqN3RCdUlZN1pyN01Ud2ZjQT09



ABSTRACT:



Applications of photodetectors sensitive to the circular polarization of
light (CPL) can be found in various fields of science and engineering.
Developing a compact, polarization-sensitive photodetector (PSPD) with good
responsivity is essential to fulfil the growing needs for CPL detection in
next-generation technologies. This work elucidates the design of a compact
PSPD using layered semiconductors as the optically active layer. Simple
planar metallic nanostructures are used to enhance the responsivity of the
detector, as the fabrication process flow for planar structures can be
relatively more straightforward.



Assigning chiral geometries to the nanostructure can impart polarization
sensitivity to the detector. To identify geometries that yield maximum
polarization sensitivity at the absorption peak of the photoactive
monolayer MoS2 (671nm), six different Ag plasmonic nanostructures are
designed and analyzed, initially. The shifted rod structure, with a CD of
7%, showed the highest polarization sensitivity.



Since the shifted rod geometry shows good polarisation sensitivity,
different configurations in shifted nanorod geometries are explored,
including modifying the metallic shifted rod to three different
configurations using shifted metal-insulator-metal (MIM) based rods.
Detailed simulations and analysis of the chiroptic response of each of
these configurations are performed using the absorption and reflection
spectra, electric field and surface charge distributions.



The M-I shifted rod configuration (with Ag film underneath MoS2) exhibited
high CD; this is further explored to study the effect of overlap length on
CD in MoS2, to improve the device performance. The ratio (γ) of overlap
length to length of the rod is varied, and the origin of spectral features
is understood from the charge and field distributions. The photocurrents
and the spectral responsively have been calculated as well. The electrical
analysis shows 51% more sensitivity to LCP than RCP besides the
illumination sensitivity, making it an efficient PSPD.


The poster for the research seminar is attached herewith.

All are cordially invited.


-- 
Thank you
Regards,

Office of the Dean (Academics)
IIT Palakkad


*****************************************************

Dear All,

      World Suicide Prevention Day (WSPD), celebrated annually on 10
September, is organized by the International Association for Suicide
Prevention (IASP) and endorsed by the World Health Organization (WHO). The
event represents a global commitment to focus attention on suicide
prevention.

     The theme of 2022 is "Creating hope through action, " which reflects
the need for collective action to adress this public health issu The
overall goal of this day is to raise awareness about suicide prevention
world wide.

        .


FORWARD TOGETHER

Team Mitra

CS5617-M-2022 -> Forums -> Announcements -> Self assessment
https://lms.iitpkd.ac.in/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=323#p362
Self assessment
by Ramaswamy Krishnan Chittur - Monday, 12 September 2022, 4:44 PM
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Class:

Just wanted to check how things are going. Since we did not have a class
last Friday, please do a self-assessment on the progress – here is a
quick checklist

THEORY:

* Did you get a chance to go through the slide deck I shared, named
“SoftwareEngi”eeeringPrinciples"? That captures the core theory that we
have discussed so far.

PROGRAMMING:

Did you get a chance to try out the following code samples:

* Storage classes in XML, JSON and TXT that I mentioned in the first
class.
* The Design Patterns code sample that I shared out.
* The UX/MVVM code sample that I shared out.

 If you have not read through any of these topics, or have not tried out
these code samples yet, please do ASAP. If you have any questions, please
feel free to ask.

Thank you.

---------------------------------------------------------------------

*****************************************************

Dear All,
Hope you are in good health!
Don't forget to pay attention to your health. .
Due to unhealthy lifestyle habits, work pressure, getting infected,
problems related to digestion and other similar health issues have become
quite normal in today's world. The best part is that all these problems can
be solved by practicing simple Asanas of Yoga.

With a combination of deep breathing as well as proper body stretches
targeting abdominal organs and twists that massages and wrings out stuck
intestinal toxins, we can get rid of a wide range of digestive discomforts
(gas, bloating, acid reflux, constipation etc.).

Below I have attached a document on recommended Yoga Asanas for digestion
related issues. Hope you will find it helpful and practice them at home.


With best regards,
Sujata Priyambada Palai
Yoga and Wellness,
IIT Palakkad

DAY 313
11/09/2022

*EVERYTHING MOVES, EVERYTHING VIBRATES*

  ♦ Lie down flat on your back with your palms facing up.
  ♦ On your inhale, breathe into the top and the bottom, the left and the
right, and the front and the back sides of the lungs.
  ♦ On your exhale, breathe out from the top and the bottom, the left and
the right, and the front and the back sides of the lungs.
  ♦ Bring your awareness to the vibration of your heartbeat.
  ♦ Envision every cell in your being echoing its own heartbeat-like
vibration

--
    FORWARD TOGETHER
*Team MITRA*
*IIT Palakkad*
*Nila Campus Room# B-224A (Tilang Hostel)*
*Ahalia Campus#Hostel 3 (Left side Room)*

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: CZC 2022 <czeroc@iitm.ac.in>
Date: Thu, Sep 15, 2022, 10:19
Subject: Carbon Zero Challenge CZC 2022 - IIT Madras inviting application
for All India Eco-Innovation and Entrepreneurship contest
To: <deanacad@iitpkd.ac.in>


Dear Prof. Pramod S. Mehta

Greetings from IIT Madras!

We are glad to inform you that the third edition of Carbon Zero Challenge
(CZC), an All India Eco-Innovation and Entrepreneurship competition was
launched on 24 August 2022. CZC 2022 aims to accelerate the lab-to-market
transition of eco-innovations in India by funding innovations from
proof-of-concept, lab-scale solutions to working prototypes or pilots.

The Theme for CZC2022 is CZC for CRC  “Circularity in Resources
Conservation”. CZC 2022  would focus on fostering innovative solutions
incorporating circularity and sustainability for managing and conserving
the following resources - Air, Water, Soil, Materials, and Energy.

If you are working in technology/ policy/business or IT/ Data analytics
development in any of the above domains and interested in implementing your
technology in the field through entrepreneurship, we strongly encourage you
and your team to apply for CZeroC. We expect to shortlist 100 teams by
October 2022 of which  25 teams will be given prototype funding up to Rs 5
lakhs per team. The teams will be connected to experts in industry and
academia to hone their technical and business skills. The CZC winners get a
10 lakhs startup seed grant and continued support, including access to the
IITM incubation ecosystem.

Please check out our website http://www.czeroc.in for more details and the
application portal.

Why Clean Tech and Circularity?

Startups in the Cleantech/ Eco tech domain are very few but the global
challenges and demand for startups with deep tech solutions are
accelerating and opening an enormous business opportunity.  A report from
Allied Market Research states that in 2020, the global green tech and
sustainability market was valued at over $10 billion. By 2030, it’s expected to
reach over $74 billion
<https://www.alliedmarketresearch.com/green-technology-and-sustainability-market-A06033>.
Across the globe, investments in green technologies hit a whopping $755
billion in 2021
<https://www.investopedia.com/articles/investing/040915/investing-green-technologythe-future-now.asp#toc-understanding-green-technology-investing>,
a significant increase from the previous year.

Resource Depletion accelerated by the triple planetary crisis of climate
change, pollution, and Biodiversity loss is the world's biggest challenge.
Earth overshoot day when we exhaust our annual budget for natural resources
fell on July 28th and we need 1.75 piles of earth to sustain our
consumption. It is imperative to balance our demand and the earth’s supply
through resource conservation, rethinking design, and materials to enable
the reduction, recycling, recovery, and reuse of resources. The industry
and public service systems need non-polluting technology to achieve this
carbon, land, and water footprint.

We look forward to participation from your faculty, students in your
respective research groups,  early-stage startups, and startups about to
register teams.



 If you have any questions about the competition, please write to us at
czeroc@iitm.ac.in

Thank you
-- 
Warm Regards
Indu

Professor  ( Environmental Engineering)

1. *You are not supposed to bring any books having written codes to the
examination. If the company allows you to use the documentation, you may
refer to it during the examination, however.*

*2. You are expected not to use incognito mode during the examination and
the history will be checked by the coordinators after or during the exam.
Clearing the history or removing the searched data will also be considered
as malpractice hereafter. You are not supposed to shut down the system
until the approval of the coordinator after everything is checked.*

*3. The system numbers will be allocated to you before the exam and you are
supposed to sit only at your designated system numbers. Students are
supposed to get permission from the respective coordinator coordinating the
process without fail in case of any unforeseen circumstances.*

*4. The recordings of the sessions will be checked through cameras and also
the coordinators will be recording the session. *

*Any sort of unfair means during the exam will lead to serious actions
being taken against you.*

*****************************************************

Dear All,
   Greetings from the Career Development Centre! Hope you are doing good
and this email finds you well.

As you all are aware, we are starting the placement season 2022-2023. In
this regard, we kindly request you to keep note of the following points.

*1. Go through the placement and the internship policy thoroughly. It's
very important to read it properly and any violation of it will not be
entertained. We have shared them earlier already. In case you don't find
them, please refer them in our CDC Portal.*

*2. Go through the email carefully and closely. If it says both the company
registration and CDC portal application are mandatory, then you need to
oblige to the instructions. You need to fill out the company registration
form and must apply in the CDC portal. Both the processes are mandatory in
order to appear for the drive. The changes cannot be made after the
deadline.*


*3. Stick to the application deadline timing and schedule. No excuses will
be entertained at any point in time and Top MNCs won't prefer doing that.*


*4. Once you apply for the process, it's mandatory to go through the entire
process from PPT to Final interviews. If you have any difficulties, inform
the coordinator well in advance.  Otherwise, you will be debarred from the
other campus processes.*

*5. There could be instances where the updates of the interviews,
online tests etc... are provided on short notice. So, please check your
emails regularly and no requests will be entertained with the reason as
"Didn't check the Mail".*

6. *Since some of the companies could have physical(offline) hiring this
year, we request everyone to have the required document copies.*


All the best for your much-awaited campus placement. Wishing you a fruitful
experience.

Regards,
Yagnesh Katragadda
B.Tech Overall Coordinator,
Career Development Centre,
Indian Institute of Technology, Palakkad
Contact No: +91 9908183474
Email: 111901027@smail.iitpkd.ac.in
Website: cdc.iitpkd.ac.in

Dear Students,

The Office of Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India is
facilitating the Chevening Adani Scholarships for Indian students for a
one-year master’s degree in the UK, in courses related to Artificial
Intelligence (AI).

Chevening Adani Scholarships:

Chevening (FCDO) and the Adani Group have partnered to sponsor 5 scholars
from India who will study for a one-year master’s degree in the UK, in
courses related to Artificial Intelligence (AI). The scholars can choose to
study at any registered university in the UK. Artificial Intelligence is an
emerging critical sector in India and from improving people’s lives to
optimising business outcomes, AI is reshaping the world. Scholars may
choose AI in health, education, governance, and policy-making – the list is
endless and the impact enormous.

There are approx. 150 courses in AI, listed on the site. Please visit -
https://www.chevening.org/scholarships/find-a-course/

Chevening Scholarships & Fellowships

Scholarships are given to outstanding Indian graduates for a one-year
master's degree, to study any subject, at any recognised university in the
UK. This year they hope to send more scholars to the UK as the Adani Group
has partnered with Chevening to co-sponsor 5 scholars who will study a
one-year master's course in Artificial Intelligence.

Fellowships are bespoke courses aimed at mid-to-senior level professionals
who are looking to expand their knowledge and expertise in their specific
field of work. The programmes are tailored, short courses which usually run
for 8-11 weeks at a designated UK University.

Timeline:

 The last date to apply for the scholarship is the 1st of November,
2022. Selected
scholars will begin their master's degree in Sep 2023. For more information
and to apply click here:
https://www.chevening.org/apply/?country=india&award_type=

Submission cut-off date: 01 November 2022

Thanking you,

With regards
Kavitha

(ii)Throwing events (Shot Put, Discus Throw, Javelin Throw and Hammer

*****************************************************

*English Idioms* - speak and understand spoken English better

1. Sit tight

Sit tight is a great example of why you can’t translate idioms in English
word-for-word. It literally would mean that you sit down squeezing your
body in a tight way—which if you did would be very uncomfortable, not to
mention you’d look really strange.

But if a person tells you to sit tight they want you to wait patiently and
take no action until you hear otherwise.

“Priya, do you have any idea when the exam results are going to come out?”

“Who knows Ramesh, sometimes they come out quickly but it could take some
time. You’re just going to have to sit tight and wait.”

2. Pitch in

This phrase actually makes no sense if you try to take it literally.
However, figuratively speaking, it means to contribute (give) to something
or someone or to join in.

So if Mr.Samuel tells the residents of Hostel 3 that he wants everyone to
pitch in this weekend and help clear the hostel grounds, it means he wants
everyone to join in on the efforts to clear the grounds and get things done
quicker.

“What are you going to buy Ankita for her birthday?”

“I don’t know. I don’t have much money.”

“Maybe we can all pitch in and buy her something great.”

The above conversation suggests that every one of  Ankita’s friends should
contribute a little bit of money so they can afford to buy her a bigger and
better present together.


3. Face the music

In literal terms, facing the music means turning your body to the direction
of the music and standing in front of it. But if your friend or your
parents tell you to face the music, there’s a much harsher meaning.

It means to “face reality” or to deal with the reality of the situation and
accept all the consequences, good or bad (but mostly bad). Perhaps you’ve
been avoiding something because you feel unsure or scared of the outcome.
Maybe you lied to your teacher and she discovered the truth and now you
have to face the music and accept the punishment.

“I can’t understand why I failed EL 405.”

“You know you didn’t study hard, so you’re going to have to face the music
and take the course again next odd semester if you really want to graduate
with the rest of your class.”

4. Ring a bell

If we look at the literal meaning of ring a bell, it’s just that: You could
be ringing the school bell to tell students it’s time to go to class or
ringing someone’s doorbell.

But the idiom means that somebody has mentioned something that sounds
familiar to you, perhaps you’ve heard it before. In other words, when
someone says something that you believe you’ve heard in the past, bells
start ringing and you try to remember how or why that name or place sounds
familiar.

“You’ve met my friend Supriya Devarakonda, right?”

“Hmmm, I’m not sure, but that name rings a bell. Was she the one who won a
Tata Endowment for a senior-citizen care program last year?”

5. Blow off steam

In reality a person cannot blow off steam (the hot rising air from boiling
water)—only electrical equipment can, such as the electric jug (appliance
for boiling water for coffee). So what does it mean when a person blows off
steam?

If you’re feeling angry, stressed or are experiencing some strong feelings
and you want to get rid of them so you feel better again, you will blow off
steam by doing something such as exercising to get rid of the stress.

“Why is Nizam so angry and where did he go?”

“He had a fight with his brother, so he went for a run to blow off steam.”


regards, Sandhya

-- 
English Language Support & Services
IIT Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/elss

Greetings from Petrichor!

Hope you are doing fine.

PETRICHOR, the annual techno-cultural fest of IIT Palakkad is hosting a
series of offline workshops. We are happy to extend this invitation to our
students so they can take part in this enlightening event and broaden their
technical knowledge.

After an incredibly successful edition of virtual workshops the previous
year,* PETRICHOR '23, IIT PALAKKAD* is back with a brand-new redesigned
version of offline workshops to feed your yearning intellectual criosity!

*OFFLINE WORKSHOPS FROM PETRICHOR IIT PALAKKAD*

*👉 ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE*

Date: 17 & 18 September 2022
Duration: 2 Days
Perks: Certificate from Petrichor '23, IIT Palakkad



*👉 GAME DEVELOPMENT*

Date: 17 & 18 September 2022
Duration: 2 Days
Perks: Certificate from Petrichor '23, IIT Palakkad


*👉 IC ENGINES*

Date: 17 & 18 September 2022
Duration: 2 Days
Perks: Certificate from Petrichor '23, IIT Palakkad


*👉 REAL-TIME SIGNAL PROCESSING FOR IOT - Edge-based event monitoring
devices using Arduino*

Date: 17 & 18 September 2022
Duration: 2 Days
Perks: Certificate from Petrichor '23, IIT Palakkad


Registration Link: Apply here
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1cK8EP9Zx0qXgVzAExC-MSpBm9kKaOTbagXuEFR8ssvQ/edit>

*Registration deadline: 14 September 2022,2 PM.*

For more details, please refer to the brochure attached.

*Notice:*

   - *Only a limited number of seats are left so register quickly.*
   - *Only register if you are willing to attend the full workshop (we
   don't want any genuine student to miss the workshop due to limited seats).*
   - *Certificates will be provided only to participants who attend the
   full workshop*
   - *The registration form will be closed once we reach maximum capacity.*


*Regards     *

*****************************************************

Dear all,
Greetings!

Hope you are safe and doing well. As you might already be aware of the
*leaderboard
system* that the cultural council is following, in extension to that, our
current plan is to install a physical leaderboard in each hostel and any
other relevant common spaces. Thus, I am very glad to announce a design
challenge for the same. The challenge will be carried out in two phases.
Phase 1 will be the design phase and phase 2 will be fabrication. One best
design will be selected and moved to phase 2 for the fabrication.

We are curiously looking forward to your creative and innovative design for
the leaderboards that we will be installing across each of the hostels and
other common spaces. Stand a chance to win prizes worth *Rs. 500* along
with the *certificates and credits* for your work.

P.S.: The expenses for the raw materials and fabrication will be taken care
of by us.

-- 
Regards,
Sai Prakesh Vorluvothu

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Chinmay Ghoroi <chinmayg@iitgn.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Sep 12, 2022 at 7:19 AM
Subject: Symposium at IIT Gandhinagar – “E-mobility in India: Safety and
the Way Forward” (Sept 27-28, 2022)
To: Chinmay Ghoroi <chinmayg@iitgn.ac.in>, Safety Centre IITGN <
safety@iitgn.ac.in>


Dear Professor,



Greetings from the Centre for Safety Engineering, IIT Gandhinagar!


Kindly circulate the following announcement among the student and faculty
community.




The Centre for Safety Engineering <http://safety.iitgn.ac.in/> at IIT
Gandhinagar, in association with Electrochemical Safety Research Institute
<https://ul.org/research/electrochemical-safety> (ESRI) of UL Research
Institutes, Chicago, USA is organizing a two-day symposium on "*E-Mobility
in India: Safety and the Way Forward*" during *September 27-28, 2022*.
Industry leaders and researchers in the area will discuss various aspects
of safety in the E-Mobility mission. The two-day symposium will cover
technology readiness, the challenges of electric vehicle (EV) fires,
Battery Management Systems (BMS), charging of EVs, thermal management and
runaways, Codes/Standards of EV, and response to EV fires etc. The
symposium will also provide the local and global experiences and challenges
of handling EV fires.



*The symposium will be very useful for people from Industry, academia,
researchers, safety professionals, and professionals from insurance,
battery manufacturers, automotive manufacturers, regulators, and other EV
sector stakeholders in India and elsewhere. Kindly circulate the
announcement to interested colleagues. *



The Centre for Safety Engineering and Electrochemical Safety Research
Institute are collaborating for safer E-mobility and inviting individuals,
academic institutions, industry partners, regulators, and other
organizations to join our efforts toward improving public safety in
E-mobility. The symposium will provide crucial input to the ongoing efforts
of the Government, Industry, and other stakeholders in the EV sector.



Kindly see the attached tentative program and register using this link
<https://events.iitgn.ac.in/apply/application_emobility.php?eventid=09092022>
for the symposium on or before September 23, 2022 (1800 hrs).





Look forward to meeting you at the symposium on September 27, 2022.
-- 
--
With Regards,

Dr. Chinmay Ghoroi
B.S. Gelot Chair Professor of Chemical Engineering
Coordinator, Centre for Safety Engineering  <http://safety.iitgn.ac.in/>
IIT Gandhinagar
Gandhinagar - 382355, Gujarat, India.
https://www.iitgn.ac.in/faculty/chemical/fac-chinmay


*****************************************************

Greetings Everyone.

Hope you are doing well.


As a part of the Swachhta Pakhwada celebrations, we at EBSB would like to
educate our institute family regarding the most basic yet instrumental part
of the Swachh Bharat Mission -* proper waste management and appropriate use
of waste bins.*


I am sure all of you must have seen dustbins painted with different colours
across the street, but have you ever wondered what these colours symbolise
or why we need colour coding in the first place?

Well, the reason is not just limited to their different ways of being
recycled but also we must realise that the segregation of waste at source
is key to the success of all the options and technologies available in the
country.

The most common colour coding followed in India :



   1.

   RED * : *Non recyclable glass (window glass, mirrors), single use
   plastic (plastic

           wraps), foam materials, plastic coated cups and plates.


   1.

   YELLOW *: *Recyclable plastics, glasses, paper waste, cardboards.



   1.

   GREEN *: *Biodegradable waste, organic wastes(fruits and vegetable peels
   etc), non

                  hazardous wood waste.


   1.

   BLUE : Sometimes you may even come across these types of bins, they
   are

             generally used for disposing metals(beverage cans, machinery,
window

              frames, wire cables etc).


   1.

   BLACK *:* Ever wondered where do all the computers and other appliances
   end up

                after we discard them? Black dustbins are specifically used
for recycling

                “e-waste”, a term broadly used for all surplus electronics.


   -

   Sometimes you may not find dustbins specifically for metals or
   electronics, so just remember segregation is key. We can always put them
   in separate plastic bags so that the concerned authorities may take care of
   it.



So this Swachhta Pakhwada, let us be more responsible IITians and do our
bit to make this world a better place to live in.


For more information about the Swachh Bharat Mission and the values it
entails, refer the following link:

http://swachhbharatmission.gov.in/SBMCMS/swachhta-pakhwada.htm


-- 


*Thanks and Regards*
*Yash Mittal*
*EBSB Secretary*

*Instagram: ebsb.iitpalakkad <https://www.instagram.com/ebsb.iitpkd/>*
*Contact no: 8295512850 *

Dear All,

              I am writing this mail requesting entries for the Institute
Activity Planner 2023. We would like to have the institute planner
(calendar) to be based on a broad theme with original photographs from our
institute community and this is possible only if there are sufficient
images/photographs that are received from the institute fraternity. I
encourage all of you to submit your best photographs to be considered for
the activity planner through the following Google form.

https://forms.gle/Amy6CKTgCXBC9D6C8

The last date for submission is *15 Oct, 2022* and there is no limit on the
number of submissions from one person.

We hope that there will be a large active participation and look forward to
receiving original and interesting entries from all of you, from which the
best ones that can be hopefully connected to a broad theme, will feature in
the 2023 Activity Planner.

Hi Joel Sam Mathew,
You have been invited to take GE Digital - Online Exam - 2023 - IIT Palakkad by GE Digital ..
Test details

Opens at: 9 Sep, 2022 (Friday) | 3:00p.m.
Closes at: Sep 09, 2022 03:15 PM IST
Test Duration: 1 hrs 
Invite Expiry Date: None
Test Link: https://www.hackerearth.com/challenges/test/ge-digital-online-exam-2023-iit-palakkad-2/?login=baa3612136427d4d42c393b41c932f46 


Important

You can take this test anytime between the start date/time and end date/time.
Once the test starts, you cannot pause it. The test will run continuously for 1 hrs .

Before you begin

Before you take the GE Digital - Online Exam - 2023 - IIT Palakkad, we recommend that you take the practice test a few days before the actual test.
Advantages of taking the practice test

You get familiar with the HackerEarth Recruit platform including the proctoring settings. The actual test may have fewer restrictions than the practice test. This advanced familiarity will enable you to solve problems more efficiently during the actual test.
An automatic system-compatibility check is performed before you start the test. If your system isn't compatible, you must make the required changes before you take the actual test.

Regards,
Team GE Digital .

Many students including me got a bugged coding question during today's
Arista coding round. There was no description nor function template nor
constraints and in the sample output irregular spacing was messing up the
test case judgment. We reported this question during the test and have

question were able to complete the test, so I request some action to
be taken immediately.

*****************************************************

Dear Students @Ahalia Hostels,
It has been found that one of the Access points kept in a class room
(Academic Block) was damaged by the students recently. In another incident,
the students have removed the access point from the installed location to a
different location in Hostel 4. They have used self-adhesive tapes to fix
the Access Points on the wall ! Had the access point not been removed by
our duty staff, that would also have been damaged.
Quite interestingly, a ticket was raised today complaining that the access
point was removed !

Such practices would not help us in any way to provide better services.
Hence, we request you to abstain from such activities and instead raise
tickets in the support portal if there are any issues.

The loss to the Institute will be restituted from the students involved in
these cases.


Assuring you of our best services at all times...

Thanks,
With Regards,
Team CET

--

*****************************************************

DAY 310
08/09/2022

*EVEN THIS IS A MEDITATION*

 Become very present wherever you are with whatever you’re doing. Bring
your attention to the different components of your experience, treating the
uncomfortable situations exactly the same as you treat comfortable
situations. Throughout your day, silently repeat the mantra: “Even this is
a meditation.” Observe any changes in your attitude, perception, or
experience.

--

demo and Hands on

*****************************************************

DAY 309
07/09/2022

*MASTERFUL LIFESTYLE *

All of life’s experiences can be likened to the initiations for martial
artists. Sometimes one move must be practiced over and over and over again
until it is mastered in order to achieve one degree of initiation. A
masterful martial artist becomes so through discipline and consistency.
Laziness or complacency has no place in the life of the martial artist, who
maintains great order and commitment in daily life. Throughout your day,
hold yourself to a higher standard. Practice what you know to be true.
Become masterful.


--
 FORWARD TOGETHER
*Team MITRA*
*IIT Palakkad*
*Nila Campus Room# B-224A (Tilang Hostel)*

DAY 311
09/09/2022

*OPEN TO GUIDANCE*

 Sometimes, we can find ourselves at the end of one season, uncertain about
the next. Other times we are faced with challenging decisions to make, or
we feel at a loss for what to do next. For today’s meditation, use the
mantra: *“I am open to guidance.” *There is great power in humility, and
you will attract guidance just through your openness.
--

Important

You can take this test anytime between the start date/time and end date/time.
Once the test starts, you cannot pause it. The test will run continuously for 1 hrs .

Before you begin

Before you take the Premier Institute, we recommend that you take the practice test a few days before the actual test.
Advantages of taking the practice test

You get familiar with the HackerEarth Recruit platform including the proctoring settings. The actual test may have fewer restrictions than the practice test. This advanced familiarity will enable you to solve problems more efficiently during the actual test.
An automatic system-compatibility check is performed before you start the test. If your system isn't compatible, you must make the required changes before you take the actual test.

Regards,
Team ColorTokens

On Tue, Aug 30, 2022 at 5:57 AM Academic Research <acadresearch@iitpkd.ac.in>
wrote:

> Dear All,
>
> Ms. Manju C  who is working with Dr. Uma Divakaran will be presenting her
> research proposal on 1st September 2022 at 02:15 PM.
>
> Title: Entanglement as a measure of chaos in kicked spin systems
>
> Date & Time: 1st September 2022, 2:15 pm
>
> Venue: Room Number 113, MBA Block, Ahalia Campus
>
> Abstract
>
> Chaos is a well studied area in classical systems. The existence of chaos
> in quantum mechanical systems is an area which has received a lot of
> attention lately. The central theme of all these works has been to
> understand the quantum mechanical measures which can identify regular and
> chaotic motions just like phase space trajectories identify regular and
> chaotic motions in classical physics. To study this, the best suited
> example is a kicked top model that exhibits both Classical and Quantum
> dynamics. A parameter in the Hamiltonian is tuned to go from regular to
> chaotic regime. The classical phase space gives a picture of the regular
> and chaotic motions of the system, and in the quantum realm, different
> entanglement measures show features of classical chaos and are identified
> as signatures of classical chaos. We first present the results of a
> disorder free system, and then introduce disorder to study its effect on
> the entanglement measures. We also highlight that the plots in all cases
> lead to a saturation value which can be explained by the Wishart ensemble
> of the Random matrix theory.
>
> All are cordially invited.
>
>
> --
> Thank you
> Regards,
>
> Office of the Dean (Academics)
> IIT Palakkad
>


-- 
Uma Divakaran,
Assistant Professor (Physics),
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad,
Kerala.


*****************************************************

Regards,
Albert

Dear Sir/Madam
Greetings from Technology Innovation Hub at IIT Tirupati

We’d like to invite you to attend the Two-Day Online Workshop on
Hyperspectral Imagery and Its Applications. The workshop is intended for
faculty, research scholars, start-ups/young professionals, scientists, and
stakeholders/end-users. This requires active participation from faculty,
students, business experts, and industry. This workshop introduces in
detail hyperspectral imagery and aims to equip the participants with the
ability to take up their research.


What: Two-Day Online Workshop on Hyperspectral Imagery and Its
Applications

When: September 16-17, 2022

Mode: Online

Website: https://iittnif.com/initiatives/skill-development

Cost:


   - Registration Fees
      - Students/Research Scholars     : ₹ 300/-
      - Faculty/Other                             : ₹ 500/-

IMPORTANT DATES


   - Registration Starts: September 9, 2022 (14:00hrs)
   - Registration Ends: September 15, 2022 (23:59hrs)

To secure your space at the workshop, please RSVP by completing the form
linked below. You must complete the RSVP form by September 15th.

👉RSVP here <https://iittnif.com/initiatives/skill-development>.

Kindly circulate this within your peers, other institutes/contact lists and
encourage them to apply.

hesitate to contact us at programmes@iittnif.com

Dear all,
Greetings!

Hope you are safe and doing well. I am delighted to announce that after a
long wait we have been successful in getting a music room in the Nila
campus. Thus, from now on, room no *201-A* in *Bageshri Hostel* will be
used as the music room.  There are particular instructions that you have to
follow if you want to access the instruments as they are very expensive and
we want you to use them carefully and responsibly as well.

Please fill out *this form* <https://forms.gle/CMrua8BaZQQVi9eY9> if you
want to access instrument/instruments for practice or are curious to learn.
In this case please note that you will not be allowed to take the
instruments outside. If you are a non-vadya member then you will be
accompanied by a vadya member throughout who is aware of using the
instrument that you want to learn.

Please fill out *this form* <https://forms.gle/uzezxkq4bssP1ffj8> if you
want to take the instruments for a specific purpose/event. In this case,
only the event coordinator or the event head should fill the form.

This is our attempt to help students explore their interest in music and I
hope you all will coordinate and cooperate with us in this initiative and
make it fruitful for you as well.

P.S: Please find the basic instructions to be followed *here*
<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1gC1tsc_fGwsMDH23iODQKciF6G5yJ_oUV4TsxljAIMI/edit?usp=sharing>
.

--

*****************************************************

*Phrasal verbs and correct usage*

Examine these phrasal verbs, and use them to fill-in the blanks to make
meaningful sentences

a) Used to: Accustomed to, tolerant or accepting of
b) Wait for: Await the arrival of a person/ event
c) Wait for: Wait for a person to do something
d) Wait up: Wait
e) Wait upon: Wait on; to serve


1) I hope he doesn't expect you to ................... for him.

2) The emperor had dozens of servants to ...................... him.

3) I'm a teacher so I'm ................ speaking in public.

4) She stopped to ............. him, unsure whether to be happy about his
presence or annoyed.

5) Could you .................. me at the bus stop, Mani?

6) She leaned impatiently over the drawing board, unable
to................... him to finish her portrait.

7) Did you ................... last night?

8) Like other kings, the king of Saudi Arabia lived in a beautiful palace
and had many officers and servants to ................him.

9) He wasn't ...............walking so much and his legs hurt after the
hike.

10) They'll have to ............................ their turn to vote, the
same as we did.


*Answers*
1) wait up
2) wait upon
3) used to
4) wait for (b)
5) wait for (b)
6)  wait for (c)
7) wait up
8) wait upon
9) used to
10) wait for (b)


regards, Sandhya
-- 
English Language Support & Services
IIT Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/elss

*****************************************************

Greetings everyone,
Hope this email finds you well.
The boxing club has arranged for a workshop on 'Boxing: Basics' on
06/09/2022 (Tuesday) evening from 4pm to 5pm at Ahalia Gym. This session
will be mainly focusing on introductory lessons of boxing and will be
coached by Dr. Swaroop Sahoo.

Whoever is interested, please attend the session and get literate and
introduced about the fundamentals of boxing. For further queries if any,
please contact Vasanthan (142102014), Club Head. Based on the
participation, we will decide whether to conduct similar sessions in future.
[image: 41868.jpg]
"Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee.."

*Note:* Please join this Pre Placement Talk connect using a Laptop /
standard PC. We encourage you to check the meeting link before the actual

*Microsoft Teams Video Instructions*


**Please use Chrome or Microsoft Edge as they allow full access to meeting
features**
1.     Using your PC, click the meeting link to attend the meeting.
2.     Choose to join the meeting by clicking the “Continue on this
browser” option
3.     Allow Teams to access your microphone and camera (permissions will
appear in a pop-up window)
4.     Press join meeting

Yagnesh Katragadda

*UPLIFTING PLAYLIST *

songs.

*****************************************************

Dear all,
Greetings!

Hope you all are safe and doing well. With immense pleasure, I hereby
welcome the newly formed club - *Yogshala*, the yoga club into the cultural
council of our institute. We have *Steffy Benny*, a research scholar
(Ph.D.) leading the club as the secretary for its first-ever tenure
whereas *Dipanshu
Dutta*, a batch 2021 B.Tech student will be handling the responsibility of
Deputy Secretary. I thank Sujata Priyambada ma'am, the yoga and wellness
instructor for her constant support towards forming the yoga club and her
inputs along the way. I hope with a well-coordinated effort we can
achieve a lot more things in the future.

Opening of new recruitments and other activities of the club will be
provided by the secretary and if you have any more queries and suggestions,
please feel free to contact us.

P.S: Please find the contact details of the secretary - 9539951768 (Steffy
Benny) and the deputy secretary - 9319570167 (Dipanshu Dutta)

-- 
Regards,
Sai Prakesh Vorluvothu
Secretary, Cultural Affairs
Indian Institute of Technology, Palakkad

<https://www.linkedin.com/in/sai-prakesh-vorluvothu-41a6641aa/>

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: IITACB <iitacb2010@gmail.com>
Date: Fri, Sep 2, 2022 at 7:59 AM
Subject: Tomorrow @ 5pm | Dr. Anjan Ray, Director CSIR-Indian Institute of
Petroleum | Decentralised deployment approaches to Energy Sustainability
To: Prof. K.L. Sebastian <deanresearch@iitpkd.ac.in>


Register Now
View this email in your browser
<https://mailchi.mp/6763c0055847/decentralised-deployment-approaches-to-energy-sustainability-15042101?e=f2a2bf3970>
<https://iitacb.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=09d513bf234324e79831cf686&id=aece795e21&e=f2a2bf3970>
REGISTER NOW
<https://iitacb.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=09d513bf234324e79831cf686&id=9c641c95e6&e=f2a2bf3970>

Traditional industrial models and beliefs have driven investments towards
economies of scale in the conventional energy sector, be it mega-refineries
or massive thermal power plants. Can the same principles be applied to
sustainable energy production systems, or do we need a new paradigm of
decentralised deployment and delivery in the context of climate change?

Learning from decentralised solar energy in Europe, can a 1 barrel per day
alternate fuel plant be made economically competitive and ecologically
meaningful in India?

Joining us this Saturday, September 3, 2022 at 5.00pm is Dr Anjan Ray,
Director, CSIR-Indian Institute of Petroleum. He will share his dream of an
India where all fossil fuel imports would be displaced by domestic carbon
atoms and sustainable energy sources, and decentralized pursuit of the
nation’s climate goals would be practiced widely under enabling policies.

*Date:* Saturday, September 3, 2022

*Time: *5.00pm to 6.30pm (IST)

*Charges:* *FREE for all, but registration is mandatory*

*Link to
Register: https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/1116614783252/WN_DHyGq7hMTWCVAZ4dPZmDMQ
<https://iitacb.us12.list-manage.com/track/click?u=09d513bf234324e79831cf686&id=0c688051e9&e=f2a2bf3970>*

*ABOUT THE SPEAKER:*

*Dr. Anjan Ray* is the Director of CSIR-Indian Institute of Petroleum,
Dehradun, India. He received his Doctorate in Chemistry from the University
of Pennsylvania and worked thereafter for over 25 years in the Chemicals
and Energy Industries across functions ranging from Quality Control,
Technical Service, R&D and Marketing to General Management, Mergers &
Acquisitions and Corporate Strategy.  Subsequently, he took up his current
position as Director, CSIR-Institute of Petroleum (CSIR-IIP), Dehradun in
November 2016. Currently, he is entrusted with an additional charge of
CSIR-Central Building Research Institute, Roorkee in addition to his
primary assignment at CSIR-IIP.

Dr. Ray’s professional interests have spanned fields as diverse as
surfactants, lubricants, oleochemicals, cosmetics, pharmaceuticals, oil and
gas, energy efficiency, biofuels, biotechnology, sustainable supply chains,
and renewable energy policy.

Apart from his professional career in chemical technology, Anjan has had an
active interest in media, education, heritage, and environmental
conservation for over 4 decades.  He is a recipient of the Indian
Federation of Green Energy Jury Choice Award for Outstanding Green Energy
Activist in 2021 and was recently a member of India’s delegation to the
56th IPCC Working Group 3 deliberations.
*ABOUT THE MODERATOR:*
*Tejal Kanitkar *is an Associate Professor in the School of Natural
Sciences and Engineering at the National Institute of Advanced Studies,
Bengaluru. She is a mechanical engineer by training and has worked on
various aspects of energy planning and policy, and climate change
mitigation, for over 15 years.

Her research interests lie in the areas of energy, development, and climate
policy. She works on trying to integrate perspectives from the natural
sciences, engineering, and the social sciences to understand the
interconnected aspects of energy production, environmental constraints, and
economic development, with a perspective that prioritizes equity in the era
of acute environmental crises such as climate change.

*****************************************************

DAY 305
03/09/2022

*THIS IS YOUR GENERATION *

Every individual in a generation is the cocreator of that generation’s
history.
♦ Begin your meditation by setting a timer for five minutes and getting
into a comfortable position.
  ♦ Silently repeat the statement: “I am a cocreator of my generation, and
history will remember my contributions.”
♦ When your timer goes off, stretch the body in any way that feels
comfortable for you.
  ♦ Take a deep breath and say out loud, “I am a cocreator of my
generation, and history will remember my contributions.”

-FORWARD TOGETHER-
*Team MITRA*
*IIT Palakkad*
*Nila Campus Room# B-224A (Tilang Hostel)*
*Ahalia Campus#Hostel 3 (Left side Room)*

Hi Everyone,

As said in previous mails, tomorrow's session focuses on the beginner to
intermediate level introduction to the following fields.
1. Competitive Coding
2. Web Development
3. Game Development and
4. Ethical Hacking

Additionally, we openly discuss how to crack interviews, create projects,
participate in hackathons, Inter-IIT Tech Meet etc with the entire YACC
Team. At the end of the session, you can discuss all your doubts with the
YACC Team members.

*Revised Venue and Timings:*
*Saturday, 1:30pm at Ahalia Auditorium in Academic Block*

*Important Note to Nila Students:*
Please take the *bus at 11AM *along with the mess coupons from Nila to
Ahalia.

*Note for all students:*
*Complete your lunch early and be there on time for the sess!*

*Join YACC on Discord*: https://discord.gg/sVtEgQCqCk

Thanks and Regards,
*Yet Another Coding Club (YACC)*
*IIT Palakkad*

*****************************************************

Hello everyone!

We are proud to announce that we will be resuming offline sessions after
almost 2 years!

We are planning to host an interactive session where we will discuss all
streams offered by YACC, Competitive Coding, Web Development, Ethical
Hacking, Game Development. We will showcase projects and showcase how to
approach problem statements and how to start in any of these streams. You
will also get a chance to meet the YACC team (12 members), and openly ask
us about internships, projects, hackathons, coding
competitions, placements, and lots more.

Venue - *Ahalia Auditorium, 9pm,* *Tomorrow ( 1st September, 2022 )*
For mechanical and civil students residing in Nila, a Zoom link will be
given.

Looking forward to seeing everyone there! The YACC team is very excited!

*Join YACC on Discord*: https://discord.gg/sVtEgQCqCk

Thanks and Regards,
*Yet Another Coding Club (YACC)*
*IIT Palakkad*

CS5617-M-2022 -> Forums -> Announcements -> Spec submission and First Quiz
https://lms.iitpkd.ac.in/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=250#p279
Spec submission and First Quiz
by Ramaswamy Krishnan Chittur - Saturday, 3 September 2022, 2:52 PM
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Folks:

As discussed in class, please:

* Submit the hard copy of your specification documents to the TA before 7
PM on the 24th of September (Saturday).
* We'll conduct the first quiz on the 30th of September Friday taking an
hour off of our class. Please just bring a pen. Syllabus is: Object
Oriented Design, Software Development Life Cycle, Design Patterns (classic
as well as UX), UML. Questions would be about theory as well as about some
basic coding around the aforementioned topics.

Please also find under this week's section, the UX code sample that we
discussed in class.

Thank you.

Change your forum digest preferences:
https://lms.iitpkd.ac.in/mod/forum/index.php?id=121


*****************************************************

Trending Stories from Money Business

-----




Sometimes we get so engrossed with the routine work that we end up doing things mechanically and become comfortable in our current situation.

It leads to stagnancy and we continuously lose self-confidence and motivation to take up new challenges.

At the end blame game starts and it leads to more negativity.

Remember our personal growth is entirely in our own hands. We have to follow our huger of growth and keep looking for new horizons apart from our comfort zones.

You need to ask this question to yourself every day. "Am I giving my best?"

If you keep running away from this question, the answer for growth will always be going to be a ’Never’.
Read More: https://www.quora.com/qemail/track_click?aoid=jxyEjwfSiwU&aoty=4&aty=4&cp=0&ct=1662133815866299&et=146&id=5db1914c7d5b4ef5b873e260a630a23b&notif_type=418&request_id=418&snid=41613971265&src=1&st=1662133815870023&stories=%5B(%3Cstory_types.tribe_post%3A+10%3E%2C+78832232)%2C+(%3Cstory_types.tribe_post%3A+10%3E%2C+80053790)%2C+(%3Cstory_types.tribe_post%3A+10%3E%2C+78739053)%5D&tribe_item_ids=MAYNw9YGBAS%7Cj6QeQ0SZoT1%7CMDfW6PA2CMK&uid=Mcebbm1BPpQ&v=0
-----



Answer from Adam Fayed

SStep by step, over time, all you need to do is:

1. Start asap - ideally start young
2. Have a middle-class income or better
3. Do anything to improve that income. Even small
Read More: https://www.quora.com/How-do-you-amass-a-large-wealth-over-time/answer/Adam-Fayed
-----


Are you confused with Sukanya Samrudhi Yojana and PPF for your princess? Go through it.


Answer from Preeti Zende (प्रीती झेंडे)

If you are blessed to have a girl child and you are confused between the Sukanya Samrudhi Yojana and Public Provident fund as a debt part of the portfolio meant for your daugh
Read More: https://www.quora.com/Can-I-open-both-a-PPF-and-an-SSY-account-for-my-daughter/answer/Preeti-Zende-1
-----

-----

*****************************************************

DAY 303
01/09/2022

*HANDWASHING MEDITATION*

 Make washing your hands a meditation.
  ♦ Take a few deep breaths and experience the temperature of the water.
  ♦ Really notice the fragrance of the soap, massaging it into your hands.
  ♦ Mindfully clean every part of the hands, between the fingers,
underneath the fingernails.
♦ Experience it all as if for the first time.

-FORWARD TOGETHER
*Team MITRA*
*IIT Palakkad*
*Nila Campus Room# B-224A (Tilang Hostel)*
*Ahalia Campus#Hostel 3 (Left side Room)*
https://www.facebook.com/TEAM.MITRA.IIT.PALAKKAD

*****************************************************

See the attached photos of the Innovation lab in the Ahalia campus -- the
tables are messy, leftover food is all over the place. If you cannot use
the facility responsibly, then we will have to severely restrict entry to
the lab. Genuine users amongst the students will suffer.

Last fortnight, just as we were reopening, we found that many first year
projects had been vandalized. Parts removed, Arduino boards missing.

Similar  behaviour has been seen in the EE labs in Nila nd Ahali as well

A lot of money and effort goes into setting up and managing facilities for
you. USE THEM RESPONSIBLY.


*****************************************************

Dear Arvind,
Sorry to see how freedom and free access are misutilized by the students.
Hats off to those underserved students. We are seeing similar behavior
elsewhere in the institute as well.
The only solution is to control and monitor the entry and their use of
facilities in the innovation labs.
Thank you,
Jagadeesh


--
Prof. Dr. Jagadeesh Bayry,
Dean (Student Affairs),
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
Sikharam block, Nila Campus.

FYI

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: , Skand <peris@oregonstate.edu>
Date: Thu, Sep 1, 2022 at 8:05 PM
Subject: Artificial Intelligence Application Support Program for
underrepresented groups @ Oregon State University
To: <ckn@iitpkd.ac.in>


Hi Sir,


I hope things are great at Palakkad! I'm reaching out on behalf of the
Artificial
Intelligence Graduate Student Association (AIGSA) at Oregon State
University. Our organization represents the graduate student body of the AI
program here, as well as students researching artificial intelligence at
the university in general.

This year, we're launching the Artificial Intelligence Application Support
Program (AIASP), a service run by volunteer graduate students in our school
to assist folks historically underrepresented in the field as they apply to
AI graduate programs (M.S./Ph.D.) at OSU!

The program is divided into two phases:

   1.

   Graduate School Chats. In the first phase, applicants will have a
   30-minute one-on-one chat with one of our mentors. These chats will provide
   perspective to applicants wondering if graduate school is right for them,
   and demystify the application process.
   2.

   Application Feedback. In the second phase, applicants will receive early
   feedback on their Statement of Purpose and CV. They may share any
   information about their identity and research interests that they'd like
   considered when matching their application materials with a mentor for
   review.


If you think this program will benefit your undergraduate or graduate
(M.Tech) students, I would deeply appreciate you taking the time to pass it
along! You can find more information on our website at aigsa.club/aiasp
<https://www.aigsa.club/aiasp/> and register to participate with this form
https://forms.gle/dc425Z944hLm4brb7.

Please do not hesitate to reach out if you have any questions, comments, or
concerns; we're always happy to answer!

Best,

Skand

> Dear All,

> It is a pleasure to invite you for a talk by Dr. Ujjwal Maulik, a
> Professor of Computer Science from Jadavpur University. The details of the
> talk are provided below. The speaker will also be available for interaction
> post the talk.
>
> *Title: Single and Multi-objective Data Clustering*
> *Location:* Ahalia 120
> *Time:* 11.00am-12.00pm
> *Abstract: *Data clustering is a popular unsupervised pattern
> classification technique that is used for partitioning a given data set
> into homogeneous groups based on some similarity/dissimilarity metric.
> There are several single objective clustering algorithms available and
> popular in the literature including KMean and FCM. Although both KMean and
> FCM are very popular algorithms, they may stuck to local optima depending
> on the choice of initial cluster centers. In this lecture first we will
> demonstrate how Metaheuristic techniques can be used to solve the problem
> of KMean/FCM. Result will be demonstrated for pixel classification of
> satellite images. In the second part of the lecture we will discuss more on
> Multiobjective clustering, in which multiple objective functions are
> simultaneously optimized. Selecting one solution from the set of Pareto
> Optimal solutions is always a critical issue. We will also discuss how
> machine learning techniques like Support Vector Machine (SVM) can be used
> to combine the Pareto Optimal solutions to evolve a better solution. The
> result will be demonstrated for classification of Micro Array Gene
> Expression Data.

> of Comp. Sc. and Engg., Jadavpur University since 2004. He was also the

> Kalayni Govt. Engg. College. Dr. Maulik has worked in many universities and
> research laboratories around the world as visiting Professor/ Scientist

> Australia in 1999, Univ. of Texas at Arlington, USA in 2001, Univ. of
> Maryland at Baltimore County, USA in 2004, Fraunhofer Institute for

> University of Warsaw in 2013 and 2019, University of Padova, Italy in 2014
> and 2016, Corvinus University, Budapest, Hungary in 2015 and 2016,
> University of Ljubljana, Slovenia in 2015 and 2017, International Center
> for Theoretical Physics (ICTP), Trieste, Italy in 2014, 2017 and 2018. He
> is the recipient of Alexander von Humboldt Fellowship during 2010, 2011 and
> 2012 and Senior Associate of ICTP, Italy during 2012-2018. He is the Fellow
> of Indian National Academy of Engineers (INAE), India, National Academy of
> Science India (NASI), International Association for Pattern Recognition
> (IAPR), USA and The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
> (IEEE), USA. He is also the Distinguish Member of the ACM. He is
> Distinguished Speaker of IEEE as well as ACM. His research interest include
> Machine Learning, Pattern Analysis, Data Science, Bioinformatics,
> Multi-objective Optimization, Social Networking, IoT and Autonomous Car. In
> these areas he has published ten books, more than four hundred papers,
> mentoring several start-ups, filed several patents and already guided
> twenty two doctoral students. His other interest include outdoor Sports and
> Classical Music.
>
> All are welcome.
>
> Thanks and regards
