*****************************************************

Dear All,

It is a pleasure to invite you for a talk by Dr. Ujjwal Maulik, a Professor
of Computer Science from Jadavpur University. The details of the talk are
provided below. The speaker will also be available for interaction post the
talk.

*Title: Single and Multi-objective Data Clustering*
*Location:* Ahalia 120
*Time:* 11.00am-12.00pm
*Abstract: *Data clustering is a popular unsupervised pattern
classification technique that is used for partitioning a given data set
into homogeneous groups based on some similarity/dissimilarity metric.
There are several single objective clustering algorithms available and
popular in the literature including KMean and FCM. Although both KMean and
FCM are very popular algorithms, they may stuck to local optima depending
on the choice of initial cluster centers. In this lecture first we will
demonstrate how Metaheuristic techniques can be used to solve the problem
of KMean/FCM. Result will be demonstrated for pixel classification of
satellite images. In the second part of the lecture we will discuss more on
Multiobjective clustering, in which multiple objective functions are
simultaneously optimized. Selecting one solution from the set of Pareto
Optimal solutions is always a critical issue. We will also discuss how
machine learning techniques like Support Vector Machine (SVM) can be used
to combine the Pareto Optimal solutions to evolve a better solution. The
result will be demonstrated for classification of Micro Array Gene
Expression Data.


*Biography of the Speaker:* Dr. Ujjwal Maulik is a Professor in the Dept.
of Comp. Sc. and Engg., Jadavpur University since 2004. He was also the
former Head of the same Department. He also held the position of the
Principal in charge and the Head of the Dept. of Comp. Sc. and Engg.,
Kalayni Govt. Engg. College. Dr. Maulik has worked in many universities and
research laboratories around the world as visiting Professor/ Scientist
including Los Alamos National Lab., USA in 1997, Univ. of New South Wales,
Australia in 1999, Univ. of Texas at Arlington, USA in 2001, Univ. of
Maryland at Baltimore County, USA in 2004, Fraunhofer Institute for
Autonome Intelligent Systems, St. Augustin, Germany in 2005, Tsinghua
Univ., China in 2007, Sapienza Univ., Rome, Italy in 2008, Univ. of
Heidelberg, Germany in 2009, German Cancer Research Center (DKFZ), Germany
in 2010, 2011 and 2012, Grenoble INP, France in 2010, 2013 and 2016,
University of Warsaw in 2013 and 2019, University of Padova, Italy in 2014
and 2016, Corvinus University, Budapest, Hungary in 2015 and 2016,
University of Ljubljana, Slovenia in 2015 and 2017, International Center
for Theoretical Physics (ICTP), Trieste, Italy in 2014, 2017 and 2018. He
is the recipient of Alexander von Humboldt Fellowship during 2010, 2011 and
2012 and Senior Associate of ICTP, Italy during 2012-2018. He is the Fellow
of Indian National Academy of Engineers (INAE), India, National Academy of
Science India (NASI), International Association for Pattern Recognition
(IAPR), USA and The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
(IEEE), USA. He is also the Distinguish Member of the ACM. He is
Distinguished Speaker of IEEE as well as ACM. His research interest include
Machine Learning, Pattern Analysis, Data Science, Bioinformatics,
Multi-objective Optimization, Social Networking, IoT and Autonomous Car. In
these areas he has published ten books, more than four hundred papers,
mentoring several start-ups, filed several patents and already guided
twenty two doctoral students. His other interest include outdoor Sports and
Classical Music.

All are welcome.

Thanks and regards
ck

*****************************************************

Dear Students,



We are opening the third phase of registration (Add/Drop phase) in Fedena.
Please add or drop courses in this phase only after obtaining the prior
consent of the instructor and your faculty advisor.* Remember that this is
the last chance to add any course.* The deadline for this phase is 5 pm,
1st September 2022.



 *Kindly ensure that all the courses you registered in the
previous phases are reflected in your course log as “approved” by the
instructor and Faculty advisor. If not, kindly add the
missing courses again in this phase for registration.*


You are permitted to add / drop the courses that you are currently
attending with the consent of the concerned instructor and your faculty
advisor.



Please note:

1.    The user guide attached includes the required instructions.

2.     After the above deadline, any changes you make will go to the
instructor and faculty advisor and will be reflected in
your registration only after their approval.

3. Newly joined PG students are requested to add the courses that you are
doing in this semester.

4. Register your backlog courses by selecting backlog courses from
Additional courses.

If you have any technical difficulty in logging into the portal, please
write an email to records@iitpkd.ac.in . Mr. Kiran will be happy to assist
you. If you have any academic related queries, please fill in the google
form attached herewith: Google Form for ADD/DROP Issue
<https://forms.gle/Vt9BhSm7JsUdHWe5A>.

-- 
*With Thanks and Regards*
*Academics Section*
*IIT Palakkad*

*****************************************************

Dear all,
Some students, especially after dinner, have been observed to disregard the
specified times for going to the mess and instead choose to enter after the
specified timings. Strictly adhere to the mess timings. Those who are
discovered to be not adhering to the proper timing will face consequences.


Mess timing is mentioned below.


*Breakfast*

*7:30 to 9:30 a.m. on*

*weekdays*

*&*

*8:00 to 9.30 a.m. on*

*Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays*

*All students*

*Lunch*

*12:00 PM to 1:00 PM*

*Scholars, staff and faculty*

*(Btech and pg students can also go as per class/bus timings).*

*1:00 PM to 2:00 PM*

*BTech and PG students*

*Snacks*

*5:00 PM to 5:45 PM *

*All students*

*Dinner*

*7:30 PM to 9:00 PM*

*All students*

*****************************************************

Dear Students,
It has been noticed that some users are downloading copyright protected
materials through proxy browsers and torrent applications. Downloading such
files (movies) through Bittorrent is an illegal activity.
We have received infringement notice from the law enforcement agencies.
*The user, who has been downloading such contents,  will have to face the
legal consequences as per the national and international law.*
Hence, we would like to request  you to kindly restrain from such  illegal
activities.
We would also like to request you to uninstall your torrent applications
from your devices.
As we have a complete log of the network activities, such users will be
blocked automatically to avoid future infringements.

Thanks
With regards,
Biju

*****************************************************

Dear Students,
The Senate in its 21st meeting approved the BTech with Honours (by
Research) option in addition to the already existing course based BTech
with Honours. The details can be found in the amended BTech Regulations R2.8
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1n-7VEhNq_bGal5mpMMlhFJSE6fQqfLTV/view>.
Please take a look if you are interested in BTech with Honours (by
Research) Degree at the time of graduation. This needs planning and
execution for about one year.

Further, the 100% weightage options for Supplementary Examination has been
enabled and the details can be found in the amended BTech Regulations R
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1n-7VEhNq_bGal5mpMMlhFJSE6fQqfLTV/view>17.
Please check the regulations if you are planning to take the supplementary
exam option.

Best, Sovan

*Sovan Lal Das*
*Associate Professor of Mechanical Engineering and*

*Dean (Academics)*

*Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad*

That cool catchphrase, that hilarious quote, or a completely new, amazing

*****************************************************

*Listen and learn!*

Today we will hear about a new kind of job that digital technology has
created in the world. Listen to it here
<https://www.bbc.co.uk/learningenglish/english/features/6-minute-english_2022/ep-220825>

After paying attention to the video, answer these questions:

1) The two cities mentioned in the video are
a) Lagos and Karachi
b) Addis and Islamabad
c) Islamabad and Lagos

2) In the game 'Happy families' which of the following is not represented
a) candle-stick maker
b) butcher
c) baker

3) Rammal Mehmud says her viewers are very intrigued about
a) her children
b) her personal life
c) her pets

4) Besides lipstick, the Sumerians
a) painted their face and eyes
b) painted their eyes and nose
c) plaited their hair

5) Social media influencer and Youtuber are examples of
a) 21st century jobs
b) careers for those who can't be doctors and engineers
c) modern day counterparts of butchers and bakers

6) Which of the following is 'a given' in an Indian wedding
a) dowry
b) it will be ' a big fat' Indian wedding
c) a bride and a groom

*Answers*
1) c
2) a
3) b
4) a
5) a
6) c

regards, Sandhya

-- 
English Language Support & Services
IIT Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/elss

*****************************************************

DAY 301
30/08/2022

*EMOTIONAL INVENTORY*

 Take out a journal or a blank sheet of paper. Write out at least one full
page of whatever emotions you are currently experiencing. Imagine that no
one will ever see this. List whatever you’re feeling, take a full inventory
of whatever comes up, and save it for yourself to reflect on for insight at
another time

-- -FORWARD TOGETHER-

IIT Palakkad Intern + NCG 2022 - Submission Confirmation


Hello,

Thanks for completing **IIT Palakkad Intern + NCG 2022**. We've sent your submission to Indeed.

In the meantime, you can go ahead and solve more of such code challenges on [HackerRank](https://www.hackerrank.com/dashboard?h_r=hrw&h_l=confirmation_email&utm_source=hrw&utm_campaign=confirmation_domains&utm_medium=email).Solving code challenges is a great way to keep your skills sharp for interviews.  
    
Wish you all the best for your test result! 🤞  
    
This is an automated message. Please **do not** reply to this. You'll need to contact **Indeed** directly for any follow-up questions.

Thanks,  
HackerRank Team



PS: HackerRank only provides a platform to conduct the challenges. It does not schedule or evaluate
any hiring challenges or conduct interviews for any company. Please directly contact the company
that sent you the invite for such purposes.

Dear all,

Greetings on the auspicious occasion of Ganesh Chaturthi. On this occasion,
we planned several cultural activities. The following is the schedule:

31st August, 4 p.m. to 5 p.m.: Rangoli competition
Venue: Acad Block

31st August, 5:00 PM: performance by Sync to Beat
Venue: Acad Block

31st August, 5:15 PM to 7 PM: performance by Vadya, Open Mic
Venue: Acad Block

Arrangements and changes for August 31st:


   - During dinner, there will be Modak (sweet) in both messes.
   - At 7:15 PM, a bus is scheduled to go from Ahalia to Nila.
   - For dinner on Wednesday and Thursday, the mess menu is swapped.
   (Tonight is the dinner of Thursday.)
   - Tonight the night canteen (Ahalia) will be open and closed on Thursday.

*****************************************************

Dear All,
As per the CERT-in communique,  multiple vulnerabilities have been reported
in various Microsoft products, which could be exploited by an attacker to
access sensitive information, bypass security restrictions, perform a
denial of service(DoS) attack,escalating privileges, perform spoofing
attacks or executing arbitrary codes on the targeted systems.

The following products are affected
Windows, MS Office, Visual Studio..etc.

All the Windows users are requested to apply the appropriate security
updates.
To update, go to the settings tab and install the latest update.
And if the auto-update option is enabled, then your device will be updated
to the latest software version automatically.

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/releaseNote/2022-Aug

Vulnerabilities were also detected in Google Chrome versions prior to
104.0.5112.79.
So, we request all the Chrome users to upgrade your browser to the latest
version.

PS: The information provided in this mail is on an  "as is" basis, without
warranty of any kind.

Thanks
With regards,
biju

-- 
K V Biju
Technical Officer | IIT Palakkad
Ahalia Integrated Campus | Kozhippara PO | Palakkad Dist | Kerala 678557
Call: +91-4923 226 309/390
GSM:+91-9497718136/8281112815 | Email:kvbiju@iitpkd.ac.in

Dear all,
Western Digital will be coming for recruitment for the 1st time. The HR of
the company has asked for a very good response from students and would like
to have the sessions as interactive as possible (It is recommended to have
your videos on).
This could be a dream company for some of you and hence I request your
participation and kind attention in the interactive session and Clear all
your doubts.

*See you all at 6 PM today*.

P.S. Join the meeting 5 min before on the Microsoft Team meeting link
shared in the trailing mail.

Dear All,
   Just to add to the previous email, please find attached a few more
instructions.
1. *You are not supposed to unplug any of the LAN Cables from the systems
in the computer labs under any cost. For your personal laptops, you have to
take care of the internet.*
*2. A few companies ask to upload the resumes before the start of the exam.
Hence, please keep a copy of the resumes in your drive before the exam
itself.*

On Fri, Aug 26, 2022 at 12:48 AM Yagnesh Katragadda <
111901027@smail.iitpkd.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear All,
>      Please note that *all the placement and internship tests will be
> conducted in the computer labs.* Please keep note of the following
> instructions.
>
> 1. Be at the computer lab at least 15 mins before the test time so that
> you can log in and set up the systems properly.
> 2. Align the cameras properly so that the neighbouring students are not
> visible before the start of the test.
> 3. Please keep your mobiles on silent mode.
> 4. Do not leave the exam hall immediately after you are done as it might
> show up in the cameras of other students.
> 5. Do not make noise once your exam is done.
> 6. You will not be allowed to go out in between the exam.
> 7. If you wish to use your own systems to take up the exams, you can do so
> in the computer lab but it's your responsibility to take care of the
> internet issues etc...
> 8. All students are expected to inform the respective student coordinators
> handling the process in case you have any problem(s) due to which he/she
> would like to skip the test etc...
> 9. *All students have to attend all the processes once you apply for a
> company till the point you are disqualified/qualified to further rounds.*
>
>
>
> Regards,
> Yagnesh Katragadda
> B.Tech Overall Coordinator,
> Career Development Centre,
> Indian Institute of Technology, Palakkad
> Contact No: +91 9908183474
> Email: 111901027@smail.iitpkd.ac.in
> Website: cdc.iitpkd.ac.in

*****************************************************

Dear All,
     Please note that *all the placement and internship tests will be
conducted in the computer labs.* Please keep note of the following
instructions.

1. Be at the computer lab at least 15 mins before the test time so that you
can log in and set up the systems properly.
2. Align the cameras properly so that the neighbouring students are not
visible before the start of the test.
3. Please keep your mobiles on silent mode.
4. Do not leave the exam hall immediately after you are done as it might
show up in the cameras of other students.
5. Do not make noise once your exam is done.
6. You will not be allowed to go out in between the exam.
7. If you wish to use your own systems to take up the exams, you can do so
in the computer lab but it's your responsibility to take care of the
internet issues etc...
8. All students are expected to inform the respective student coordinators
handling the process in case you have any problem(s) due to which he/she
would like to skip the test etc...
9. *All students have to attend all the processes once you apply for a
company till the point you are disqualified/qualified to further rounds.*



Regards,
Yagnesh Katragadda
B.Tech Overall Coordinator,
Career Development Centre,
Indian Institute of Technology, Palakkad
Contact No: +91 9908183474
Email: 111901027@smail.iitpkd.ac.in
Website: cdc.iitpkd.ac.in

approaching (https://event.iitg.ac.in/ncc2023/imp_dates.php).
<https://event.iitg.ac.in/ncc2023/imp_dates.php>
Welcome to NCC 2023 (29th National Conference on Communications), IIT
Guwahati <https://event.iitg.ac.in/ncc2023/imp_dates.php>
The Twenty-Ninth NCC will be jointly organized by IIT Guwahati, IIT Patna
and IIT Ropar. The conference will be offline and will be held at IIT
Guwahati during February 23 - 26, 2023.
event.iitg.ac.in

<https://event.iitg.ac.in/ncc2023/sub.php>

Welcome to NCC 2023 (29th National Conference on Communications), IIT
Guwahati <https://event.iitg.ac.in/ncc2023/index.php>
Paper submission portal will open on 1st July, 2022 . The National
Conference on Communications (NCC) is a flagship conference of India in the
broad areas of communications, organized every year by the Joint Telematics
Group (JTG) of the IITs and the IISc.
event.iitg.ac.in
Five plenary speakers (https://event.iitg.ac.in/ncc2023/plenary.php) and
nine invited speakers (https://event.iitg.ac.in/ncc2023/invited.php) have
been finalized.
<https://event.iitg.ac.in/ncc2023/plenary.php>
Welcome to NCC 2023 (29th National Conference on Communications), IIT
Guwahati <https://event.iitg.ac.in/ncc2023/plenary.php>
The Twenty-Ninth NCC will be jointly organized by IIT Guwahati, IIT Patna
and IIT Ropar. The conference will be offline and will be held at IIT
Guwahati during February 23 - 26, 2023.
event.iitg.ac.in

You are also requested to forward the call for papers of NCC 2023 (
https://event.iitg.ac.in/ncc2023/pdf/NCC_2023_CFP.pdf) to your colleagues
who would be interested to submit papers to the conference.

*****************************************************

Dear All,

Due to OFC break, Nila campus is cut off from Ahalia Campus. Consequently,
the following services are affected.

Internet in computer labs at Nila
License Servers
PG Portal, Joinus and Faculty portals.
Telephone Services.

However, limited Internet connectivity is available at Nila Campus through
the failover connection from Railtel.

We are working with BSNL to get the cable repaired at the earliest. The
inconvenience caused is regretted.

With regards,
Biju

DAY 297
26/08/2022

*LETTERS OF HOPE *

Consider someone in your life who is going through a hard time. With love
and generosity, write a message of hope to them. When you are finished,
sign the letter, tear it up, and throw it away, imagining that the message
of hope is being released into the universe.

FORWARD TOGETHER
--

*IIT Palakkad*

From: TECHgium <TECHgium@ltts.com>
Date: Thu, Aug 25, 2022 at 9:57 AM
Subject: L&T Technology Services | TECHgium 6th Edition | Global Innovation
Challenge | Invitation to Register
To: TECHgium <TECHgium@ltts.com>






Dear Sir/Madam,



*We are proud to announce and invite you to be a part of our sixth edition
of TECHgium® - 2022 !*



TECHgium® is a multi-stage Innovation competition by L&T Technology
Services for students across the world.



*TECHgium® provides a platform for *

   - Students to engage on real-world industry use cases and challenges to
   come up with solutions and taking a step towards industry readiness
   - For institutes and faculty to engage with industry challenge
   statements along with the students and thereby taking steps towards
   bridging gap between industry and academia
   - Top 3 winning teams take away prizes worth 18Lakhs.



Please find attached TECHgium poster and brochure that has details and
timeline that you may use to circulate to the students.



The below is the process for TECHgium registration and participation.



   1. *Stage1: *

*Step1: Institute registration *

                                                               i.
Institute
register on TECHgium portal (https://ltts.techgium.com
<https://ind01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fltts.techgium.com%2F&data=05%7C01%7Carchana.s1%40ltts.com%7C492ef6b5472e4baf5f0408da7b5cb9a5%7C311b33788e8a4b5ea33fe80a3d8ba60a%7C0%7C0%7C637957936375627283%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=LzrzvOEDM0MwSdx%2BH4IzetOJ6hH7jyAUTBG%2FdXU%2B0Js%3D&reserved=0>).
This process generates a unique institute id. (Institute can sign in, if
already registered earlier)

                                                             ii.      The
unique institute id is passed on to the students by the institute received
through LTTS.

*Step2: Student registration*

                                                           iii.      Students
(pre-final and final year of their engineering degree) register on the
portal and use the unique institute id to complete their respective
registration

*Step3:  Challenge Statement selection by students and concept submission*

                                                           iv.      Students
view the challenge statements available on TECHgium portal. Any queries can
also be submitted through the portal.

                                                             v.      Students
submit concept note against selected challenge statement on the portal.

                                                           vi.      Students
have the option to invite faculty from their institutes as mentor who can
guide them through this journey.

Shortlisted students move to Stage2



   1. *Stage2: *

*Step4: Full Technical Paper*

                                                               i.      Students
work on technical paper/presentation around the concept suggested by them
in stage1.

                                                             ii.
Shortlisted
students are invited for presentation to a Jury identified by LTTS

Shortlisted students move to Stage3.



   1. *Stage3:*

*Step5: Proof Of Concept (POC) Demonstration *

                                                               i.      Students
work on a POC of their solution.

                                                             ii.      Students
showcase their POC to Jury identified by LTTS.

                                                           iii.      Students
demonstrating POCs have option to appear for LTTS recruitment process

Shortlisted students move to Stage 4 finale presentation.



   1. *Stage4:*

*Step6: Finale Presentation*

                                                               i.
Presentation
by students to LTTS identified Jury.



   1. *Stage5:*

*Step7: Award Ceremony*

                                                               i.      Top
3 Winner announcement.



*Top 3 Prizes*

*1st Prize ~ 10 Lakhs*

*2nd Prize ~ 5 Lakhs*

*3rd Prize ~ 3 Lakhs*



*Apart from the awards and prizes for the winners, all the participants of
POC demonstration round of this competition will be called for
Pre-Placement process at LTTS.*



Please feel free to write to us at TECHgium@ltts.com in case of any queries
in this regard.



We look forward to an enthusiastic participation in TECHgium® 6th Edition
by your students and faculty members.





Link to Register : (https://ltts.techgium.com
<https://ind01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fltts.techgium.com%2F&data=05%7C01%7Carchana.s1%40ltts.com%7C492ef6b5472e4baf5f0408da7b5cb9a5%7C311b33788e8a4b5ea33fe80a3d8ba60a%7C0%7C0%7C637957936375627283%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=LzrzvOEDM0MwSdx%2BH4IzetOJ6hH7jyAUTBG%2FdXU%2B0Js%3D&reserved=0>

*****************************************************

Dear All,

SPICMACAY IIT Palakkad Chapter is restarting its activities after a long
gap with *Sufi Qawwali by Ustad Ateeq Hussain Khan Bandanawazi Al-Hashmi*,
as per the details below.


*Date : August 24th, 2022 (Wednesday)*
*Time: 5:30 pm*
*Venue: Agora, Nila Campus, IIT Palakkad*



*About the Artist:*
Ateeq Hussain Khan is a Hindustani Qawwal  from Hyderabad who performs in
Bandish, Thumri, Bhajan Tarana Ghazal etc in Hindustani Classical Music. He
is the son of renowned Hindustani singer Iqubal Hussain Khan Bandanawazi of
Gwaliar Gharana, who was a Sufi singer too. Ustaad Ateeq's  Qawwali group
is known as *Bandanawazi Qawwal. *The group received *Sangeet Ratna Samman*
from the Maharashtra Art & Culture Department.


*About SPIC MACAY *
(Society for the Promotion of Indian Classical Music And Culture Amongst
Youth): SPIC MACAY is a non-political nationwide voluntary movement that
organizes programmes of classical music and dance, folk arts, crafts, yoga,
classic cinema screenings, heritage walks, etc. inside school and college
campuses throughout the world to make students more aware about the Indian
and world heritage.

*SPIC MACAY chapter at IIT Palakkad started on October 23, 2017, with an
idea of providing a platform for the students to admire and appreciate the
beauty of Indian culture. For more details, please visit our webpage
https://spicmacayiitpkd.wixsite.com/mysite
<https://spicmacayiitpkd.wixsite.com/mysite>*

Poster is also attached for more details about the program.

We believe that this will be a never before experience for all of you, and
hope for an active participation from all of you.

Regards,
SPIC MACAY IIT Palakkad



-- 
Uma Divakaran,
Assistant Professor (Physics),
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad,
Kerala.

Hope you are doing well,

KnowDis brings you the 4th edition of Machine Learning Day. This will be an
online event to be held on 14th October 2022. The conference seeks to
accelerate knowledge dissemination and spark new ideas by hosting
interactive and focused sessions with world-leading researchers and
practitioners.
[image: image.png]


As participants in the KnowDis Machine Learning Day 2022, you will gain
access to a unique audience of international researchers, developers,
entrepreneurs, and other people interested in Machine Learning and AI.



This is a free international online conference and we hope to see you there.

>> SPICMACAY IIT Palakkad Chapter is restarting its activities after a long
>> gap with *Sufi Qawwali by Ustad Ateeq Hussain Khan Bandanawazi Al-Hashmi*,
>> as per the details below.

>> *Date : August 24th, 2022 (Wednesday)*
>> *Time: 5:30 pm*
>> *Venue: Agora, Nila Campus, IIT Palakkad*
>>
>>
>>
>> *About the Artist:*
>> Ateeq Hussain Khan is a Hindustani Qawwal  from Hyderabad who performs in
>> Bandish, Thumri, Bhajan Tarana Ghazal etc in Hindustani Classical Music. He
>> is the son of renowned Hindustani singer Iqubal Hussain Khan Bandanawazi of
>> Gwaliar Gharana, who was a Sufi singer too. Ustaad Ateeq's  Qawwali group
>> is known as *Bandanawazi Qawwal. *The group received *Sangeet Ratna
>> Samman* from the Maharashtra Art & Culture Department.
>>
>>
>> *About SPIC MACAY *
>> (Society for the Promotion of Indian Classical Music And Culture Amongst
>> Youth): SPIC MACAY is a non-political nationwide voluntary movement that
>> organizes programmes of classical music and dance, folk arts, crafts, yoga,
>> classic cinema screenings, heritage walks, etc. inside school and college
>> campuses throughout the world to make students more aware about the Indian
>> and world heritage.
>>
>> *SPIC MACAY chapter at IIT Palakkad started on October 23, 2017, with an
>> idea of providing a platform for the students to admire and appreciate the
>> beauty of Indian culture. For more details, please visit our webpage
>> https://spicmacayiitpkd.wixsite.com/mysite
>> <https://spicmacayiitpkd.wixsite.com/mysite>*
>>
>> Poster is also attached for more details about the program.
>>
>> We believe that this will be a never before experience for all of you,
>> and hope for an active participation from all of you.
>>
>> Regards,
>> SPIC MACAY IIT Palakkad
>>
>>
>>
>> --
>> Uma Divakaran,
>> Assistant Professor (Physics),
>> Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad,
>> Kerala.

*****************************************************

Dear all,

Please refer to the broadcast message of Dr. Uma Divakaran.

*Today evening,* we are conducting a first ever post-pandemic cultural
event by external artists in Nila campus.

The event is being organized by SPICMACAY IIT Palakkad Chapter in
association with Wellness Hub of the institute.

Please attend the event in big number and encourage the artists.
Thank you,
Jagadeesh

On Sun, Aug 21, 2022 at 11:12 PM Uma Divakaran <uma@iitpkd.ac.in> wrote:

>
> Dear All,
>
> SPICMACAY IIT Palakkad Chapter is restarting its activities after a long
> gap with *Sufi Qawwali by Ustad Ateeq Hussain Khan Bandanawazi Al-Hashmi*,
> as per the details below.
>
>
> *Date : August 24th, 2022 (Wednesday)*
> *Time: 5:30 pm*
> *Venue: Agora, Nila Campus, IIT Palakkad*
>
>
>
> *About the Artist:*
> Ateeq Hussain Khan is a Hindustani Qawwal  from Hyderabad who performs in
> Bandish, Thumri, Bhajan Tarana Ghazal etc in Hindustani Classical Music. He
> is the son of renowned Hindustani singer Iqubal Hussain Khan Bandanawazi of
> Gwaliar Gharana, who was a Sufi singer too. Ustaad Ateeq's  Qawwali group
> is known as *Bandanawazi Qawwal. *The group received *Sangeet Ratna
> Samman* from the Maharashtra Art & Culture Department.
>
>
> *About SPIC MACAY *
> (Society for the Promotion of Indian Classical Music And Culture Amongst
> Youth): SPIC MACAY is a non-political nationwide voluntary movement that
> organizes programmes of classical music and dance, folk arts, crafts, yoga,
> classic cinema screenings, heritage walks, etc. inside school and college
> campuses throughout the world to make students more aware about the Indian
> and world heritage.
>
> *SPIC MACAY chapter at IIT Palakkad started on October 23, 2017, with an
> idea of providing a platform for the students to admire and appreciate the
> beauty of Indian culture. For more details, please visit our webpage
> https://spicmacayiitpkd.wixsite.com/mysite
> <https://spicmacayiitpkd.wixsite.com/mysite>*
>
> Poster is also attached for more details about the program.
>
> We believe that this will be a never before experience for all of you, and
> hope for an active participation from all of you.
>
> Regards,
> SPIC MACAY IIT Palakkad

*****************************************************

Greetings everyone,
On Saturday, 27th August 2022, the Wellness Hub of IIT Palakkad conducted a
Marathon for the Students, Staff and Faculty. The event was conducted in
the Ahalia Campus.

The results of the event are :
*Boys*
1st Place - Pavan Kumar
2nd Place - Nitin Arya
3rd Place - Krishan Nair
*Girls*
1st Place - Athira M
2nd Place - Maaya R Srivatsav
3rd Place - D Charishma
Congratulations to all the winners of the Marathon. They will be moving
further in the process of selection for the Inter-IIT competition.

The photographs of the event are in the following Google Drive folder :
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1aRvYWb_dHyUUF2cdEk0gnZuV_6Q5d1fE

I would like to thank our chief guest Mr Biju K V for his presence at the
event.
I would also like to thank Mr K. Madhavan Unni for his help in coordinating
the event with the Ahalia Security Team, the Ahalia-in-charge for giving us
the permission to conduct this event, Mr S. Samuel and Ms Arya Aravind for
their presence and assistance and the Sports Secretary and all the
volunteers and members of the Sports Council for their help in organizing
the event.
Thank you to all the participants for taking part in the event and making
it a success.

Alok Singh
International Kabaddi Player & SAI Gold Medalist Coach
Physical Training Instructor
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad

*****************************************************

Greetings all,
A few changes to the event being conducted tomorrow. It'll be starting at
the Y-junction and ending at the academic block. The marathon will be
starting at 10:00 am but I'd request for everyone interested to be present
at the Y-junction ahead of time(10-15 mins preferably).

Please adhere to the rules mentioned below:
i) Run/walk at your own pace, do not overdo it and injure yourself/tire
yourself out
ii) Proper attire is a must - tshirt, shorts/track pants, and shoes
iii) Stick to the left side of the road and be wary of vehicles passing by
iv) There will be volunteers and Ahalia security personnel present along
the route, approach them in case of any injuries and follow their
instructions carefully
v) Look out for other runners on the track
vi) Water will be available(for emergencies and people in dire need of it)
at different checkpoints but do bring your own water bottles if you think
it's necessary

Students coming from Nila campus, please get coupons for lunch at Ahalia as
there is no bus back until 2:00 pm(after lunchtime).



Alok Singh
International Kabaddi Player & SAI Gold Medalist Coach
physical Training Instructor
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad

*****************************************************

Greetings all,
On the occasion of National Sports Day on 29th August 2022, the Wellness
Hub will be conducting a Marathon and Selection Trial for the students,
faculty and staff of IIT Palakkad. This event will be conducted on *Saturday,
27th August 2022*. This event will be conducted in the Ahalia Campus,
starting and ending at Hostel-3, at 9:40 am.
Students currently at the Nila campus can take the 8:30 am Tempo or 9:00 am
Bus on Saturday to Ahalia and return on the 2:00 pm bus to Nila. (Kindly
note that students coming from Nila should bring coupons for the Mess if
they plan to have lunch in Ahalia)

Those interested in participating in the Marathon should fill out this
Google Form :
https://forms.gle/2cHhzmWbusgYKaV88

We look forward to your participation in this event.

Alok Singh
International Kabaddi Player & SAI Gold Medalist Coach
Physical Training Instructor
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad

*****************************************************

Dear All,

Mr. Mithulraj M  who is working with Dr. Madhu Karthik will be presenting
his research proposal on 23rd August 2022 at 03:30 PM.

Title: Fatigue response of shear critical reinforced concrete bent cap with
corroded reinforcement

Date & Time: 23rd August 2022 at 03:30 PM

Venue: Room Number 305, Samgatha, Nila Campus

Abstract

Cantilever bent caps are commonly used supporting structural elements in
elevated bridges, that are subjected to repeated loading and are exposed to
environmental conditions. During application of loads from the girder on
the overhang portion of the cantilever bent cap, tension cracks typically
form at the top face of the joint region. These cracks create a pathway for
moisture ingress into the structure, and leads to reinforcement corrosion
in the beam-column joint. Being shear critical members, corrosion of
reinforcement in the joint region could severely affect the strength and
durability performance of these structural components. In addition, the
bent caps are also subject to repeated vehicular loading, and fatigue could
be an important consideration to assess the performance of the structure.
An experimental and analytical investigation is proposed in this study, to
understand the effects of reinforcement corrosion on the strength and
durability of reinforced bridge bent caps subject to fatigue loading.
Scaled cantilever bent cap with and without reinforcement corrosion in the
joint region, will be experimentally evaluated for its fatigue performance,
load carrying capacity, ductility and mode of failure. Reinforcement
corrosion will also be incorporated into the Compatibility Strut-and-Tie
Method (C-STM), to study the progression of nonlinear events, and the
failure mechanism. The validated model will also be used to conduct a
parametric study, to understand the effects of various parameters on the
performance of bridge bent caps with reinforcement corrosion in the joint
region. Based on the experimental and analytical results, equations will be
proposed for estimating the residual shear strength of cantilever bent cap
with reinforcement corrosion. This in turn, can be used for evaluating the
residual shear capacity of existing bridge bent caps with reinforcement
corrosion in the joint region.

All are cordially invited.

--

Thank you

Regards,

Office of the Dean (Academics)

IIT Palakkad

*****************************************************

*Reading Comprehension*

Read the following passage and attempt the questions that follow:

 India@75: Behaving like an Elder? by   Ashish Kothari

As India celebrates 75 years of Independence, does it embody the wisdom
such an age should bring? At least from one point of view, the answer is a
resounding NO—the sustainability of its natural environment, on which all
our lives depend.

It is astounding how we still ‘externalize’ nature in our single-minded
pursuit of economic growth. After decades of high growth, 480 million
people in northern India face the most extreme levels of air pollution in
the world. According to the NITI Aayog, “600 million people in India face
high to extreme water stress … with nearly 70% of water being
contaminated.” The Indian Space Research Organisation says that 30% of our
land is at various stages of degradation, some getting desertified. In the
markets of most cities, food has levels of pesticides well above human
safety levels. The climate crisis is threatening the livelihoods and lives
of several hundred million—mostly the poorest. Yet, the government is busy
dismantling environmental and social security policies to favor corporate
access to land and natural resources. Sixty million people have already
been displaced by ‘development’ projects; how many more?

It does not have to be like this. Thousands of initiatives are
demonstrating how basic needs including food, water, energy, housing can be
met, dignified livelihoods generated, and learning and health access
enhanced, while working with and within the natural environment, respecting
not only human rights but also the rights of fellow species to thrive (
www.vikalpsangam.org). But this requires spaces for everyone’s voice in
decision-making (a radical democracy), community control over the commons,
struggles against various inequalities including gender and caste,
sustaining diverse cultures and knowledges, and replacing GDP with
meaningful indicators of well-being … a genuine swaraj. In the last quarter
of its century of Independence, this is India’s biggest challenge. If we
fail, we will be mourning, not celebrating, in 2047.

1) As used here, 'externalize' means
a) send outside
b) an economic concept, of failing to or choosing not to incorporate as
part of a pricing structure, costs (especially social and environmental)
resulting from a product's manufacture and use.
c) give external existence or form to.

2) 'The climate crisis is threatening the livelihoods and lives of several
hundred million'. Which of the following is NOT an example of that?
a) 600 million people in India face high to extreme water stress
b)  30% of our land is at various stages of degradation, some getting
desertified
c) food has levels of pesticides well above human safety levels

3) Why does the author ask for 'replacing GDP with meaningful indicators of
well-being'?
a) GDP (gross domestic product) measures the money-value of all the goods
and services produced in a country
b) GDP fails to take note of how producing goods and services pollutes
air,water and soil
c) He has some ideas about what meaningful indicators could be

4) From the passage, it is possible to conclude that India's air and water
pollution problems show
a) we have too many people, especially poor ones
b) GDP is growing at the cost of environment
c) access to clean air and adequate water of acceptable quality for all
Indians is not being prioritised

5) 'working with and within the natural environment' can be described as
a) radical democracy
b) democracy
c) sustainability

Answers
1) b
2) c
3) b
4) c
5) c

regards, Sandhya

-- 
English Language Support & Services
IIT Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/elss


*****************************************************

*Comparative Adjective Quiz*

1. Which is the comparative form? "I'm strong, but my brother is _______ ."

 strongest
 stronger
 as strong

2. Comparative adjectives are used when comparing _______ things, people or
groups.

 two
 two or more
 three or more

3. Many adjectives are changed into the comparative form by adding

 -er
 -est
 -ies

4. Which is the correct comparative form? "My phone's expensive, but
Jeena's is _______ ."

 expensiver
 most expensive
 more expensive

5. A long adjective of 3 or more syllables is changed into a comparative
adjective by

 adding -er to it
 adding -est to it
 putting "more" before it

6. Which is correct? "Do you think Manya is _______ than Selena?"

 friendlier
 more friendly
 more friendlier

7. Which is not a comparative form of the adjective "clever"?

 cleverer
 cleverrer
 more clever

8. Which is correct? "Learning English is _______ learning Japanese."

 easier
 more easy
 easier than

9. Which is correct? "This year the weather is ______ than last year."

 badder
 worse
 worser

10. Which is comparative? "Whose English is _______? Mine or his?"

 good
 better
 best


*Answers*

1. stronger
2. two (most commonly) OR two or more (eg: A cheetah can run  faster than a
tiger or a leopard)
3. -er
4. more expensive
5. putting more before it (eg: 'interesting' becomes 'more interesting')
6. friendlier
7. cleverrer (both cleverer and more clever are correct)
8. easier than
9. worse
10. better

regards, Sandhya

-- 
English Language Support & Services
IIT Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/elss

Dear All
 To fly or launch or space travel happen to be your vision or dream read on
Thank you

correction:
3) What Darwin *studied *(past tense) about the finches was

On Mon, 22 Aug 2022 at 13:57, Sandhya Chandrasekharan <
engconsultant@iitpkd.ac.in> wrote:

> *Listen and Learn!*
>
> Today's 6-minute audio clip is here
> <https://www.bbc.co.uk/learningenglish/oromo/features/6-minute-english_2022/ep-220714>
>
> Listen to it carefully and answer the following questions:
>
> 1) The setting for Charles Darwin's famous observation experiments are the
> Galapagos. These are
> a) a family of lizards
> b) a string of island in the Pacific Ocean
> c) islands near Australia
>
> 2) They had a 'drab colour and not a very interesting song' describes
> a) Galapagos parrots
> b) birds called finches
> c) the ship Darwin used
>
> 3) What Darwin studies about the finches was
> a) the food they ate
> b) their body size
> c) the shape of their beaks
>
> 4) Why does the clip mention "man-made climate change"?
> a) only men are causing it, no women or trans people
> b) greenhouse gas emissions are a post industrial revolution phenomena and
> the single largest cause of global warming
> c) climate can change because of natural phenomena like volcanic eruptions
> and melting glaciers as well
>
> 5) The evolutionary example in lizards that the clip mentions is
> a) long tails that flap in the wind in a hurricane
> b) stronger front legs and smaller back legs
> c) smaller bodies
>
> Answers
> 1) b
> 2) b
> 3) c
> 4) b
> 5) b
>
> regards, Sandhya

*****************************************************

*Listen and Learn!*

Today's 6-minute audio clip is here
<https://www.bbc.co.uk/learningenglish/oromo/features/6-minute-english_2022/ep-220714>

Listen to it carefully and answer the following questions:

1) The setting for Charles Darwin's famous observation experiments are the
Galapagos. These are
a) a family of lizards
b) a string of island in the Pacific Ocean
c) islands near Australia

2) They had a 'drab colour and not a very interesting song' describes
a) Galapagos parrots
b) birds called finches
c) the ship Darwin used

3) What Darwin studies about the finches was
a) the food they ate
b) their body size
c) the shape of their beaks

4) Why does the clip mention "man-made climate change"?
a) only men are causing it, no women or trans people
b) greenhouse gas emissions are a post industrial revolution phenomena and
the single largest cause of global warming
c) climate can change because of natural phenomena like volcanic eruptions
and melting glaciers as well

5) The evolutionary example in lizards that the clip mentions is
a) long tails that flap in the wind in a hurricane
b) stronger front legs and smaller back legs
c) smaller bodies

Answers
1) b
2) b
3) c
4) b
5) b

regards, Sandhya
-- 
English Language Support & Services
IIT Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/elss

DAY 289
18/08/2022

*MUSCLE ENERGIZATION*

 Energize every muscle group in your body by gently activating it. Stand up
for this practice and make sure to take full, deep inhales and complete
exhales throughout the process.
  ♦ Begin by opening and stretching the fingers on both hands and clenching
both fists.
♦ Rotate your wrists, neck, hips, and ankles in both directions.
  ♦ Flex and stretch the muscles in your arms, chest, back, core, and legs.
♦ Roll your shoulders, and bring your awareness into the body, stretching,
flexing, and relaxing every muscle you can think of

FORWARD TOGETHER

*****************************************************

 Dear All,
Please see below and email on the Sitare University which will provide
absolutely free Undergraduate Education in Computer Science to deserving
underprivileged students. A two-page (not three as mentioned below) flier
on the university is attached to this email. Request you to kaindly share
with your contacts, so that deserving students get an opportunity.

Thanks, Sovan

On Mon, Aug 1, 2022 at 12:23 AM Brijesh Eshpuniyani <brijeshe@sitare.org>
>> wrote:
>>
>>> Hi Sovan,
>>>
>>> I hope this email finds you in good health and spirits.
>>>
>>> Before I come to why I'm writing this email, here's sharing an
>>> interesting move I recently made:
>>>
>>> It's very likely that you've heard of Dr. Amit Singhal (Google Search
>>> Algorithm). But just in case the name doesn't ring a bell: Amit
>>> received his B.Tech. from University of Roorkee in 1989 and PhD from
>>> Cornell University in 1996. For his PhD, he worked with Prof. Gerard
>>> Salton, the founding father of the field of Information Retrieval (Search).
>>> He then worked with AT&T Labs for about four years and Google for about
>>> fifteen where he rose to the position of Senior Vice President.
>>>
>>> What makes the above doubly impressive is that just a couple of
>>> generations ago the Singhal family was tremendously poor (roadside puncture
>>> repair shop). A belief in education as the sustainable way up led to his
>>> grandfather doing a two year MA and becoming an English teacher, his father
>>> becoming an Engineer, and now Amit achieving a much higher level of success.
>>>
>>> He now wants to give back to society. And he wants to do it in the way
>>> that worked for him: Education.
>>>
>>> In 2016 he left Google and launched Sitare Foundation (
>>> https://sitare.org/) with an intent to provide free world class
>>> education to deserving underprivileged students in India. Having
>>> established the framework for school education (6-12), Dr. Singhal decided
>>> to move on to Undergraduate Education and formally launched Sitare
>>> University on 15/07/2022. The attached three page flier introduces the
>>> university. It will provide absolutely free Undergraduate Education in
>>> Computer Science to deserving underprivileged students. The start will be
>>> humble (50 - 100 students this year) but will scale up to 1000 students per
>>> year steadily. As of now Amit seeks to build the university along the lines
>>> of a Harvey Mudd, i.e. a purely undergraduate school but excellent in the
>>> education and training it will impart.
>>>
>>> Amit and me got introduced about a month and a half ago and he asked me
>>> if I would come in as an Applied Math faculty. I was quite happy to accept.
>>> It suits my present academic temperament and the cause is undeniably good.
>>>
>>> Now to why I'm writing to you:
>>>
>>> Would you be willing to help in generating awareness of this initiative
>>> in the IITPKD community? I make this request for two reasons:
>>>
>>> 1. We want this information to quickly reach as many present engineering
>>> aspirants as possible who are academically strong, interested, but come
>>> from families that may not have the means to educate them. We've had some
>>> press coverage but nothing replaces word of mouth! The student community at
>>> IITPKD itself will send across this information to many parts of the
>>> country. I will also write to folks at other IITs with a similar request.
>>>
>>> 2. There will inevitably be folks in the faculty and staff community who
>>> might be interested in knowing more about us. They are welcome to write to
>>> me (or Amit directly at amit@sitare.org). We'll only be too happy to
>>> engage, discuss and answer queries as best as we can.
>>>
>>> If you have any questions for us, please do write to us. You can cc
>>> amit@sitare.org so that he can engage directly as well.
>>>
>>> Rest is fine at my end. Covid was of course challenging, but things are
>>> getting better and I'm looking forward to being back in the classroom.
>>>
>>> I'll end this email here. Will certainly try to meet you when I visit
>>> IITPKD.
>>>
>>> Best regards
>>>
>>> Brijesh
>>>
>>> --
>>> Dr. Brijesh Eshpuniyani
>>> Professor (Applied Mathematics)
>>> Sitare University (https://sitare.org/)
>>> Presently hosted by: Rajiv Gandhi Proudyogiki Vishwavidyalaya
>>> (rgpv.ac.in) <https://www.rgpv.ac.in/>
>>> Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh 462033
>>> India
>>>

Dear Madam
We have made a standard system, that whenever any students or students wish
to take food from the mess other than in which they are registered, they
have to take a token for that particular meal or snack from the Mess
manager of the mess in which they are registered. They then will have to
submit the token at the other mess and take the food

On Thu, Aug 18, 2022 at 12:47 PM Jasine Babu <jasine@iitpkd.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear Academic Affairs Secretary, Hostel Secretary,
>
>    Please talk to Samuel sir and the mess supervisor and arrange *lunch
> and evening snacks in Nila Mess on Fridays* for students of software
> engineering course and the course TA Ms. Nirnaeshitha. There will be* 30
> students and 1 TA* in this course and they need to go by the 1pm shuttle
> from Ahalia and return by the 5:30pm bus from Nila.
>
> Thanks
> --
> Jasine Babu
> Assistant Professor
> Dept of Computer Science and Engineering
> Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad

Jasine Babu

Greetings everyone,
As specified earlier, the Chess Selection Tournament (Phase 2 & 3) will
start today. The fixtures of the tournament are as follows:

Saturday (20/08/22):
Round 1: 6:00 - 6:45 pm
Round 2: 6:45 - 7:30 pm

Sunday (21/08/22):
Round 3: 5:00 - 5:45 pm
Round 4: 5:45 - 6:30 pm
Round 5: 6:30 - 7:15 pm

Also, it is a request to all the participants to join the WhatsApp group
for easier communication.
Link - https://chat.whatsapp.com/DgHYPD1011O8twknYnKpha

Alok Singh
International Kabaddi Player & SAI Gold Medalist Coach
Physical Training Instructor
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad

Block, Ahalia Campus.*

All are cordially invited.

Dear students,

Those who have registered for the soft skill webinar , please find the
attached schedule for the second soft skill training session.

The session will start from 9:30 am tomorrow , and each group is provided
with a half an hour time slot.check your respective group and slots in the
given pdf document.

The meeting credentials will be shared in the WhatsApp group.

Thanks and regards,
Shruti Gupta
M.Tech Branch CDC coordinator

*****************************************************

Dear students,

Warm Greetings!

Career development cell IIT Palakkad is planning to conduct a webinar
session on July 17th, 2022 Sunday by Alameen Khanakashi who is currently
working as a managing director and community manager at Willings, Inc
(India).

The webinar will be mainly focused on soft skills training, it will be
conducted in two sessions,  the morning session will be common for all, and
in the afternoon there will be a group session where the speaker will
directly interact with a group of 5 students where the students can take
the feedback from the speaker about their communication skills,
interpersonal skills, etc.

The placement season will be starting from August onwards, this will be a
great learning opportunity for everyone to strengthen their soft skills.
It's an additional training program from the CDC and no registration fees
are involved for this session.

Once the student has registered for the training program, it's mandatory to
attend the webinar, no excuses will be entertained after that.

Those who are interested can register with the following link.

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeog8pwmGzt2E81dt5BkkgE-LWomqYqRlw3f7Y29jI2VcFfdQ/viewform?usp=sf_link

*The deadline for the registration is 16th July - 2:00 pm.*

Please reach out to me, if there are any queries or concerns regarding the
session.

Thanks and Regards,
Shruti Gupta
M.Tech Branch Coordinator
Career Development Centre


*****************************************************

DAY 287
16/08/2022

*RESPONSIBILITY FOR ALL HUMANITY *

Each of us must work for his own improvement, and at the same time share a
general responsibility for all humanity, our particular duty being to aid
those to whom we think we can be most useful. —Marie Curie

*****************************************************

Warm Greetings,

It gives me immense pleasure in announcing the winners of the India Quiz.
It was an exciting affair with a lot of emotions involved. We witnessed
participants shouting with joy on answering correctly and expressing sighs
of despair upon answering incorrectly. There were moments of doubt and
nervousness while answering a question and there were also moments of sheer
confidence upon answering with absolute certainty. The final standings
are as follows:

   1. *Saket Sharan and Bikash Kumar Gupta*
   2. *Akash Brijesh and Joel Jeffrey*
   3. *Julin S and Amithabh A*
   4. *Vaibhav B Nagrale and Vinay Ingle*

Congratulations to all the winners. I would also like to wholeheartedly
thank all the participants for attending the quiz.
Please note that due to the format of the quiz, only the finalists will be
awarded leaderboard points in accordance with the guidelines, all other
participants will be awarded participation points.

I would also like to thank my fellow core team members, Paul Tony and Ravi
Chaudhary and my fellow batchmate, Shashwat Singh for assisting me in
organising this event successfully.

Hoping to see good participation in the future quizzes as well.

Regards
Kartik Gopa Kumar
Secretary, Qriosity

Namaskar,

Hope you are doing well.I am Sant Ranjan from KPIT Technologies and member
of KPIT Sparkle team. KPIT Technologies Ltd. is an independent software
integration partner to global automotive leaders. We are present in 13
countries with 7000+ employees.

We conduct our flagship event past 8 years known as *KPIT Sparkle* program
which is a platform which provides opportunity to our studentsâ€™
innovators from grassroot levels across India to showcase their innovations
for the best incubation and business opportunities and handsome prize
money.

As we are entering the auspicious period of Azadi Ka Amrut Mahotsav after
completion of 75 years of our Independence and KPIT Sparkle is entering
into its 9th year, we want to do our best for the nation towards
Atmanirbhar Bharat through studentsâ€™ innovation and for that we need your
active support in the form of motivating and enabling your students to
participate in KPIT Sparkle 2023.

It is our honor to request you to motivate your students to participate in
this pan India program which can make them successful entrepreneurs in the
country and World. Participation is totally free in this program and
students get best complimentary mentorship support for their project from
our side.

You will be very happy to know that KPIT Sparkle is India's one of the
largest students' innovation platforms and we have participation from
Arunachal to Gujarat and Kashmir till Tamil Nadu and 4 successful
entrepreneurs have successfully come out of it. Many others are under
incubation.

We strongly believe the power of collaboration, we got support from DST,
AIM, AICTE, CIIE.CO IIMA, NID Ahmedabad, IIIT Hyderabad, Anna University
and MNRE as knowledge partners in earlier KPIT Sparkle programs. Your
support will help this program and Indian innovative students a lot.

The KPIT Sparkle Innovation Movement is back with its 9th edition. As
always, we welcome your students to participate in the 9th edition. We
wanted to highlight the output of the initiative and the societal impact
which we could achieve with your support, our student entrepreneurs do
deserve a special mention kindly find the link
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tqOMIZPFaZw> to this video.

For 8 years, we have been inculcating the culture of innovation amongst the
youth. Returning with the same zeal, the 9th Edition is now officially
live.

Be it, Under-graduates, Master or PhD students, the KPIT Sparkle contest
presents exclusive opportunities for innovators to solve real-world
challenges by proposing path-breaking solutions based on valid problem
statements.

Beginning in 2015, the revolution that is KPIT Sparkle has only risen. And
our numbers prove it!

*****************************************************

Dear students,

In continuation with broadcast message of the Registrar regarding the
independence day event, the students from Ahalia should finish their
breakfast in Ahalia mess before boarding the buses at 8:00 AM. Two buses
will be waiting for you in front of the mess complex.

After the completion of all the programs, by 12:30 PM, these two buses will
leave from Nila to drop you back to Ahalia. After that no more
transportation.

*No one should wander in the permanent campus*. Your presence is restricted
to*  A1 Block/ClassRoom Complex. After the institute event and
coffee/snacks, everyone should board the bus to reach Nila campus for the
fun sports, quiz and independence day face painting.*

Thank you,
Jagadeesh




--
Prof. Dr. Jagadeesh Bayry,
Dean (Student Affairs),
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
Sikharam block, Nila Campus.


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Registrar IIT Palakkad <registrar@iitpkd.ac.in>
Date: Sun, Aug 14, 2022 at 6:27 PM
Subject: [Broadcast] Reg: Invitation to Independence Day
Celebrations@Permanent Campus
To: <broadcast@iitpkd.ac.in>


Dear All,

           It is my pleasure to invite you to the celebrations at IIT
Palakkad on account of the 76th Independence Day, commemorating 75 years of
independence. The flag hoisting ceremony will be at *9 am at the Permanent
Campus (A1 Block/ClassRoom Complex), *followed by performances from the
students. I request your presence for the function, which also marks the
first Independence Day celebrations on the Permanent Campus, and to make it
a memorable one to cherish for years to come. Kindly note the following
points with regard to the function.

1. *No private/personal vehicles shall be allowed* into the Permanent
Campus beyond the parking lot area.

2. Travel arrangements are made for pick-up/drop of faculty, staff and
students. *There are two tempos from town starting at 8 am in the
designated routes, as broadcast earlier, and there will be two buses from
Ahalia to Nila campus, which shall start at 8 am as well*. All four
vehicles will be arriving at Nila Campus at 8:30 am. Faculty/Staff and
students at Nila Campus may board these vehicles at the Nila
Campus/Permanent Campus parking lot and then proceed to the venue of the
celebrations. No other mode of transport to reach and exit the venue will
be permitted.

3. Following the event at the Permanent Campus, there shall be fun games
organised by Students' Section (details have been sent separately) that
shall be held in the Nila Campus from 10:30 am. Transport back to town and
Ahalia will be after the games are over, around 12:30 pm.

Kindly note that as there are construction activities at the permanent
campus, straying away and wandering from the venue of the event is strongly
discouraged. Looking forward to seeing you all tomorrow as we as a nation
celebrate the Diamond Jubilee of its Independence.

=================
Regards,

Ganesh Natarajan,
Registrar I/C
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
04923 - 226 520
Ahalia Integrated Campus, Kozhippara
Palakkad - 678 557, Kerala.
registrar@iitpkd.ac.in
www.iitpkd.ac.in


*****************************************************

Dear All,

           It is my pleasure to invite you to the celebrations at IIT
Palakkad on account of the 76th Independence Day, commemorating 75 years of
independence. The flag hoisting ceremony will be at *9 am at the Permanent
Campus (A1 Block/ClassRoom Complex), *followed by performances from the
students. I request your presence for the function, which also marks the
first Independence Day celebrations on the Permanent Campus, and to make it
a memorable one to cherish for years to come. Kindly note the following
points with regard to the function.

1. *No private/personal vehicles shall be allowed* into the Permanent
Campus beyond the parking lot area.

2. Travel arrangements are made for pick-up/drop of faculty, staff and
students. *There are two tempos from town starting at 8 am in the
designated routes, as broadcast earlier, and there will be two buses from
Ahalia to Nila campus, which shall start at 8 am as well*. All four
vehicles will be arriving at Nila Campus at 8:30 am. Faculty/Staff and
students at Nila Campus may board these vehicles at the Nila
Campus/Permanent Campus parking lot and then proceed to the venue of the
celebrations. No other mode of transport to reach and exit the venue will
be permitted.

3. Following the event at the Permanent Campus, there shall be fun games
organised by Students' Section (details have been sent separately) that
shall be held in the Nila Campus from 10:30 am. Transport back to town and
Ahalia will be after the games are over, around 12:30 pm.

Kindly note that as there are construction activities at the permanent
campus, straying away and wandering from the venue of the event is strongly
discouraged. Looking forward to seeing you all tomorrow as we as a nation
celebrate the Diamond Jubilee of its Independence.

=================
Regards,

Ganesh Natarajan,

*****************************************************

Dear All,

The users of Amenity centre under the tensile roof at Nila are* requested
to handover the plates and the tea/coffee cups to the staff.* Due to the
wind gust, we are getting reports on breaking of glass utensils. Also,
broken glass utensils may cause severe injury to the people.

All the users and *in particular students, should not leave any used
plastic bottles or wrappers or food packages either in the Amenity centre
or in the surroundings. The dust bins are placed for the disposal. *I am
sure, we have a basic civic sense.

Thank you,
Jagadeesh

--
Prof. Dr. Jagadeesh Bayry,
Dean (Student Affairs),
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
Sikharam block, Nila Campus.

*****************************************************

Greetings everyone,
As part of Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav some fun events were conducted after the
flag hoisting in Nila campus by the Sports council under Alok Sir. I want
to thank all the sports council members for helping organize the events. I
want to thank EWD for their help in providing necessary equipment for
organising the events. Last but not the least I want to thank all the
students, faculty and staff who participated in the events and also the
people who were there to witness the events.
My sincere thanks to Dr. Jagadeesh Bayry (Dean students) for his support
and his presence throughout the event.

Link for the media
https://photos.app.goo.gl/EVhE23cZLM7hXkJJ6

                      Thank you All!

*****************************************************

Dear All,

The library has created a new website(lib.iitpkd.ac.in) and the link to the
same has been updated on our institute website. I hope that our new website
will give you all the information about the library facilities. The library
Web OPAC portal(library.iitpkd.ac.in), which was used for the library site
will remain the same and can be used for search, renewal and reservation of
books. The Web OPAC link is moved to the new website (to the home page-main
block).

I sincerely thank Mr. Sumesh, Biju Sir (for technical assistance), Ms.
Rukshana, Mr. Sreejith(for content) and Sovan Sir(for guidance).

Thank you

Regards,
Shailesh

*****************************************************

Dear all,
As Govt.Of India has issued a directions that Independence Day Celebrations
should start after 9 AM , we will be starting our Independence Day
Celebrations after 9AM this year as the whole country is celebrating the 75
th Independence Day as "Azadi ka Amruth Mahotsav "

So there is a change in the BUS / Tempo services.

We will start the Bus and Tempo at 8 AM
from Ahalia & Palakkad. All the trip and route remain the same.

The program is expected to be over around 12 .PM and the buses and Tempos
will start from Permanent Campus with Students , Faculty and staff
for dropping them in their respective points.

All are requested to participate and make the function remarkable

With regards,

K.M UNNI
Advisor


*****************************************************

Dear All,
   You will receive the voting forms at 9 pm only for those batches in
which we received the nominations. The electives where no nominations are
received will be chosen randomly. Please vote only for those courses for
which you are registered in the form. We will be collecting the mail IDs
and the same will be validated against the registration log to avoid the
votes for unregistered courses.

The names of the students who have filled for core courses and courses
which are not offered have been discarded directly.

*****************************************************

Dear All,
   Warm Greetings!
   We would like to have the elections for the CRs for elective courses.
Interested candidates may kindly fill the Nomination form
<https://forms.gle/wexBjZm9V4o5ug4d7> *before 9 am tomorrow(20th August)*.
Kindly mention the course(s) for which you would like to contest for.
Students who are planning to drop a course, kindly please don't contest for
that subject. The number of CRs needed is one per course. You may choose to
be CR for more than one elective.

The election will be conducted from 9 pm on 20th August to 5 pm on 21st
August. The google forms of the same will be shared tomorrow.


*--*

*Yagnesh Katragadda*

  Dear All,
     Warm Greetings!
Thank you everyone for the presence, participation and engagement in the
fourth edition of the Industry-Academia Conclave (IAC 4.0) hosted on 13th
August 2022 and for making it successful. The conclave deliberated on
avenues for potential convergence and collaboration. In order to fine-tune
the later editions of our event, we would love to hear your feedback.
Please spend a minute or two of your time to provide your feedback on the
link - IAC 4.0 Feedback form <https://forms.gle/245NfXY8ahYZkU8w6>.

Thank you and have a good weekend ahead!

*****************************************************

*Greetings to All,*
On the occasion of* "Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav" *let’s think of
something colorful and vibrant.

*Let our body speak the language of freedom. *

The *Wellness Hub* of IIT Palakkad will be conducting a *face/body painting
activity* to make the day memorable and fun.
So everyone is welcome to participate in the event. The activity will be
conducted at both the campuses i.e, at the permanent as well as at the Nila
campus after the flag hoisting.

I request *all faculties, staff and students *to actively take part in the
activity, have fun and make this day enjoyable.

[image: WhatsApp Image 2022-08-14 at 2.21.22 PM.jpeg]


With best regards,
Sujata Priyambada Palai
Yoga and Wellness,
IIT Palakkad

*****************************************************

     *Students who have got courses from the previous semester(s) in their
semester enrollment and have unticked them and clicked update(i.e showing
dropped in the registration log) only kindly go through the rest of the
mail and others may kindly ignore.*

Dear All,
        Please fill in your roll number, and course code exactly(eg:
CS4010) and the semester to which that course belongs for each course that
you have unticked and updated since it belongs to previous semesters in the
semester enrollment phase in the below google sheet
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/17tbY773jUc-Hj_vcVsjibyjsuxWjUpUZcjNxXFm2eKE/edit?usp=sharing>
 *by 8 pm today.* Also, please upload a screenshot of your registration log
page as a drive link for cross-verification.

Eg: If the course HS2301 Principles of Economics is supposed to be in S3,
enter as <roll number> HS2301 S3 <Screenshot>. Please follow this naming
convention strictly.

Please be careful in entering the data because the mistakes might cause
huge mistakes in future in terms of grade cards etc... Also, please don't
edit the data of other students.

If you have any queries or doubts, please let me know but don't enter the
wrong data.


*--*
*Regards,*

*Yagnesh Katragadda*
*Secretary, Academic Affairs*
*Students Affairs Council | Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad*

Dear All,

With effect from *15th August*, please note down the timings of badminton
court.


*Morning hours: 6:30 to 8:30 AM *
*Evening hours: 5 to 9 PM*

*30 min slot/person. ONLY one slot/person/day* to avoid the use of multiple
slots by the same individual.

*Non-marking shoes are mandatory *for the use of badminton court. Users
should wear them just before entering the court.
Otherwise entry will not be permitted.

Dear Faculty Members and Department Heads,



Greetings from EXCEED 2.0!



Thank you for encouraging the participations. We are attaching a poster
that showcase our legacy. As a request, please forward them on your college
platforms such as Facebook, emails etc. so your students can be aware of
this competition. Please find the attachment.



Registration link: https://wabtecexceed.hirepro.in/registration



Thank you,



*EXCEED 2.0 Organizing Committee (Wabtecexceed2.0@Wabtec.com
<Wabtecexceed2.0@Wabtec.com>)*









*From:* WABTEC EXCEED 2.0

*Subject:* RE: Launching Wabtec India's EXCEED 2.0 Campus Challenge 2022



Dear Faculty Members and Department Heads,



Greetings from EXCEED 2.0!



Thank you for encouraging the participations. Please keep them coming.



This mail is a gentle reminder on the fast approaching deadline of *16th
August*.  Only 7 days are left before the registrations closes. Please
forward the contest information to your student community by circulating it
over your college platforms and over mails if you haven’t done yet. This
will help students to get exposure to real life industry challenges through
the contest.

*EXCEED 2.0 Organizing Committee (Wabtecexceed2.0@Wabtec.com

*From:* WABTEC EXCEED 2.0
*Sent:* Monday, August 1, 2022 11:03 AM

*Subject:* Launching Wabtec India's EXCEED 2.0 Campus Challenge 2022



[image: Fifth slide]



Dear Students and Faculty,

Wabtec Corporation is happy to launch *Pan-India 2022 Campus Challenge “
EXCEED 2.0 ”* and we invite you to be a part of this journey.



Click <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-EU_GEdxEiI> here to play the
official kickoff video by Dr. Sujatha Narayan (Regional Senior Vice
President, India)



*Contest Website*: https://wabtecexceed.hirepro.in/



This contest has been organized across campuses in India to:

   - Spread awareness of growth opportunities in Railroad Industry; this
   being one of the key sectors impacting the nation’s economy
   - Connect with the young talent that has the capability to shape
   emerging technology landscape of Railroad Industry
   - Provide a platform for expression of ideas in context of the Railroad
   industry to showcase creativity and innovation



The challenge's goal is to give the students a chance to boost their
creativity and align it with business realities. These challenges will
provide them with an exposure to a wide cross-section of on-going and
futuristic developments in the Railroad Industry, covering domains
like Mechanical,
Electrical, Software, Engines and Controls, Robotic welding, Dev-apps, etc.
The spectrum of the topics enables students from different academic
departments and across years to participate in this challenge.



*Sequence of Events: *





*Registration Link*: https://wabtecexceed.hirepro.in/registration



In case of any query please reach out to  Wabtecexceed2.0@Wabtec.com  or
Dr. Manoj Bhalerao (manoj.bhalerao@wabtec.com) or Rishabh Devagupta (
rdevagupta@Wabtec.com).



              Wishing All the Students *great learning* and *good luck* for
the contest!





Thank you,



*EXCEED 2.0 Organizing Committee (Wabtecexceed2.0@Wabtec.com
<Wabtecexceed2.0@Wabtec.com>)*

*From:* Pal, Anup Kumar
*Sent:* Monday, July 4, 2022 4:19 PM
*To:* Pal, Anup Kumar anupkumar.pal@wabtec.com
*Cc:* DEVAGUPTA, RISHABH rdevagupta@Wabtec.com; Bhalerao, Manoj
manoj.bhalerao@wabtec.com; Bindu Raghunandan (HirePro)
bindu.raghunandan@hirepro.in; Jinu Cheeran (HirePro) jinu.cheeran@hirepro.in
*Subject:* Wabtec India's EXCEED 2.0 Campus Challenge 2022





               [image: Wabtec_logo.pdf]

*Dear Students and Faculty Members,*

Greetings! Hope you all are safe and doing well.

We, Wabtec Corporation https://www.wabteccorp.com are a leading global
provider of equipment, systems, digital solutions, and value-added
services. Whether it's freight rail, transit, mining, industrial or marine,
our expertise, technologies, and people - together - are accelerating the
future of transportation.

I am pleased to invite your institute to participate in the 2nd Edition of
the Pan-India 2022 Campus Challenge *“EXCEED 2.0 – Empowering Innovation”*.
EXCEED 2.0 contest is about sharing our century-long, rail-industry focused
innovative heritage with the budding students. Provide them a forum to
contribute creative and innovative solutions for future of the Railroad
Industry and contribute in shaping the emerging technology landscape.

The projects in this contest will contribute towards the rail technology
journey, that comprises designing of autonomous, battery / hydrogen /
sustainable fuel powered locomotive with zero emissions, optimize rail
routes through deep learning to increase network velocity, develop an
intelligent & cyber-secured software platform for multimodal transportation
to integrate railways, roadways and waterways for passenger movement or
just something which will shape the future of rail industry!!

Students will interact with the technologist of the rail industry, *i.e.,*
software architects, system engineers, principal engineers, and other
technical leaders as they navigate through this contest. Winning Teams will
not only receive cash prize but will also pre-qualify for our potential
internship or final placement process for 2022-23, basis our hiring
requirements.

Tentative schedule is as follows:

   - Registration: 1st to 16th August 2022; Abstract Submission: 31st Aug
   2022
   - First Shortlist (basis abstract):15th September 2022
   - Second Shortlist: 31st October 2022
   - Grand Finale (top 10 teams) at Bangalore: 30th November 2022

The contest will be open for students across all engineering disciplines
and academic year for Bachelor’s or Masters courses. This will be in a team
format with 4 members in a team.

*We hope your institute and students would be interested to participate in
this contest. Upon your confirmation; we will share further details of the
contest. Please confirm back to us latest by 8th July 2022. *

Your point of contact from Wabtec during this entire contest will be *Dr.
Manoj Bhalerao *manoj.bhalerao@wabtec.com and *Rishabh Devagupta*
rdevagupta@Wabtec.com . *HirePro is our Partner* for this event and will
liaison with your institute from time-to-time. Kindly advise the key
contact/s from your campus to take the process forward.



With Best Regards,

Anup Kumar Pal



Director, Human Resources

Wabtec India Technology Centre, Bangalore



*P.S. – This mail is being sent as a Bcc on intention. *

original. Neither this information block, the typed name of the sender, nor
anything else in this message is intended to constitute an electronic

message. *

Hello everyone!

We are excited to announce the winners of *Sketch It, *a still-life
sketching contest conducted by Grafica.

The Winners are :

*1st Prize    * -  Srinath Guhaprasad, Ph.D. '22 (Mathematics)

*2nd Prize*   -  Alfin Jaison, BTech '20

*3rd Prize    *-  Vishnu S R, BTech, '20

Congratulations to the winners and thanks to all the participants for their
entries.

The winning entries are attached with this mail.


*Thanks and Regards*

On Tue, Jul 26, 2022 at 9:46 PM Grafica IIT Palakkad <grafica@iitpkd.ac.in>
wrote:

> Greetings all!
>
> Here to pique your interest in the world of art again, Grafica presents *Sketch
> it*, a competition to put your skills to the test!
> Please go through the attached images for more details.
> Submit your entries in the given *Google form
> <https://forms.gle/jmhvMmxAacAkx75w9> *before* 11:59 pm on 7th August
> 2022.*
>
>  Win certificates and earn leaderboard points :
>
> ● Participation - 20 points
> ● First prize - 100 points
> ● Second prize - 80 points
> ● Third prize - 60 points
>
> P.S. Did we mention we’ll be on the lookout for members to join the
> Inter-IIT Team?
>
> *Thanks and Regards*
> *Susan Varghese Padath*
> *Club Secretary*
> *Grafica*
>
>

-- 
*Thanks and Regards*
*Susan Varghese Padath*
*Club Secretary*
*Grafica*
