Dear All,

Based on a project "Analysis of Evacuation Options considering Citizen
Mobility Patterns and Disaster Vulnerability in a Himalayan Region
Transportation Network," in collaboration with IIT Delhi and IIT
Ropar funded by the National Mission on Himalayan Studies, a virtual
workshop titled “Planning for Sustainable and Resilient Transportation
Systems for the Himalayan Region.” is being organized. It will be held
online (MS Teams) on 1st October 2022 (Saturday), from 09.30AM to 12.00
Noon.

The workshop will present the analysis methodology formulated in the
project and will include invited talks by experts who research geohazards,
urban mobility, and transport planning. Also,  a panel of experts will
discuss aspects related to planning for sustainable and resilient
transportation systems for the Himalayan region. Further details of the
workshop can be found in the attached file.

I would like to invite you to participate in the workshop.
MS Teams Link:
https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3ameeting_ZGY4ODIzYjItYWMxMi00M2M1LWFkZmYtYWY3ZjkxMDc3OTY4%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%22624d5c4b-45c5-4122-8cd0-44f0f84e945d%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%2298581885-8c2d-41b8-89e3-a6b456811552%22%7d

Regards,
Bhavath.
-- 
B. K. Bhavathrathan
Assistant Professor
Civil Engineering
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/people/bhavathrathan

*****************************************************

Read the short passage and answer the questions that follow, to test your
comprehension

*Lost Cities*

For thousands of years, humans have built cities. Some of our oldest cities
have managed to maintain pieces of their original characteristics. Other
cities have disappeared completely. Devastation from war, famine, disease,
and natural disasters has caused many cities that were once bustling
centers of civilization to vanish completely.

One of these lost cities belonged to the Anasazi (pronounced
"an-uh-SAH-zee") people. The Anasazi lived in Chaco Canyon in New Mexico.
They built dwellings along the river that ran through the canyon. For close
to 300 years, the Chaco Canyon was the population centre of many desert
cities. Now, nothing is left of this busy city but ruins. Scientists
speculate that drought may have made the Anasazi's food scarce or that some
kind of disease killed off many of the people. However, no one knows
for sure what happened to the people of the Chaco Canyon.

Another lost city sits high atop the Andes Mountains in Peru: the city of
Machu Picchu (pronounced "MA-choo PEE-choo"). It was once among the most
powerful cities in South America, because it was home to the Incan emperor.
In 1527, its citizens packed up their belongings and moved for unknown
reasons. Scientists guess that smallpox, a disease brought by European
explorers, was the cause of Machu Picchu's downfall. Today, tourists from
all over the world climb thousands of steep stone steps to view the ruins
of this formerly majestic city.

Yet another city that is no more was called Pompeii (pronounced "pom-PAY").
This was one of the wealthiest cities of ancient Italy. This beautiful
seaside city was a lively center of commerce and trade. However, Mt.
Vesuvius was lurking in the distance. Eventually, a storm of lava, smoke,
and ash buried the city of Pompeii, putting an end to its prosperity.
Scientists have excavated and studied the ruins of Pompeii, which led to
new discoveries about ancient civilizations of Europe.

Humans have always built cities as hubs for trade, business, and family
life. Cities that have been lost provide information about the past,
helping to inform our future. By
studying lost cities, we can learn how to preserve our current cities.

1) Which of the following statements provides the best summary of the
passage?

A. Cities of the past and present look different from one another.
B. Several great cities have fallen in history.
C. Ancient cities are shrouded in mystery.
D. Humans built cities thousands of years ago.


2) In paragraph 2, the author describes the Anasazi people of the Chaco
Canyon in New Mexico. These people most likely “built dwellings along the
river that ran

through the canyon” because

A. the Anasazi utilized the river to transport goods using boats
B. the riverbank was the safest place to build homes
C. it was difficult to find food without the river
D. water is an important resource


3) According to the passage, the city of Machu Picchu was among the most
powerful cities in South America because

A. it was home to the Incan emperor
B. it was nestled high atop the Andes Mountains
C. powerful European explorers founded the city
D. tourists flocked to climb the steps to the city


4) Which of the following statements best summarizes the similarities and
differences between the three cities the author examines?

A. All of the cities were “lost,” but the ruins of each reflect a unique
civilization and geographic region.
B. Each city was founded by native people long ago, although one of the
cities was eventually “lost” by its founders.
C. All three cities were competitors in the world trade market of their
time, but only one city is still thriving today.
D. These cities were all destroyed by natural disasters, however,
scientists were only able to uncover ruins from one.


5) In the final paragraph, the author suggests that we should

A. get information about how to build thriving cities for a competitive
world
B. figure out how to protect our cities from disease and famine
C. learn from the past to ensure that we do not lose cities in the years to
come
D. learn about certain customs of ancient civilizations that can be used
today


*Answer Key*

1-B, 2-D, 3-A, 4-A, 5-C

regards, Sandhya
-- 
English Language Support & Services
IIT Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/elss

the Study Abroad Course on writing your SOPs and LORs for admissions abroad.

miss your chance if you're planning to go for higher studies or internship
abroad. 

 

Workshop details:

Duration per session: 1.5 hours 
Dates: 23rd Jul - 3rd Aug, 2022 (Weekends & Wednesday)
Fees: INR 1499

 

Note: Recording will be provided for missed sessions

[https://www.wiseupcommunications.com/study-abroad-workshop].

Greetings from TECHIN!!
Be a part of the Startup Ecosystem!
Please share with whomever that would be  interested

Sanitation in India requires tremendous improvement.  The current state of
Sanitation has an impact on health, hygiene, environment, water available,
water contamination. To address this we bring *SAMASTHA 3.0*,the third
Workshop & Pitch of Global Sanitation Center of Excellence (GSCOE)  at *TECHIN
of IIT Palakkad*. *SAMASTHA 3.0*  will be an online event spread over from
14th Oct 2022 to 09th Nov 2022.

<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1r7FkkV06wXst5WuDxZvvwYVENnG3Hb0g/view?usp=sharing>
[image: Samatha 3.0 png.png]
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1r7FkkV06wXst5WuDxZvvwYVENnG3Hb0g/view?usp=sharing>

<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1r7FkkV06wXst5WuDxZvvwYVENnG3Hb0g/view?usp=sharing>
The problem statements will be based on
*Theme:*
•Toilet maintenance, cleaning and sanitization
•Toilet in-situ treatment of sewage
•Pathogen free and energy efficient sanitation
•Improved STP and septage treatment
•Sewer block removal and in-situ sewage treatment
•Circular economy from Toilet and sewage* -* details are in the guidelines
document - *guidelines
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/193KHgzoWqgmAQjOxw1BrHqK9dRKeV-01/view?usp=sharing>*
.

This  is not only a standalone event and participants have to think of
actually going on to make a product and deliver it to market, post the
event in the incubation phase. *APPLICATION FORM
<https://forms.gle/wrsGVP89akwoC9zr9>. *
*LAST DATE of application is 14th Oct 2022*

[image: 360_F_313598658_3TUnxxAvA2v4oDdcAKAYVh15782FcrtW.jpg]
The event being online, the hardware challenges would require the design,
the drawings and simulations to be demonstrated. The selected teams after
this event will be incubated by us and will get the opportunity to build
their prototype, field test, mentored, assess the business viability and
eventually deploy the products with *innovation grant upto ₹10L*. This has
to be achieved in a short time span such that we can make a difference to
humanity by creating a clean and safe environment.

Workshop will consist of Business aspects (including customer discovery,
value proposition and goto market strategy) and Technical aspects
(including standards in sanitation and treatment)
Access to rapid prototyping facility and a wet lab for analysis and
testing, live field test locations, standards testing, connect to
government entities, NGOs, Industry and local bodies for the different
stages of product development and deployment, showcase pavilion for the
product, training for the maintenance and service personnel will be part
and parcel of the incubation journey at GSCOE.

*SAMASTHA 3.0 BROCHURE*
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1r7FkkV06wXst5WuDxZvvwYVENnG3Hb0g/view?usp=sharing>
-
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1r7FkkV06wXst5WuDxZvvwYVENnG3Hb0g/view?usp=sharing

*****************************************************

<https://us02web.zoom.us/j/85793947205>
<https://us02web.zoom.us/j/85793947205>

How do we describe ourselves when it comes to our goals and qualities?
Ambitious, creative, etc, right?

But what about our bodies, romantic relationships, sexual desires, and
preferences?

Experts say that sexuality is a crucial part of who we are and it's
important to ask the right questions so we remain responsible and build
meaningful bonds.

However, it isn’t easy and we know it. A study showed more than* 75%* of
young adults wish to discuss such issues openly but are often frowned upon.

That’s why we bring you a safe space wherein you can understand sexuality,
its impacts, learn how to express yourself, and be an ally to others’
choices by means of interactive activities and quizzes!

*"Understanding Sexuality: A Choice?"*
A LIVE Webinar by
Ms. Jyotsna Sodhi, Psychologist

*When:* 26th May 2022, Thursday | 7:00 PM
*Where: *Zoom Video Conference <https://us02web.zoom.us/j/85793947205>

Share your questions below and get them addressed LIVE by our Expert.

CLICK HERE TO JOIN NOW <https://us02web.zoom.us/j/85793947205>
In case of any queries or concerns, please write to us at campus@yourdost
.com


*Standing with you,Team YourDOST*


Jyothiradithya

Students' General Secretary

Student Affairs Council | Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad

Dear Students,

Greetings from the Career Development Centre.

Hope you are doing good and this email finds you well.

Please find the tentative CDC schedule for the academic year 2022-2023. We
will share the company details that visited our campus for the last 4
years, Internship policies, Placement policies, and CDC reports shortly.
Meanwhile, please check with your seniors for the company details and the
interview process. This is the tentative schedule and any changes will be
notified. The schedule given below is the same for both Placement and
Summer Internships.

Schedule 2022 Details
June 09 Placement & Training Registration - Deadline (for 2019 Batch)
July 01 Existing students' accounts will be unverified for editing/update,
New student users will receive the registration link from CDC based on the
registration.
July 02 For 2021 & 2020 Batch - A detailed explanation/briefing session
will be given on how to add details and create a CV to apply for
internships.
23 July to 31 July Submission of data in the CDC Portal for TPO verification
30 July to 07 August  Submission of required documents to the
department CDC coordinators
for verification
 August 08 Publishing the Job / Internship profiles in the CDC Portal
August 13 to 15 Placement Training (Tentative)
August 20 to August 31 Slots for PPT and Online Test
Sep 01 Day 01 slots for Final Interviews
Sep 02 Day 02 slots for Final Interviews
Sep 03 Day 03 slots for Final Interviews

Regards,

*Santhosh Kumar R*
*Training and Placement Officer*
*Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad *

*Transit Campus,*

*Near Gramalakshmi Mudralayam,*

*Pudussery West, Palakkad - 678 623,*

*Kerala*

FYI

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: I-STEM Notifications <notification-portal@istem.gov.in>
Date: Fri, Sep 9, 2022 at 12:53 PM
Subject: Talk to Experts on Lattice Boltzmann Method for High-Fidelity
Simulations on 15th Sep @3:30pm
To: <d.jagadeesan@iitpkd.ac.in>
Cc: <istem.india@gmail.com>


Dear all,

Greetings from I-STEM,

You are cordially invited to "Talk to Experts" on *15th September 2022
(Thursday), at 3.30 PM (IST)*

Speaker: Dr.Vinay Kariwala, Head of Business Development, SankhyaSutra Labs
Bangalore.

*Topic: Lattice Boltzmann Method for High-Fidelity Simulations*

*Abstract:* Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) has played an important role
in the design of products and processes over past several decades. Entropic
Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) is an emerging technique for high-fidelity
aerodynamics and multi-physics simulation. LBM achieves high levels of
accuracy and reliability, and scales linearly with the available
computational power. In this talk, we will provide an overview of
innovations embedded in SankhyaSutra’s LBM technology. We will also
demonstrate the potential of LBM using multiple examples from various
industries including Aerospace & Defense, Automobile, Process and
semiconductor manufacturing.

*WebEx Link to join*
https://istem.webex.com/istem/j.php?MTID=mb1c1fb6d4e35dd8975596fbe196f3c65

National Coordinator @ sanjeevs@iisc.ac.in or

Customer care: 9620203281

Regards

Dr. Sweta Mukherjee

*Listen and Learn*

This week's listening module is here
<https://www.bbc.co.uk/learningenglish/oromo/features/6-minute-english_2022/ep-220811>

*Use the vocabulary in the module to fill in the blanks and form meaningful
sentences*, ie:

global village
description of the modern world as a connected community in which people
communicate across great distances using technology such as the internet
and telephone

spasmodic
happening suddenly for a short time and not in a regular way

dodgy
(informal) bad, not able to be trusted

word-of-mouth
information passed by people telling each other, rather than being written
down or sent electronically

gadget
small, modern electronic device or machine which does something useful

(straight) from the horse's mouth
(idiom) directly from the most reliable source, or from someone who has
reliable knowledge of it


1) The smartphone is what most people would consider a handy
........................ given it also has a camera, a voice recorder and
is a portable source of audio-visual entertainment besides allowing for
many other things via apps.

2) The fact is that we are now living in a ..............., and that is no
longer something that is capable of being changed.

3) I don't believe that she did it. I'm going to go to ask her and hear it
...............................

4) The Covid pandemic made work so ........................ for people who
earned a daily wage.

5) Predicting voting trends from economic forecasts is a .............
business.

6) Over time, the audiences became less sparse at the theatre, thanks
mainly to ..............................marketing.

7) Philomina accepted the little ...................... with an in-built
radar from the other officer and inserted it in her own helmet.

8) He made .........................attempts to clean up the house.

9) To truly create the right buzz about a movie, the
required ..................... momentum needs to get going in every city. ·

10) One in five people who live in our .................... still have no
access to education or health care.

11) In the famous Charles Dickens novel 'Oliver Twist', Spikes is a
................. character.

12) I know it's true, because I got it ...................................


*Answers*
1) gadget
2) global village
3) straight from the horse's mouth
4) spasmodic
5) dodgy
6) word-of-mouth
7) gadget
8) spasmodic
9) word-of-mouth
10) global village
11) dodgy
12) straight from the horse's mouth

regards, Sandhya

*Use the words in the list to fill in the blanks appropriately and form
meaningful sentences.*

1. perfectly
2. ideally
3. equipped
4. hardy
5. squish
6. withstand
7. crouch
8. catapult


a) The addition of a new talented female singer seemed to
.................... the band into the spotlight.

b)The Marsi were a ................... mountain people, famed for their
simple habits and indomitable courage.

c) For this recipe, skin 4 or 5 ripe tomatoes then ................... them
through a sieve with the back of a spoon.

d) This fabric can ...................... steam and high temperatures.

e) The new dress she gifted me fits .........................

f) People should, ..................., eat much less fat than the oily food
in the mess permits.

g) They ...................themselves with a pair of sharp axes and set off
for the forest in search of timber.

h) Goats of the northern plateau are small,................... and
long-lived, being bred on extensive ranges in a cooler atmosphere, and
accustomed to long journeys in search of water and pasture.

i) The wooden boat was built to ........................... just about
every weather condition at sea.

j) The older cat seems to be living in fear, and whenever the younger cat
comes into the room, he starts to .....................in fear and growls.

k) In olden times, it was common to ................ the enemy army or
holdings with stones.

l) After we took the television for repairs, it has been working
......................

m) .................. face down, with your knees tucked in, and cover your
head with your hands, if out in the open during a dust storm.

n) When Praveen was younger he would ...................insects under his
footwear, so it's surprising to learn he's an animal rights activist now.

o) ......................, everyone in the world would start out with equal
opportunities to grow and thrive.

p) Our laboratory is well .....................

*Answers*

(a) catapult, (b) hardy, (c) squish, (d) withstand, (e) perfectly,
(f)ideally, (g) equipped, (h)hardy, (i) withstand, (j) crouch, (k)
catapult, (l) perfectly, (m) crouch, (n) squish, (o) ideally, (p) equipped

Title :  Living Glass: Active Matter at High Densities

On Thu, 19 May, 2022, 17:54 Head, Dept. of Physics IIT Palakkad, <
hodph@iitpkd.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear All,
>
> As a part of the Annual Physics Research Symposium, the Department of
> Physics at IIT Palakkad is organizing a Colloquium by Prof Chandan Das
> Gupta on Saturday 21 May 2022. The details of the Colloquium are :
>
> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
> Date and Time: 21 May 2022, 9:30 a.m.
> Venue : Room No 203, Samgatha Building, Nila Campus
>
> Title :  Living Glass: Active Matter at High Densities
>
> Speaker : Prof Chandan Dasgupta
> Indian Institute of Science and International Centre for Theoretical
> Sciences
> Bangalore
>
> Abstract:
>
> Active matter consists of objects that can convert internal or ambient
> sources of energy into systematic motion. Experimentally studied active
> matter includes living systems such as flocks of birds, schools of fish,
> swimming bacteria, migrating cells and molecular motors, as well as
> synthetic non-living examples such as vibrated granular matter,
> self-propelled colloids, and swimming microrobots. These systems have
> received a lot of attention in recent years because they exhibit various
> forms of self-organization and collective behaviour. After a general
> introduction to the nonequilibrium statistical mechanics of active systems,
> I will discuss some of the results of our recent studies of glassy
> behaviour in dense active matter. In several biological systems, such as
> bacterial cytoplasm, cytoskeleton-motor complexes and epithelial sheets of
> cells, self-propulsion or activity is found to fluidize a state that
> exhibits characteristic glassy features in the absence of activity. The
> occurrence of an active glass transition has also been observed in recent
> experiments on dense systems of Janus colloids. To develop a theoretical
> understanding of these non-equilibrium phenomena, we have studied the
> effects of activity in several model glass-forming liquids. Our analytic
> and numerical results show that dense active matter brings together the
> physics of glass, jamming and plasticity in an internally driven classical
> system.
>
> ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
>
> All are cordially invited to attend the colloquium.

*****************************************************

Dear All,

As a part of the Annual Physics Research Symposium, the Department of
Physics at IIT Palakkad is organizing a Colloquium by Prof Chandan Das
Gupta on Saturday 21 May 2022. The details of the Colloquium are :
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Date and Time: 21 May 2022, 9:30 a.m.
Venue : Room No 203, Samgatha Building, Nila Campus

Title :  Living Glass: Active Matter at High Densities

Speaker : Prof Chandan Dasgupta
Indian Institute of Science and International Centre for Theoretical
Sciences
Bangalore

Abstract:

Active matter consists of objects that can convert internal or ambient
sources of energy into systematic motion. Experimentally studied active
matter includes living systems such as flocks of birds, schools of fish,
swimming bacteria, migrating cells and molecular motors, as well as
synthetic non-living examples such as vibrated granular matter,
self-propelled colloids, and swimming microrobots. These systems have
received a lot of attention in recent years because they exhibit various
forms of self-organization and collective behaviour. After a general
introduction to the nonequilibrium statistical mechanics of active systems,
I will discuss some of the results of our recent studies of glassy
behaviour in dense active matter. In several biological systems, such as
bacterial cytoplasm, cytoskeleton-motor complexes and epithelial sheets of
cells, self-propulsion or activity is found to fluidize a state that
exhibits characteristic glassy features in the absence of activity. The
occurrence of an active glass transition has also been observed in recent
experiments on dense systems of Janus colloids. To develop a theoretical
understanding of these non-equilibrium phenomena, we have studied the
effects of activity in several model glass-forming liquids. Our analytic
and numerical results show that dense active matter brings together the
physics of glass, jamming and plasticity in an internally driven classical
system.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

All are cordially invited to attend the colloquium.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Dr Jayakumar Balakrishnan
Assistant Professor (Physics) and
Head (Department of Physics)
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
Nila Campus, Pudussery West,
Kanjikode P O , Palakkad -678623
Kerala , India
<hodph@iitpkd.ac.in>

This webinar will bring together an expert international panel comprising representatives of top Australian universities, overseas education counsellors, test prep experts and alumni of one of the top universities.

> with an idea of providing personal mentorship to them from our batch
> students(as mentors).
>
> We will soon be releasing self-study curriculums containing topics related
> to each community ( GameDev, WebDev, CP, ML etc. ) and resources from where
> to learn that specific topic in an organized manner to all the students.
> Selected mentors will be helping the self-studying students (from the
> curriculums) in cases when they're stuck.
>
> I call for the students who are good in CP or GameDev or WebDev to sign up
> for the mentor role by filling this form
> <https://forms.gle/QY2PdPqurP8wF5UD8>. This can add immense value to our
> juniors in their learning. We will soon be expanding personal mentorship to
> other technical clubs as well.
>
> Common Queries for mentors :
> *Q: *How many mentors are we going to pick from the responses ?
> *Ans: *As of now, there's no limitation on the number of mentors we are
> going to pick from the responses, all the potential candidates are
> welcomed.
>
> *Q: *Selection Procedure ?
> *Ans: *Selection of the CP mentor is purely based on the ranks on Coding
> platforms.
> Selection of the WebDev and GameDev mentor is based on the CV, Tech Stack
> and the projects you've worked on.
>
> *Q: * How many students does each mentor assigned to ?
> *Ans: *A maximum of 7 juniors gets assigned to a mentor. Beyond that is
> up to the mentor.
>
> *Q: *When and how juniors can contact mentors ?
> *Ans: *Yacc Server will be edited to incorporate separate groups
> containing the mentor and his/her assigned students. Sharing whatsapp and
> phone number sharing is upto the mentor. The mentor can schedule the hours
> when the assigned students can contact him/her.
>
> *Q: *Do you have to debug juniors code ?
> *A: *Absolutely,No.
>
> Link to the form : https://forms.gle/QY2PdPqurP8wF5UD8 ( just in case you
> missed the same link above ). Form closes on Sunday 11:59pm.
>
> Looking forward to your participation guys. In case of any more queries,
> please feel free to contact me on whatsapp.
>
> *PS: *** I ensure complete privacy to your information filled in the form
> **
>
> Thanks and Regards,
> Jayanth Kumar,
> Secretary, Technical Affairs.
>


*****************************************************

Hello B'19,

Our juniors are concerned in learning Competitive Programming, Web
Development and Game Development and lack the support of a mentor to guide
them in their learning process. Therefore, the Technical council came up
with an idea of providing personal mentorship to them from our batch
students(as mentors).

We will soon be releasing self-study curriculums containing topics related
to each community ( GameDev, WebDev, CP, ML etc. ) and resources from where
to learn that specific topic in an organized manner to all the students.
Selected mentors will be helping the self-studying students (from the
curriculums) in cases when they're stuck.

I call for the students who are good in CP or GameDev or WebDev to sign up
for the mentor role by filling this form
<https://forms.gle/QY2PdPqurP8wF5UD8>. This can add immense value to our
juniors in their learning. We will soon be expanding personal mentorship to
other technical clubs as well.

Common Queries for mentors :
*Q: *How many mentors are we going to pick from the responses ?
*Ans: *As of now, there's no limitation on the number of mentors we are
going to pick from the responses, all the potential candidates are
welcomed.

*Q: *Selection Procedure ?
*Ans: *Selection of the CP mentor is purely based on the ranks on Coding
platforms.
Selection of the WebDev and GameDev mentor is based on the CV, Tech Stack
and the projects you've worked on.

*Q: * How many students does each mentor assigned to ?
*Ans: *A maximum of 7 juniors gets assigned to a mentor. Beyond that is
up to the mentor.

*Q: *When and how juniors can contact mentors ?
*Ans: *Yacc Server will be edited to incorporate separate groups containing
the mentor and his/her assigned students. Sharing whatsapp and phone number
sharing is upto the mentor. The mentor can schedule the hours when the
assigned students can contact him/her.

*Q: *Do you have to debug juniors code ?
*A: *Absolutely,No.

Link to the form : https://forms.gle/QY2PdPqurP8wF5UD8 ( just in case you
missed the same link above ). Form closes on Sunday 11:59pm.

Looking forward to your participation guys. In case of any more queries,
please feel free to contact me on whatsapp.

*PS: *** I ensure complete privacy to your information filled in the form **

Thanks and Regards,
Jayanth Kumar,
Secretary, Technical Affairs.


*****************************************************

” to similar papers on Academia.

*****************************************************

Dear Students:

Please find attached the final timetable for the Aug-Dec 2022 semester
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/11gfkWe_UVyJkhpons4qPWjrnxspYZ_uN/view>
starting tomorrow. The same has been uploaded to our website under the
"Academics" menu. The allotted classroom for each course [e.g., A 112 -
Room no. prefixed with A (Ahalia) or N (Nila)] is given in the last column.
Since most of you need to travel between the campuses to attend classes,
please check the Institute's bus schedule and plan your commute accordingly
to arrive on time.

Best wishes for the new academic semester...

Thanks and regards,
--
Sudheesh

*****************************************************

Dear all,

Please join me in congratulating Noushija M.K., a PhD scholar working with
Dr. Shanmugaraju, who has won the best poster award at the 7th
International Conference on Molecular Sensors & Logic Gates (MSMLG-22) held
at Trinity College Dublin, Ireland. For more details, you may look at the
attached images.

Congratulations Noushija and Dr. Shanmugaraju for this achievement. Hope to
hear more such good news from your group.

Best regards,
Uma

*************************************************************************************************************

Dear Dr. Uma
I am pleased to inform you that my group Ph.D. student Ms. Noushija M. K.
won the best poster presentation award at the 7th International Conference
on Molecular Sensors & Logic Gates (MSMLG-22) held at Trinity College
Dublin, Ireland.
Please find the attached certificate and images related to this award.
Thanks and best regards
Shanmugam

*****************************************************

Hello Everyone,

Warm greetings from the Machine Learning Group and CREDS at IIT Palakkad.

We would like to invite you to the Florence Nightingale Data Science Talk
Series, held on the last Saturday of every month at 11 AM IST. This time,
on *27/08/2022*, we have *Dr. Naresh Manwani, Assistant Professor
International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad*, to deliver a
talk on *Learning under Uncertain/Incomplete Supervision.*

Dr. Naresh Manwani is currently an Assistant Professor at IIIT Hyderabad.
He is associated with Machine learning Lab at Kohli Centre on Intelligent
Systems (KCIS). Before joining IIIT-H, he worked at Microsoft India (R & D)
Pvt. Ltd, Bangalore and GE Global research Centre, Bangalore. He finished
his PhD from IISc Bangalore under supervision of Professor P. S. Sastry.

His research interests are statistical learning theory, deep learning,
online learning and reinforcement learning, specifically looking at the
problems in the area of learning with label noise, learning in high risk
situations, learning with incomplete supervision and adversarial machine
learning.


Check out our official website <https://mlgiitpkd.github.io/dst.html> for
more details on the talk series. The meeting will be online on Zoom and is
open to all.



Feel free to contact us if you have any questions.



Meet link: https://zoom.us/j/92885815960


Thanks and Regards,

Vishnu B Raj

Machine Learning Group, IIT Palakkad, https://mlgiitpkd.github.io

CREDS, creds@iitpkd.ac.in

Trending Stories from Money Business

-----


21 June 2022 Financial Express


https://www.financialexpress.com/market/nifty-jumps-1-7-sensex-surges-800-pts-day-heres-why-should-investors-start-buying-stocks-amid-volatility/2567677/
“Choppy movement in the broader market is expected and it is likely to face resistance near 15700 marks and on downside 15000 may act as the key support level. The near-term market trend is weak and we can expect the level of 14700 in near term. One may look for good quality stocks for the long-term perspective and invest in good large caps stocks as it has been that in an inflationary environment large-caps stocks have outperformed,” said Akhilesh Jat.
Read More: https://www.quora.com/qemail/track_click?aoid=b60BYxpqMRy&aoty=4&aty=4&cp=0&ct=1656685011988967&et=146&id=4b10ee4f9f184755adc824f2bf3f8840&notif_type=418&request_id=418&snid=38688970517&src=1&st=1656685011992607&stories=%5B(%3Cstory_types.tribe_post%3A+10%3E%2C+69662495)%2C+(%3Cstory_types.tribe_post%3A+10%3E%2C+69042579)%2C+(%3Cstory_types.tribe_post%3A+10%3E%2C+69664260)%5D&tribe_item_ids=jiMpIkGYrbi%7C1fd3Z3uQNE6%7CU5E6Hnc1Zu&uid=Mcebbm1BPpQ&v=0
-----


2 years back The covid pandemic came with a sudden shock of compulsory lockdown for weeks, sudden mass hospitalization, reduction in salary and business income, and the worst was job loss and losing loved ones. The whole world had witnessed these events in some or the other way. It was really a hard time for all of us but especially women had witnessed its bitterness much more.

Because of a slowdown in economic activity and a complete lockdown for weeks resulted in the stoppage of active production for some companies, the demand for goods and services had reduced, the supply chain got disturbed and it all resulted in losses for the companies, and because of this companies had to cut their salaries or reduce their workforce. Surprisingly women employees were asked to leave the organization more than men employees and this leads many women to lose their job in this pandemic. Some have to leave their job to take care of their family members who fell sick in this pandemic.

Some are fortunate to get back the employment post things became normal but still, a majority of men and women are still unemployed so for them managing household expenses is really a worry.

Following pointers must be helpful for you if you are one of those in this difficult situation.

1. Make a monthly budget and compulsorily stick to it. If you were contributing to monthly household expenses and now because of no income it is better to make sure that your following the budget and sticking with essential spending each month.

2. Make sure that you are not using your emergency fund for any discretionary expenses. You have to postpone such spending till you regain employment.

3. Make a note of the next 6 months' compulsory expenses including medical expenses. Then check what total savings you have currently which is liquid means not deployed for your long-term goals. If you feel that your liquid amount is less than covering the next 6 months' expenses then pause your SIPs and other investments till things turn positive for you.

4. If your emergency fund seems short then you may liquidate investments that you were doing for any short-term financial goals. But never liquidate the investments for any ad hoc or impulsive purchases.

5. But if you already have a saving which is quite more than the emergency fund in that case you should continue funding your SIPs if you are doing it for the long term.

6. Last but not least start searching aggressively for a new job and meanwhile, look for any freelancing work available as per your skill and qualification.
Read More: https://www.quora.com/qemail/track_click?aoid=j80tIj4RjdH&aoty=4&aty=4&cp=0&ct=1656685011988967&et=146&id=4b10ee4f9f184755adc824f2bf3f8840&notif_type=418&request_id=418&snid=38688970517&src=1&st=1656685011992607&stories=%5B(%3Cstory_types.tribe_post%3A+10%3E%2C+69662495)%2C+(%3Cstory_types.tribe_post%3A+10%3E%2C+69042579)%2C+(%3Cstory_types.tribe_post%3A+10%3E%2C+69664260)%5D&tribe_item_ids=jiMpIkGYrbi%7C1fd3Z3uQNE6%7CU5E6Hnc1Zu&uid=Mcebbm1BPpQ&v=0

Dear all,

The General Quiz was conducted successfully yesterday. The prelims were
conducted in the morning, out of which the 4 top teams advanced to the
finals. The finals, which was conducted in the evening, was an intense
affair till the very last round but one team simply outclassed the others.

The finals standings are as follows:

   1. Ashwin R Nair and Kiran M V
   2. Puneet Singh
   3. Vaibhav B Nagrale and Vinay Ingle
   4. Paul M Kunju

I would like to express my heartfelt gratitude to all those who
participated in the quiz and would like to once again congratulate all the
finalists.
Looking forward to seeing you all soon in the next quiz.

Regards
Kartik Gopa Kumar
Secretary, Qriosity

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: INAE Youth Conclave for 2022 <inaeyc2022@iitj.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Aug 29, 2022 at 10:13 PM
Subject: Invitation for participation in Youth Conclave 2022
To: <gen_sec@smail.iitpkd.ac.in>


Greetings for the day!

It gives me immense pleasure to announce that *Youth Conclave 2022* will be
organized by the Indian Institute of Technology Jodhpur in association
with *INAE
(Indian National Academy of Engineering).*

INAE is a prestigious organization that conducts Youth Conclave annually to
give incredible opportunities to young engineers from all across the nation
to showcase their exceptional talent and wisdom in various domains in front
of renowned and distinguished experts who have their exceptional
contributions in the field of Engineering R&D, Industry and Academics.

The theme of INAE Youth Conclave-2022 is: *“Emerging Technologies for
Sustainable Future”.*

The specific focus areas are related to:
*Quantum Technologies,*
*Smart Infrastructure,*
*Digital Healthcare,*
*Materials for Sustainability,*
*Experiential Interface,*
*Sustainability of Drinking Water,*
*Food: An Emerging Vista of Engineering*

This 5th edition of the same will encompass diverse and numerous
challenging events such as *Hackathon, Ideathon, Game Jam, Start-up
Showcase, 3-Minutes Thesis Presentation by Research Scholars and Technical
Sessions on the focus areas.*
On behalf of *IIT Jodhpur*, it is my utmost pleasure to cordially invite
you and your distinguished team members to flaunt your knack by actively
participating in these events.

We look forward to your arrival at IIT Jodhpur!

--
*Thanks & Regards*
*Team Youth Conclave 5.0*
Website <https://iitj.ac.in/inae/> | LinkedIn
<https://www.linkedin.com/company/youth-conclave-2022/> | Instagram
<https://www.instagram.com/youth_conclave_2022/> | *Discord
<https://discord.com/invite/qCRqdUQT>*
*IIT Jodhpur*

                display: block;
                padding-top: 20px;
                max-width: 280px;
                padding-left: 35px !important;
                padding-right: 0 !important;
            }
            .cptn_box h2 {
                margin: 0px 0 5px !important;
                font-size: 16px !important;
                line-height: 20px !important;
            }
            .cptn_box p {
                font-size: 15px !important;
                line-height: 21px !important;
            }
        }
    </style>
</head>

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Dr. Ashok Jhunjhunwala <tenetoffice@tenet.res.in>
Date: Wed, Jul 13, 2022 at 12:35 PM
Subject: Seeking urgent action: Call for participation in EMPOWER 2022
Assistive Technology Conference – Reg.
To: <director@iitpkd.ac.in>
Cc: <jaya@incubation.iitm.ac.in>, <nafisa@respark.iitm.ac.in>, <
shradha@respark.iitm.ac.in>, <akila@incubation.iitm.ac.in>, office <
office@tenet.res.in>


To
Prof. P. B. Sunil Kumar
Professor & Director
Department Physics
IIT Palakkad
Palakkad

Dear Prof. Sunil Kumar,

*Sub:* Seeking urgent action: Call for participation in EMPOWER 2022
Assistive Technology Conference – Reg.

I am seeking your help. It is our strong belief that India can become a
leader in Assistive Technology and Geriatrics (technology for people with
disabilities and for senior citizens) if we in academia join hands
together. We request you to encourage interested faculty, students and
start-ups at your Institution to participate in this endeavour.

Towards this, IIT Madras Research Park (IITMRP) is joining the organisers
of EMPOWER Assistive Technology Conference in hosting *EMPOWER 2022 from
13th to 15th October 2022 *at IITMRP (Chennai, India).

We welcome your colleagues and students to submit research papers to the
Conference. The paper submission guidelines can be found in the conference
website *(**https://empower2022.in/* <https://empower2022.in/>*)**.* The
conference will have paper presentations, workshops and product display by
startups and others. Exhibitors will also get a time slot for presentation
of their products. (There will be no charge for the exhibition space).

Kindly request interested students/faculty to fill out the registration
form available at *https://empower2022.in/* <https://empower2022.in/> before
July 31st, 2022.

Looking forward to your support.



Ashok Jhunjhunwala

Organizing Chair of EMPOWER 2022

Institute Professor, IIT Madras, India

President, IITM Research Park, IITM Incubation Cell and RTBI



*Encl.: Empower 2022 Brochures *

*****************************************************

DAY 271
12/07/2022

*IMPERIUM *

Mindfulness practices help us establish a sense of power or authority over
our automatic behaviors, developing a greater sense of confidence and
self-control. Meditate for at least five minutes, silently repeating the
mantra “Imperium,” which means “power” or “authority.” When the mind
wanders, come back to the mantra. With each exhale, allow a wave of
relaxation to pass through every part of the body, as if each exhale is
establishing greater power throughout every part of your being.

--
  *FORWARD TOGETHER*
*Team MITRA*
*IIT Palakkad*
*Nila Campus Room# B-224A (Tilang Hostel)*
*Ahalia Campus#Hostel 3 (Left side Room)*
https://www.facebook.com/TEAM.MITRA.IIT.PALAKKAD
<https://www.facebook.com/TEAM.MITRA.IIT.PALAKKAD/?__cft__[0]=AZWnTfStvGlEXxtjgA1HgnDm-8s9Tn2cQ7hvMVz-Mn8flr9ZwNvDoYd2s9muzRozhOvnhjaSZ3uKZMEKAZ7UtfIStmZiExYfiKweNttjb6Iy26uHgaqcxhb4bkU2yOET96yGUmYzUnvCpztdg_FAsD_X6UlK2G1yqL7NAN651Z7pglMtbf3XUN57-fngOjJeNIk&__tn__=kK-R>


*****************************************************

DAY 307
05/09/2022

*REVERENCE INSIGHT MEDITATION*

 Reverence is deep respect for the sacred, and from a mindfulness
perspective, all beings and all things are worthy of reverence.
  ♦ Take a few minutes to meditate and set a timer for at least five
minutes.
  ♦ Ask yourself, “What does it mean for me to be reverent?”
  ♦ Notice your mind’s natural response. Breathe and take your time.
  ♦ Ask again, “What does it mean for me to be reverent?”
  ♦ Allow the body to be relaxed as you continue to ask the same question,
observing the many ways your mind will respond.

-FORWARD TOGETHER-
*Team MITRA*
*IIT Palakkad*
*Nila Campus Room# B-224A (Tilang Hostel)*
*Ahalia Campus#Hostel 3 (Left side Room)*
https://www.facebook.com/TEAM.MITRA.IIT.PALAKKAD
<https://www.facebook.com/TEAM.MITRA.IIT.PALAKKAD/?__cft__[0]=AZWnTfStvGlEXxtjgA1HgnDm-8s9Tn2cQ7hvMVz-Mn8flr9ZwNvDoYd2s9muzRozhOvnhjaSZ3uKZMEKAZ7UtfIStmZiExYfiKweNttjb6Iy26uHgaqcxhb4bkU2yOET96yGUmYzUnvCpztdg_FAsD_X6UlK2G1yqL7NAN651Z7pglMtbf3XUN57-fngOjJeNIk&__tn__=kK-R>

Hey everyone,

DAY 298
27/08/2022

*PRESENT MOMENT CONTEXT *

Cultivate a more advanced expression of present moment context by expanding
your awareness beyond your surroundings in this meditation.
  ♦ Set a timer for your meditation.
  ♦ Close your eyes and bring the awareness into the breath.
♦ Visualize yourself in your current environment, seeing all directions
around you.
  ♦ Welcome the sensations in your body, your emotions, and anything else
that presents itself to you.
♦ Visualize the immediate surroundings, the building and neighborhood you
are in, expanding outward to the city, nation, planet, and beyond until
your timer goes off.

FORWARD TOGETHER
-- 
*Team MITRA*
*IIT Palakkad*

Dear Student,







Greetings from the ETS India Resource Centre managed by DP Cube Learning.







ETS (Educational Testing Service), as you may already be aware develops, administers and scores more than 50 million tests annually – including the globally well-known TOEFL and GRE tests in over 180 countries worldwide.







ETS India Resource Centre invites you to attend a GRE Masterclass titled “ETS GRE – Text Completion (Verbal Reasoning)”.  This session has been designed to help aspiring test-takers, gain insights about the GRE test, in a way that will enhance skills and help them in acing the exam. The session is suitable for both beginners and intermediate learners.



[cid:image001.png@01D89147.BD175C80]<https://forms.gle/HNfi7VpmAqzcyo7z7>[cid:image004.png@01D89545.022D60C0]

Date:23 July, 2022



Time:5:00pm- 6:30pm.

*****************************************************

All hostellers are requested to take note of the following:
1. All hostellers should be back inside the campus before 10 p.m. Those
returning after this time without the advance permission of the Warden are
liable for action.

2. Any hosteller staying out of campus overnight should positively make an
entry in the register kept with the security guard while going out and
close the entry on arrival.

3. Those from the Ahalia campus wishing to stay overnight on the Nila
campus and vice-versa should obtain the permission of both wardens. Also,
make an entry in the register kept with the security guard while entering
the other hostel and close the entry on completion of your stay.

4. Students staying in Ahalia mess and wishing to take a particular meal
from the Nila mess due to academic purposes can do so only by collecting
the food coupon(s), from the mess manager of their hostel on the previous
day itself. The same rule applies to those belonging to Nila mess and
wishing to take a particular meal from Ahalia mess.

 *Action will be taken against those who do not follow these rules
strictly.*

With Regards,
--
Himanshu Kumar,
Secretary, Hostel Affairs,
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
Ph: +91 8235861628
Email: sec_hostel@smail.iitpkd.ac.in

*****************************************************

Dear All,

Mr. Shubhang Jain  who is working with the guidance of Dr. Sanjukta
Chakraborty will be presenting his open research seminar on 19th May 2022
at 02:30 PM through online mode.

Title: Development of a novel adaptive feedback-based system for the passive
control of rail bridge vibration

Date & Time: 19th May 2022 at 02:30 PM
Venue: Zoom meeting details are given below
Meeting ID:   945 8297 5396
Passcode:     935879
Meeting link:
https://zoom.us/j/94582975396?pwd=bEhDN082MHZWVy9XZmFtMkJ2VHpVQT09

ABSTRACT :

This study investigates the multiple tuning requirements of rail bridge
girder and offers the design of a novel passive adaptive control mechanism
providing the optimum tuning effect in various situations causing system
modifications. In the first part of the study, a generalized stepwise
formulation is established for designing an optimum
multiple-tuned-mass-damper (MTMD) system in the modal space of a continuous
bridge girder for controlling a selected set of modes. The numerical simulation
of a real-life steel rail bridge girder using OpenSees shows that the
MTMD system
provides unsatisfactory results in case of a detuned condition while
subjected to ground excitations with strong vertical components. Therefore,
a passive conical spring based tuned-mass-damper (TMD) system is proposed
theoretically along with a feedback-amplifier. The principle and design of
the conical spring, dampers and the feedback-amplifier system are presented
for providing optimum tuning at variations in the system inertia while
subjected to dynamic excitations. In order to realize the performance of
the control system, the same rail bridge girder is considered along with
the proposed control system after modelling it numerically in OpenSees. A
dynamic interaction study is conducted for selecting the feedback- amplifier
properties. The selected mass points for designing the proposed control
system are justified based on a time settlement analysis. Comparative
assessment is carried out considering the response time history
performances of total four control systems, namely, system 1, which is the
proposed control system assembly; system 2, in which the TMD is optimally
tuned to the primary structure with full train-load; system 3, in which the
TMD is optimally tuned to the primary structure without train- load; and
system 4, in which the optimal TMD design is accomplished considering
a weighted
combination of the transfer functions of the primary structure at both
the train-load
conditions. Results from the analysis demonstrate that the proposed control
system can be successfully designed to remain optimally tuned for modifications
in the dynamic system properties and thus, the control system provides
significant
response reduction of the primary structure at all the designed load conditions
although the conventional MTMD system suffers from the performance degradation
whenever there is a variation in the conforming loading condition.



All are cordially invited.

-- 
Thank you
Regards,

Office of the Dean (Academics)
IIT Palakkad

*MATLAB in Research*
[image: Otto von Guericke University Magdeburg Optimizes Power Grid as
Renewable Energy Sources Come Online]
<https://in.mathworks.com/company/user_stories/otto-von-guericke-university-magdeburg-optimizes-power-grid-as-renewable-energy-sources-come-online.html?s_v1=43833&elqem=3743191_EM_IN_DIR_22-06_MOE-EDU&elqTrackId=f8a3230498ce437eaab32e0c5b5d8ea4&elq=3aa50b2d7807417a9e0a98ca4b8af44b&elqaid=43833&elqat=1&elqCampaignId=16148>
*Otto von Guericke University Magdeburg Optimizes Power Grid as Renewable
Energy Sources Come Online*
Working in MATLAB, OVGU researchers modeled the power flow behavior of
transformers and other individual pieces of equipment using systems of
nonlinear equations.
Read story
<https://in.mathworks.com/company/user_stories/otto-von-guericke-university-magdeburg-optimizes-power-grid-as-renewable-energy-sources-come-online.html?s_v1=43833&elqem=3743191_EM_IN_DIR_22-06_MOE-EDU&elqTrackId=44866ea03e364ddd96e137d1a22d20c7&elq=3aa50b2d7807417a9e0a98ca4b8af44b&elqaid=43833&elqat=1&elqCampaignId=16148>
*MATLAB and Simulink in Industry*
*Machine Learning Helps Fix Broken Hearts: Startup Brings Arrhythmia
Treatment into the 21st Century*
Startup, Corify Care, uses AI to develop a noninvasive system to identify
the source of heart problems, which will improve diagnostics, reduce costs,
and save lives.
Read article
<https://in.mathworks.com/company/mathworks-stories/corify-care-machine-learning-improves-ecg-technology.html?s_v1=43833&elqem=3743191_EM_IN_DIR_22-06_MOE-EDU&elqTrackId=c423548b97b2407eb84a7931cca5122a&elq=3aa50b2d7807417a9e0a98ca4b8af44b&elqaid=43833&elqat=1&elqCampaignId=16148>

Dear All,
    It gives me immense pleasure to announce the setup of the Academic
Forum of IIT Palakkad on Discord. All the important information,
announcements and discussions related to the academic council will be
posted on it.

I kindly request everyone to post all your queries related to academic
matters and also propose any new ideas and discussions related to academics
on this server so that common queries can be addressed at once.

You will be receiving the invite linked to join the server shortly on your
mails. I request everyone to join the server using the invite link. Please
note that the invite link will expire in 7 days.


*--*
*Regards,*

*Yagnesh Katragadda*

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: All India Council for Technical Education(no-reply) <
admin@aicte-india.org>
Date: Fri, Sep 23, 2022 at 12:52 PM
Subject: MIC & ACITE - Registrations open for KAPILA phase IV- Funding
opportunity for Patents – Regarding
To: <cio@iitpkd.ac.in>


*Dear Sir / Madam,*

Greetings from the Ministry of Education Innovation Cell & AICTE…

“Avail funding for patent through KAPILA”

As you are aware that the Ministry of Education’s Innovation Cell (MIC), in
collaboration with All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), has
launched the* “Kalam Program for IP Literacy and Awareness (KAPILA)”*.

This program provides financial assistance to the institutions that are
part of the Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) for filing the patent.
This program will create appropriate awareness regarding the need of IP
filing, mechanism, and methodology involved in filing IP in India and
globally, especially amongst students and faculty of higher education
institutions.

*I kindly request to circulate this information among faculties and
students of your institute. *

*NOTE: Only convener of the KAPILA Committee can register their institute
and submit applications on behalf of the applicant’s not an individual
(student/faculty). After Convener completes institute registration, kindly
inform their respective Institute students and faculty to apply. *

*KAPILA REGISTRATION OPEN FOR PHASE IV*

*Register now through the KAPILA portal link:  **https://kapila.mic.gov.in/*
<https://kapila.mic.gov.in/>

*For any query you may contact to email ID : **kapila@aicte-india.org*
<kapila@aicte-india.org>
* and telephone No. 011-2958 1225 *
*OR**JOIN KAPILA TELEGRAM GROUP and mention your query in group : *
*https://t.me/+SljAoMOwrF0wMDNl* <https://t.me/+SljAoMOwrF0wMDNl>

PFA:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wP-NGYBVCC36cdEaaHv--W2E80s29zxx/view?usp=sharing


*With Best Regards,*
*KAPILA Team*
*Ministry of Education’s Innovation Cell*
*AICTE HQs, New Delhi.*
*011-29581225*

*kapila@aicte-india.org <kapila@aicte-india.org>https://kapila.mic.gov.in/
<https://kapila.mic.gov.in/>*

> with little to no prerequisites required. So, it's a very good opportunity
> for all who know some programming language and want to start up with
> Competitive programming.

>>>>>> Hope you all are doing well.

>>>>>> (mail of which was sent earlier). We encourage everyone to participate in
>>>>>> it.
>>>>>> So, we are postponing yesterday's contest discussion session which
>>>>>> was supposed to be held today to tomorrow *Tuesday, 16th November *from
>>>>>> *9 pm.*
>>>>>> Use the same Google Meet Link sent earlier for tomorrow's discussion
>>>>>> session.
>>>>>>
>>>>>> *Join YACC on Discord*: https://discord.gg/sVtEgQCqCk
>>>>>>

*****************************************************

Hello Everyone!

Greetings from Yet Another Coding Club (YACC) IITPKD!! Hope you all are
doing well.

Yet Another Coding Club (YACC) is conducting a series of competitive
programming contests. These contests will be beginner-friendly contests
with little to no prerequisites required. So, it's a very good opportunity
for all who know some programming language and want to start up with
Competitive programming.

The 8th Training Programming contest will be conducted *today* *(Saturday,
17th September), from 9:05 PM - 11:05 PM*. The platform will be Codeforces.
Kindly create an account in advance.

You need to register for the contest before it starts. The registration
phase will start 6 hours before the Contest. The doubt discussion session
timing will be informed later.

Contest link: Contest Link
<https://codeforces.com/contestInvitation/ae3b8460b25c41a04fd0ef16cb2396edc86626df%20Codeforces>

For those who do not know what CP is, have a look at this YouTube
video : Introduction
to CP <https://youtu.be/xAeiXy8-9Y8>
For an introduction to the Codeforces platform : Introduction to Codeforces
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fbNRCXRJ76E>
For more clarification on how to submit on the Codeforces platform :
Document
<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1t-aKEUXTgXAf-di0o5eOveNm9ziAgExTT-XzMv_uI64/edit>

*Join YACC on Discord*: https://discord.gg/sVtEgQCqCk

Thanks and Regards,
*Yet Another Coding Club (YACC)*
*IIT Palakkad*

*****************************************************

Hello Everyone!

Greetings from Yet Another Coding Club (YACC) IITPKD!! Hope you all are
doing well.

Yet Another Coding Club (YACC) is conducting a series of competitive
programming contests. These contests will be beginner-friendly contests
with little to no prerequisites required. So, it's a very good opportunity
for all who know some programming language and want to start up with
Competitive programming.

The 7th Training Programming contest will be conducted tomorrow (*Friday,
24th June*), from *9:05 PM - 11:05 PM*. The platform will be Codeforces.
Kindly create an account in advance.

You need to register for the contest before it starts. The registration
phase will start 6 hours before the Contest. The time of the doubt
discussion session will be informed later.

Contest link: Contest Link
<https://codeforces.com/contestInvitation/34ab8b793484df327905b6a08c15ac384887b562>


For those who do not know what CP is, have a look at this YouTube
video : Introduction
to CP <https://youtu.be/xAeiXy8-9Y8>
For an introduction to the Codeforces platform : Introduction to Codeforces
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fbNRCXRJ76E>
For more clarification on how to submit on the Codeforces platform :  Link
to doc
<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1t-aKEUXTgXAf-di0o5eOveNm9ziAgExTT-XzMv_uI64/edit>

Looking forward to active participation from everyone!

*Join YACC on Discord*: https://discord.gg/sVtEgQCqCk

Thanks and Regards,
*Yet Another Coding Club (YACC)*
*IIT Palakkad*

*****************************************************

Hello Everyone!

Greetings from Yet Another Coding Club (YACC) IITPKD!! Hope you all are
doing well.

Yet Another Coding Club (YACC) is conducting a series of competitive
programming contests. These contests will be beginner-friendly contests
with little to no prerequisites required. So, it's a very good opportunity
for all who know some programming language and want to start up with
Competitive programming.

We decided to resume Contests and now plan to host at least one contest on
the last Friday of the Month. The 6th Training Programming contest will be
conducted tomorrow (Friday, 27th May), from 9:05 PM - 11:05 PM. The
platform will be Codeforces. Kindly create an account in advance.

You need to register for the contest before it starts. The registration
phase will start 6 hours before the Contest. The doubt discussion session
will be on Saturday (28th May) 10 am.

Contest link: Contest Link
<https://codeforces.com/contestInvitation/22da946a702610a8f7b628054b2b946891785f0b>

Doubt Discussion session link: Discussion Link
<https://meet.google.com/rir-hhms-abj>

For those who do not know what CP is, have a look at this YouTube
video : Introduction
to CP <https://youtu.be/xAeiXy8-9Y8>
For an introduction to the Codeforces platform : Introduction to Codeforces
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fbNRCXRJ76E>
For more clarification on how to submit on the Codeforces platform :  Link
to doc
<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1t-aKEUXTgXAf-di0o5eOveNm9ziAgExTT-XzMv_uI64/edit>

*Join YACC on Discord*: https://discord.gg/sVtEgQCqCk

Thanks and Regards,
*Yet Another Coding Club (YACC)*
*IIT Palakkad*

Greetings from Yet Another Coding Club (YACC) IITPKD!!
Hope you all are doing well.

We are conducting a contests discussion session for Codechef Snackdown 1A
<https://www.codechef.com/SNCK1A21?itm_campaign=contest_listing>, 1B
<https://www.codechef.com/SNCK1B21?itm_campaign=contest_listing>, and
Inter-IIT <https://www.codechef.com/IICP2021> held recently,
*today from 9 pm.*Google Meet Link: https://meet.google.com/vfx-mpdg-yds

You can ask any doubts you have or discuss any problems from these contests
and even if you have not participated, you can still learn a lot from the
session. We strongly encourage everyone to come and discuss.
Hope to see you all during the session!!

*Join YACC on Discord*: https://discord.gg/sVtEgQCqCk

Thanks and Regards,
*Yet Another Coding Club (YACC)*
*IIT Palakkad*

*****************************************************

Greetings from Yet Another Coding Club (YACC) IITPKD!!
Hope you all are doing well.

Yet Another Coding Club (YACC) is conducting a *series of competitive
programming contests.* These contests will be beginner-friendly contests
with little to no prerequisites required. So, it's a very good opportunity
for all who know some programming language and want to start up with
Competitive programming.

As part of it, the *4th Training Programming contest* will be conducted *today
(Saturday, 23rd October)*, from *9:05 PM - 11:20 PM*. The platform will be
Codeforces <https://codeforces.com/>. Kindly create an account in advance. *You
need to register for the contest before it starts. *The registration phase
has already started.
We will have a doubt discussion session on* Monday*, *25th October* from *9
pm*.

Contest link: YACC-Training-Contest #4
<https://codeforces.com/contestInvitation/81ea7553e6df81570e5cff606ab3bd774f40ae96>
Doubt discussion session link: https://meet.google.com/qod-hkoj-xya

*Join YACC on Discord*: https://discord.gg/sVtEgQCqCk

Thanks and Regards,
*Yet Another Coding Club (YACC)*
*IIT Palakkad*

CS5014-W-2022 -> Forums -> Announcements -> Final Exam Instructions 
https://lms.iitpkd.ac.in/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=8976#p10395
Final Exam Instructions
by Deepak Rajendraprasad - Wednesday, 4 May 2022, 12:11 PM
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Dear Students,

FDSML final exam will start at 9.30 AM tomorrow (5/May). It will be a 90
minutes exam. There will be 15-20 objective type questions and 2-3 essay
type questions.

Please keep your webcams on and be connected to zoom (our usual link)
during the entire exam. It is a closed book exam.

All the best
Deepak



---------------------------------------------------------------------
Change your forum digest preferences:
https://lms.iitpkd.ac.in/mod/forum/index.php?id=831

Dear All,


Greetings of the day from IIT Patna Vishlesan I-Hub Foundation!


As you all are aware, The Department of Science and Technology (Govt. of
India) has selected the IIT Patna Vishlesan I-Hub Foundation as one of the
technology innovation hub as part of its National Mission on
Interdisciplinary Cyber-Physical Systems (NM-ICPS) program. The IIT Patna
Vishlesan I-Hub Foundation is pleased to announce the release of its
fellowship program listed below:


a)    Chanakya UG Fellowship(
https://tih.iitp.ac.in/index.php/fellowships/ug-pg-fellowship)

b)    Chanakya PG Fellowship (

*EXPERIMENTAL EXPERIENCES*

 Experiences are the chemicals of life which the philosopher is
experimenting with. —*Manly P. Hall*


FORWARD TOGETHER-
*Team MITRA*
*IIT Palakkad*
*Nila Campus Room# B-224A (Tilang Hostel)*
*Ahalia Campus#Hostel 3 (Left side Room)*
https://www.facebook.com/TEAM.MITRA.IIT.PALAKKAD
<https://www.facebook.com/TEAM.MITRA.IIT.PALAKKAD/?__cft__[0]=AZWnTfStvGlEXxtjgA1HgnDm-8s9Tn2cQ7hvMVz-Mn8flr9ZwNvDoYd2s9muzRozhOvnhjaSZ3uKZMEKAZ7UtfIStmZiExYfiKweNttjb6Iy26uHgaqcxhb4bkU2yOET96yGUmYzUnvCpztdg_FAsD_X6UlK2G1yqL7NAN651Z7pglMtbf3XUN57-fngOjJeNIk&__tn__=kK-R>


*****************************************************

*Read the passage provided and answer the questions that follow*

The amount of CO2 in our atmosphere is actually quite small: nitrogen and
oxygen make up 99 per cent of the atmosphere, and argon and other gases
another 0.9 per cent. But a little bit of CO2 goes a long way. There are
currently 418 parts per million (ppm) of CO2 molecules in our atmosphere –
that is, just four 1,000ths of what we breathe. Nonetheless, this is almost
50 per cent higher than pre-industrial levels; in 1800, atmospheric CO2
stood at 280 ppm.

The last time CO2 levels were this high was 5 million years ago, at the end
of the Miocene epoch. CO2 was then between 400 and 500 ppm, creating a
world quite different from the one we inhabit – with no ice at the poles
and global sea levels 50 to 100 feet higher than today. Bring back these
sea levels and half of Florida disappears. So do our coastal cities:
London, New York, Cairo and Venice. Each would become a new version of the
Lost City of Atlantis – unless hidden behind a seawall.

If Miocene Earth had the same amount of CO2 in the atmosphere as we have
currently, why aren’t we living in the same conditions? It’s a matter of
time lags: there’s a delay as the climate equilibrates with the amount of
CO2 in the atmosphere. The planet will eventually catch up. A Miocene
climate is coming. It’s like seeing the flash of a far-off explosion, but
the shockwave hasn’t yet reached us.


1. The amount of CO2 in our atmosphere is actually quite small. But a
little bit of CO2 goes a long way.
This means that
1) CO2 in our atmosphere can travel long distances
2) CO2 in our atmosphere is very high
3) The impact that a little CO2 can have is serious
4) We need not worry about the little CO2 in the atmosphere

2. What is almost 50 per cent higher than pre-industrial levels?
1) pollution
2) all gases
3) CO2 in the atmosphere
4) nitrogen

3. Epoch in the passage means
1) a period of time in history
2) a date and time from which a computer measures system time
3) a million years
4) a billion years

4. Which would you 'pair' among Florida, London, New York, Cairo and Venice
a) New York and London
b) London and Cairo
c) Cairo and Venice
d) Florida and New York
1) (a) and (b)
2) (b) and (c)
3) (c) and (a)
4) (b) and (d)

5. A Miocene climate is coming.This would mean
a) no ice in the Arctic or Antarctic circles
b) some highly populated cities will be under sea level
c) sea levels will rise by 50 to 100 feet.
d) cities will need to have sea walls
1) only (c)
2) both (c) and (d)
3) (b), (c) and (d)
4) (a), (b), (c) and (d)

6. Pre-industrial in the passage means
1) before the invention of the wheel
2) before the invention of the steam engine
3) before electricity
4) before the Ford Motor Company



*Answer Key*
1-(3), 2-(3), 3- (1), 4- (4) [2 capitals and 2 American cities], 5-(4), 6-
(2)

*regards, Sandhya*

English Language Support & Services
IIT Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/elss

engineering, law, arts, sciences and business institutes in the country.

graduating batch of students of your esteemed institute.

*Use the following phrasal verbs in the right tense, to fill in the blanks*

a) Shake up: Agitate by shaking
b) Shake up: Upset or distress (If you are 'shaken up' by an unpleasant
experience, or if something 'shakes you up', it makes you feel shocked and
upset, and unable to think calmly or clearly)
c) Shake up: Reorganize, to make reforms in
d) Shape up: Improve; to correct one’s bad habits or behavior
e) Shape up: Take shape; to transform into or become
f) Show in: Lead or direct someone to an enclosed space, usually a room
g) Show off: Exhibit/ show someone the best attributes/important parts of
something
h) Show off: Attract attention to for the purpose of bragging or personal
exhibitionism


1) The jockey was ..................... when he was thrown twice from his
horse yesterday.
2) Tell him that if he doesn't ................., he can pack his bags.
3) Our young musicians will get the chance to......................their
musical skills at the fest.
4) Astronauts ..................... before their missions by working with
small weights, and doing exercises designed for rock climbers.
5) Several new players have been brought in to ............... the team.
6) The recent ........................... in the state cabinet is widely
believed to be a response to the corruption charges under investigation.
7) The plan to have a park at the street corner is beginning to
.......................
8) Please ................... the visitor I am expecting when he rings the
bell.
9) At first, Hermione seemed like a very uptight ................
10) No one likes a ........................., but false modesty can be a
big turn-off too.
11) Mathew didn't ................. until he was thirty years old.
12) He was in the car that plunged off the cliff, and killed everyone else.
That really................  him ...........
13) ............... the cough syrup before taking it.
14) The government wanted to reform the institutions, to
..................the country.
15) ............the healthy salad-dressing of lemon juice and olive oil
before you pour it on the chopped vegetables.
16) Even here, there is consistent fear of anything that threatens to
............... the status quo.
17) The young hostess ............................. the best features of
her new house over a conducted tour.
18) When she arrives, ........ her straight ......... to the board room.

regards, Sandhya

*Answer Key*

1-b (shaken up), 2-d, 3-g, 4-e, 5-c, 6-c, 7-e, 8-f, 9-h, 10-h, 11-d, 12-b
(shook him up), 13-a, 14-c, 15-a, 16-c, 17-g (showed off), 18-f (show her
straight in)

regards, Sandhya
-- 
English Language Support & Services
IIT Palakkad
https://iitpkd.ac.in/elss

On May 18, 2022, we’re updating our Paid Terms of Service (“Paid Terms”) to  

help clarify and make them easier to understand. The Paid Terms apply when  

you purchase content or services on YouTube (such as a movie or Super  

Stickers) or pay for a subscription (such as YouTube Premium) (“Paid  

Services”). You are receiving this message because you have recently  

purchased a Paid Service.

These changes won’t affect the way you use YouTube, access the Paid  

Services, or impact the price of the Paid Services. It’s been a while since  

we updated our Paid Terms and we wanted to ensure they are easy to read and  

up to date with our latest new products.

You can review a full summary of the changes and the updated Paid Terms  

here

DAY 332
11/10/2022

*ELIMINATING DISTRACTIONS *

In meditation, something is only a distraction if you deem it as such.
Allow everything to be as it is, cultivating a sense of equanimity. We
eliminate distractions by allowing them to become part of the meditation

Dear All,

Due to OFC break, Nila campus is cut off from Ahalia Campus. Consequently,
the following services are affected.

Internet in computer labs at Nila
License Server
Resap, Joinus and Faculty portals.
Telephone Services.

However, limited Internet connectivity is available at Nila Campus through
the failover connection from Railtel.

We are working with BSNL to get the cable repaired at the earliest. The
inconvenience caused is regretted.

With regards,
Biju

                line-height: 21px !important;

            }

            .successful_box li {
                font-size: 15px !important;
                line-height: 21px !important;
                margin-bottom: 8px !important;
            }

            .apps {
                padding: 15px 12px !important;
            }

            .apps span {
                font-size: 16px !important;
            }

            .full {
                width: 100%;
            }

            .footer {
                padding: 20px 15px !important;
                border-radius: 0 0 8px 8px;
            }

            .footer div a {
                padding: 0 3px !important;
            }

            .btns a {
                padding: 12px 30px !important;
                font-size: 14px !important;
            }
            .disclaimer {
                font-size: 14px !important;
                line-height: 19px !important;
            }
        }
    </style>
</head>

                            <tr>
                                <td class="successful_box" style="background-color: #f6f7f8; padding: 50px;">
                                    <table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0">
                                        <tbody>
                                            <tr>
                                                <td>
                                                    <div class="canceled">
                                                        <p
                                                            style="margin: 0 0 25px; font-size: 16px; color: #101010; line-height: 22px;">
                                                            Hi Joel Sam Mathew,
                                                        </p>

                                                        <div class="text_box"
                                                            style="margin: 0; font-size: 16px; color: #101010; line-height: 24px;">
                                                            <p>Kindly read through the following <strong>updated </strong>key instructions regarding the structure, timeline, and rules:</p>
<p><strong>Timelines & Questions: </strong></p>
<ul>
<li aria-level="1"><strong>Online Quiz Window: 1st July 2022 from 12:00 PM IST (6:30 am GMT) </strong>to <strong>2nd July 2022 8:00 PM IST (2:30 PM GMT)</strong></li>
<li aria-level="1"><strong>Online Quiz Duration: </strong>30 Minutes </li>
<li aria-level="1"><strong>Total Questions to be answered: </strong>30 Questions </li>
<li aria-level="1"><strong>Time Per Question:</strong> 60 seconds</li>
<li aria-level="1">The questions will be based on <strong>e-commerce trivia, tech awareness </strong><strong>and computer science fundamentals</strong></li>
<li aria-level="1">All the members of the team are eligible to appear for the quiz round. The final marks be rewarded based on the <strong>average score of the team members attempting the quiz </strong>(For ex - in a team of 3, if all the 3 members attempt the quiz and score 3,4 & 5 marks respectively, the team score will be [(3+4+5)/3] which equals 4)</li>
<li aria-level="1">You can attempt the quiz anytime between the provided quiz window</li>
<li aria-level="1">Please ensure that you attempt the quiz in one sitting, as once you start the quiz, the timer won’t stop</li>
<li aria-level="1">You will have to finish the quiz before <strong>2nd July 2022 08:00 PM IST (2:30 PM GMT)</strong>. To get the complete assessment duration, you need to start the assessment latest by <strong>2nd July 07:30 PM IST (2:00 PM GMT). </strong>Otherwise, you’ll get less time to complete the assessment</li>
<li aria-level="1">You can take the assessment only on a desktop/laptop with webcam access</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Proctoring Related: </strong></p>
<ul>
<li aria-level="1"> You can play the quiz only on a <strong>desktop/laptop with webcam access</strong></li>
<li aria-level="1"><strong> The quiz will be hosted in full-screen mode</strong></li>
<li aria-level="1">Anything that disturbs the full-screen mode of the assessment is treated as a violation. It may be due to any of the following reasons but not limited to: </li>
<ul>
<li aria-level="2">Tab Switching </li>
<li aria-level="2"> Screen Sharing with anyone </li>
<li aria-level="2"> Clicking on the escape button </li>
<li aria-level="2">Computer going on Sleep (Adjust your power or sleep mode settings)</li>
<li aria-level="2">Windows or Browser or any Application specific notifications (Put them No Disturb Mode or switch them off while the assessment is on)</li>
<li aria-level="2">Anything else that may result in disturbing the full-screen mode </li>
</ul>
</ul>
<ul>
<li aria-level="1">The assessment doesn’t get terminated on the first such instance. Only repeated violations will result in disqualification and termination of the assessment immediately. Your face will be verified before the start of the assessment from the photo that was captured during registration. </li>
<li aria-level="1">Your face may be verified again during the assessment</li>
<li aria-level="1">Your face will be constantly detected and violations will be tracked while the assessment is on. Violations might be </li>
<ul>
<li aria-level="2">Two-faced in front of the camera, </li>
<li aria-level="2">The different person taking the assessment than the one who registered</li>
<li aria-level="2">No one in front of the camera </li>
<li aria-level="2">And many more such violations are tracked and reported </li>
</ul>
</ul>
<p><strong>Key Instructions: </strong></p>
<ul>
<li aria-level="1">You can access the quiz from the <a href="https://fg7syt3j.r.ap-south-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Funstop.com%2Fhackathon%2Fflipkart-grid-40-software-development-challenge-flipkart-grid-40-flipkart-348170%3FrefId=MLwJx0Y4/1/01090181b962685d-20d201fe-6311-446d-aeb7-87d2af6ff54b-000000/aOrgv1z6wh8KFdyT79f5OVcsknQ=57" target="_blank" rel="noopener" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://fg7syt3j.r.ap-south-1.awstrack.me/L0/https:%252F%252Funstop.com%252Fhackathon%252Fflipkart-grid-40-software-development-challenge-flipkart-grid-40-flipkart-348170%253FrefId%3DMLwJx0Y4/1/01090181b962685d-20d201fe-6311-446d-aeb7-87d2af6ff54b-000000/aOrgv1z6wh8KFdyT79f5OVcsknQ%3D57&source=gmail&ust=1656759056955000&usg=AOvVaw25HP-TJRrVR-khtTW7lx_r">opportunity page</a> itself where you registered</li>
<li aria-level="1">You'll see <strong>a button </strong>in the respective round if you've registered to initiate the quiz</li>
<li aria-level="1">You'll have to submit answers to all the questions </li>
<li aria-level="1">While you are taking the assessment, your answers and the time of their submission are also tracked by the system question-wise </li>
<li aria-level="1">You <strong>will not be able</strong> to browse through the questions</li>
<li aria-level="1">You <strong>will not be able</strong> to modify your answers before finally submitting your answers</li>
<li aria-level="1">There is no negative marking for this quiz </li>
<li aria-level="1">Any participant resorting to unfair practices will be directly disqualified from the challenge </li>
<li aria-level="1">All decisions in the matter of eligibility, authenticity & final judgment will be with Unstop and Flipkart </li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Please note that if any student is found resorting to unfair means by sharing questions on any social media platform(s) will be disqualified immediately.</strong></p>
<p>Regards,<br />Flipkart Team</p>
                                                        </div>

*****************************************************

Dear All,

Mr. Atin Gayen  who is working with the guidance of Dr. M Ashok Kumar will
be presenting his research seminar on 09th May 2022 at 10:00 AM through
online mode.


*Title: Generalized Maximum Likelihood Estimations on Power-law
Distributions         Projection Theorems, Principle of Sufficiency, and
Cramer-Rao Bounds*

Date & Time: 09th May 2022 at 10:00 AM
Venue: Zoom meeting details are given below
Meeting ID:  987 5648 0594
Passcode:   361856
Meeting link:
https://zoom.us/j/98756480594?pwd=aHdmQlNlZjBYeURRR29mQUl0djJkdz09

The abstract of the research seminar is attached herewith.

All are cordially invited.


-- 
Thank you
Regards,

Office of the Dean (Academics)
IIT Palakkad

*****************************************************

Dear all,

   1. The form will accept responses till *11:59 pm on July 25, 2022*.
   2. Only one person needs to fill out the form for the room (among the
   roommates).
   3. You need to first discuss it with your preferred roommate and only
   then fill out the form. If any person fills out the form without discussing
   it with the other roommate, and if later there is any ambiguity or clash,
   the person who has filled out the form without discussing it with the other
   roommate will be given a room on a random basis.
   4. The person who fills out the form will have to fill in the details of
   both the roommates.
   5. Choose your roommates only *among students of CSE and EE.*
   6. Those who do not fill out the form will be assigned roommates on a
   random basis.

*form link for boys
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSc3K3TjeKeDFbDm9pqbBspmEdMe3TbwIB83o47Djy-smlLR1A/viewform?usp=pp_url>.
*

*form link for Girls
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdtMGLofcUjvTqWQAldouyXx2JFKtfIvIjMxR8EHwVDetN5Cg/viewform?usp=pp_url>.*

*NOTE: *This form is not for specifying a preferred room; it is solely for
filling out the occupants' information. In the upcoming days, information
on room assignments will also be sent.

With Regards,
--
Himanshu Kumar,
Secretary, Hostel Affairs,
Indian Institute of Technology Palakkad
Ph: +91 8235861628
Email: sec_hostel@smail.iitpkd.ac.in
